This hotel was a perfect quick stay for us! We requested an early check-in and drove up early as we were going to the Disneyland park. They allow you to “check in” via the email you receive the morning of, and at this time you can add your arrival time and they will do their best to accommodate you. That feature worked out great for us as we were able to check in to the hotel, park our car, and get our things settled in the room before we took a quick five minute Uber ride to the park. Please note there is a fee
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the nice review! We are glad you loved our amenities. We are also pleased that the room was big enough to accommodate your whole family and you were able to take advantage of our surrounding area. We look forward to having you stay with us for your next Disneyland venture!

Summary: Although the Hyatt has not provided the greatest customer service as we’ve experienced in years past, we continue to enjoy the hotel’s beautiful upgrades, immaculate rooms and comfortable beds and bedding. For the price, I’d only ask that the Hyatt take the initiative to better support breastfeeding mothers and infants. That would mean the world to a lot of families.
Manager Response: We apologize that the customer service was not up to standard. Please know that this is not typical of our property. We will make sure to take your comments to heart and do everything we can to improve. We look forward to your next stay in the Anaheim area.

Summary: Stay here anytime I’m in Anaheim!  Keep up the great service.  Convenient Walgreens next door.  Breakfast is quick and perfect at the hotel.  Easy walk to Disneyland.  Starbucks attached to hotel.  Perfect for families or just solo.
Manager Response: Thank you so much carternavy! Hearing about your great experience at our hotel is so wonderful, and we will share your kind words with our staff. We hope to see you again soon for more fun!

Summary Heading: Convenient stay by Disneyland with some areas for improvement
Summary: The hotel is only a 10-minute walk to Disneyland, has a Walgreens and Starbucks on the ground level, and is within walking distance to a number of restaurants.  You can't beat the convenient location.  The rooms are modern and well-furnished and front desk service was very friendly.  We were unexpectedly upgraded to a larger room which our group very much appreciated!  The buffet breakfast was also very good!  We did however, notice a few things which were not expected of a Hyatt hotel.  One of the cleaning ladies was very disrespectful to our group, staring us down as she was cleaning the foyer.  She seemed to take offence that some of us had to walk through an area that she had just cleaned when it would have been the only area that we could walk through.  She just stopped
Manager Response: I am disappointed to read these issues you encountered while staying with us. I am sorry that occurred and created not the most pleasant experience with us. Please know I will follow up with my team. Thank you for letting us know.

Summary: Clean rooms, nice breakfast buffet, nice bar, Starbucks around the corner, Walgreens around the corner, good convenience for the price! Would recommend if you’re going to Disneyland and don’t mind the walk.
Manager Response: What wonderful things you had to say about your experience! To say you would recommend us shows how good of an experience you had and we cannot thank you enough for letting us know.

Summary Heading: My favorite hotel for Disneyland. Gro
Summary: This is my favorite hotel when I'm visiting Disneyland because of the clean, spacious, comfortable rooms, the friendly/helpful hotel staff, the wonderful breakfast and the bonus is the Starbucks and Walgreens directly next to the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you again for your wonderful review and we look forward to having you stay with us again when you are in the Anaheim area!

Summary Heading: VERY GOOD HOTEL CLOSE TO DISNEYLAND
Summary: I had a wonderful 6-day stay at Hyatt House with my family. Staff was really nice and breakfast is very good. You find Starbucks, Wallgreens and restaurants just below the hotel, which is really convenient. I totally recommend to families with children.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful feedback Thiago F! We appreciate all the kind words about our property. We're so glad you enjoyed all our amenities, and we work hard everyday to offer our guests the best possible service! Please come back to visit.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay with all the amenities you need after a long day at the Disney parks
Summary: I stayed here for 2 days and I had a nice experience. There is no Disney View by the way since the hotel only has 5 floors. You will rather get a Pool View and maybe its quieter since the room facing the street at night can be a bit noisy. The bathrooms and overall room cleanliness is pretty good. There is a Walgreens and CVS close to the property and you can stock up your mini fridge with any beverages of your choosing and some snacks/sandwiches.    The only downside is that there is no shuttle service to the Disney parks. It is a good 15-20 min walk and uber will cost you $6-8.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind review. We greatly appreciate the consideration in choosing to stay with us. We look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary Heading: Second time staying here...and it's still great!
Summary: We stayed at Hyatt House in September 2018, and then again in September 2019, and it's still great!  Clean, quiet, comfortable rooms. The beds are comfortable. The staff are friendly, polite and super helpful.  One day I had a printing issue in the business centre, and they were more than happy to help out. The cleaning staff are also really polite, and do a great job at cleaning the rooms.  The location is great - 10 minute walk from Disneyland.  I've stayed in a number of other hotels in the Anaheim area, and Hyatt House has become our go-to hotel as it's not just great, it's consistently great.  You know what to expect when you stay there.
Manager Response: robotexplosion, our team would like to sincerely thank you for recognizing our team's dedication to our guests. We hope to be able to provide another exceptional stay for you and your family in the future!

Summary: We had a wonderful stay at the new Hyatt House at Anaheim Resort. It is conveniently close to Disneyland and has a Walgreen, Starbucks, and Blaze Pizza attached. Devin, Mariana, and Aleesha at the front desk, were extremely welcoming and informative. They helped make our stay memorable. The rooms were very comfortable and the pool was great. I highly recommend this property.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments with us. Thanks for the great compliments about our Front Desk  Associates, Devin, Mariana and Aleesha! I will share your feedback with them. We hope that we will see you again when you return to Anaheim!

Summary: We loved our stay very much.  The staff was very nice and accommodating.  The rooms were clean and the beds very comfortable.  We also liked how close we were to Disneyland and many restaurants as well.  Overall we would reccomend Hyatt House very highly.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive feedback Heididisneygirl! WE appreciate you taking the time to write such kind words about our hotel and amenities, and hope you decide to stay with us again on your next Anaheim trip. We'd love to host you again!

Summary: We were made to feel welcome from the moment we checked in and I don't think we ever left or arrived at the hotel each day without a friendly hello from someone. It's an excellent location for a Disney stay. Only a very short walk to Disney, a Walgreens just outside, 7-Eleven across the road, Starbucks and the excellent Blaze Pizza downstairs also. And of course ihop next door. We chose the Hyatt for the location and for the rooms with bunks for the family, but we got more than we expected. Overall it was exceptional value for money.   Of special note, our room was kept exceptionally clean and we came home on day one to find all our toiletries etc all nicely tidied up and arranged in the bathroom like it was in a shop window, it was a wonderful caring touch and service above and
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the nice review!  We are also pleased that the room was big enough to accommodate your whole family and you were able to take advantage of our surrounding area. We look forward to having you stay with us for your next Disneyland venture!

Summary Heading: Perfect place for a Disneyland vacation
Summary: We had a great experience here! The location is fantastic (10 minute walk to Disneyland entrance). The breakfast included with our stay was tasty and had a lot of variety. Every staff member we spoke with was friendly and helpful. The gym facility was nice, and it was convenient to have a full fridge and kitchen area in the room. We will definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the nice feedback! We greatly appreciate all of the kind words and we will make sure to pass along your words of praise to our staff. We would love to have you come stay with us again next time you are in town. Thank you

Summary Heading: Great Hotel Within Walking Distance with Great Breakfast.
Summary: This hotel was more than we expected. We have stayed at Hyatt before but this was nice and clean. Breakfast was awsome and the walk to Disnelyand is just right. Parking is nice and secure. There is even a Starbucks attatched to the hotel for the coffee lovers. The rooms were nice and looked new. No complaints about staff. Excellent experience overall.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I look forward to staying here for return visits to Disneyland. They are very conveniently located near the park - I believe less than half a mile from the park. We walked to and from every day. It is a very pleasant walk. Now, on to the facility itself.  Gabriel and his staff at the Hyatt House were AMAZING! The rooms are very nice and clean. The pool is so nice and located outdoors the roof. It felt very private. The laundry room was large and clean. It proved very useful. Now for the bar/kitchen/dining room. I was totally blown away. They take gluten/food allergies VERY seriously. The food and drinks were fantastic. I'm sure I have forgotten to praise someone or something - Sorry. Short story long is that this place blew my mind. I hope you visit and have the same experience!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Definitely worth checking out other options when visiting Disney for a week. 1st stay was superb. Second stay had us wanting to find a different hotel.  We requested a View Room 2 months in advance of booking. Nothing was available until the last two nights of our 5 night stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My adult daughters and I stayed for 4 nights and the reviews are accurate: 12-15 minute walk to Disneyland main gates, 20 minutes to Down Town Disney, super nice, clean, well laid out rooms ( we had 2 queens and the kitchenette) which had ample room, comfortable beds, a safe, a fridge, microwave, sink, plates etc , two burner stove and even a dish washer!! The pool was an average size with lots of chairs and even a portable seasonal bar run by a bartender although I thought prices at this bar were super high.  Breakfast was included and provided: scrambled eggs, sausage, shredded potatoes, waffles or French toast, English muffins, toast, porridge, yogurt, melons cubed and bowls of bananas, oranges or apples, coffee, tea, juice etc. real plates and cutlery are super smart, better
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our stay for our family of 6 was amazing!  Great service and great room as always!  The room was clean and when we needed anything extra, the hotel staff was quick and attentive to all of our needs.  As a Hyatt Rewards member, I was treated very well.  And the breakfast was great!  Just wish there were more lines open in the breakfast area as it got a bit crowded.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Wonderful stay at Hyatt House!  We enjoyed a peaceful sleep in a beautifully appointed room. Customer service was excellent and pool area is very relaxing!  Would highly recommend!  Guaranteed to enhance your vacation!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had an early check in. The phone app sped up the process. I liked the underground parking with elevator access. No parking valets to deal with, or tip. Breakfast was excellent. Easy walk to Disneyland about 10 to 15 minutes. Room was quiet for sleeping and the bed was comfortable.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Our go to hotel when visiting disneyland
Summary: We love staying at Anaheim hyatt house. Everyone is always so welcoming and nice. The rooms are clean, the breakfast is great and it's only a 15 min walk to disneyland. Great hotel to book if visiting Disneyland or convention!
Manager Response: Thank you for posting a review about our hotel. We greatly appreciate your feedback.

Summary: 1.The AC output air hit the bed directly and bounces off the bathroom walls and hits you in the face, nowhere to turn to avoid it. As if I am in front of air fan. I adjusted the 1/2 of louvers down but that did not work well with my partner on the other bed. I use the pillow to deflect the air so I can sleep. I did not bother to call building maintenance because there's not much they can do unless they lower the air fan volume lower than what the controller does. 2. The garbage can under the sink won't allow the door to close fully. I was hoping the room service will report it. He or She did not, but did unclogged the drain of the bathtub so water will drain properly and not stand on 3" deep of water.  Overall, the room is very comfortable.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect location for a Disney day.
Summary: This was the perfect location for a Disney visit for our family. Disneyland front gate is a 10-15 minute walk. We loved the breakfast, the room, the pool (great hot tub).  We also loved the convenience of the 24/7 Walgreens on the ground floor.
Manager Response: Thank you again for your review and we look forward to when you can stay with us again when you are back in Orange County.

Summary: We normally stay at the Grand California, because we are DVC members, but this was an unexpected family emergency and we were out of points. With that being said, this hotel came in handy, especially at the last minute. This Hotel was clean and convenient with a good central location, and even better if you are visiting Disneyland. The service was great, and the breakfast comes in handy. The rooms facing the Disney resort, can be a bit loud at times so choose inside facing if that is a concern. The convenience of having a small kitchen was great, and having a Starbucks and Walgreens downstairs was very nice. We will be back.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the nice review! We are glad you loved our amenities and especially the breakfast. We are also pleased that the room was big enough to accommodate your whole family and you were able to take advantage of our surrounding area. We look forward to having you stay with us for your next Disneyland venture!

Summary: very nice place to stay and very clean, with a pretty good breakfast and I love that there is a Starbucks and the Walgreens just a minute walk away makes everything so easy and its a short walk to Disney
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing our hotel on TripAdvisor. We greatly appreciate your feedback on your experience with us.

Summary: This is a perfect hotel for couples to families. Location is the best in Anaheim, I spent over a month looking online for accommodation for 6 of us and finally picked Hyatt House. My best decision ever. Beautifully clean, new, large rooms, lovely pool, bbq's, spa. Easy parking if you have a car. Reception were the most helpful friendly girls, nothing was a hassle, room service were very quick breakfast simple but all you needed. Walk to Disneyland and at least 10 restaurants and convenience stores 5 mins walk. Could not fault it.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the nice review of our property! As always, we appreciate the consideration in choosing to stay with us and we are pleased that everyone had fun. We look forward to your next Disneyland venture.

Summary: I arrived late in the evening. The check in was quick and I was upgraded as a Discoverist. The room was fairly large with a King bed and a fold out couch. The bed was comfortable. There are plenty of outlets to charge your devices. The bathroom has a large shower and one sink. The shower and amenities are good and the water pressure was strong. I parked in the garage under the hotel and the price was $22 which is in line with other hotels in the area. I would recommend.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just came back from staying 4 nights.  Arrived at the hotel at 10:30 am and our room was ready!  Off to a great start.  Room was very clean and modern.  I felt very safe at the hotel.  Bed was comfortable and plenty of storage in the room.  Nice large,clean breakfast area.  Plenty of food options and it was all good.  Real plates, cups and utensils were a nice touch.  Workers were on top of things with always having plenty of food out and with cleaning up the tables as guests left.   Very pretty pool area on the second floor.  Plenty of lounge chairs and cushioned chairs.  My husband was glad there was a hot tub.  We didn't use the exercise room so no comment on that.  On average it took about 12-13 minutes to walk to Disneyland.  Not a problem in the morning but it was kinda
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Watch your credit card bill for possible duplicate or triple charges
Summary: Upon arrival I gave my credit card for payment of my stay the following day I purchased two two day Disneyland hoppers totaling $560.00 I noticed on my online account that I had been charged twice for the same purchase.  I spoke to the front desk attendant who said the charge would be corrected.  Day three “check out day” I noticed a charge of almost $800.00 again unauthorized for payment of my room.  I contacted the property and was told I would receive call back from management NO CALL BACK.  I contacted ma agent and was told that charge would be fixed and was told of the new payment  of my stay I am now seeing the new charge PLUS old charge that has not been removed per my credit card company.  Incompetent training
Manager Response: We take pride in the service and accommodations we provide to each and every guest, so anything short of a fantastic stay does not live up to the standards that we believe in. I do apologize for the issues you experienced with the billing from your stay. I truly appreciate that you have brought this to our attention. I have notified the appropriate Department Head to address additional training to be sure this doesn't happen again. I sincerely appreciate your feedback. Your comments will help us as we continually work to improve our guest experience.

Summary: We were there for a private event and the entire experience was wonderful. Friendly staff. Upgraded our room although it was just our first stay. Would definitely stay again. Even for just a quick weekend get away.
Manager Response: none

Summary: There are various hotels in the area as you'd expect but this seems one of the more modern ones.  We had 5 in a room - 2 bunk beds and a sofa bed in one part of the room (separated by a pocket door) and a double in the other part.  Nice sized bathroom and extra space plus a safe. Obviously this is on the corner with the other hotels for walking distance to the park.  I would say it is a 20 minute brisk walk to the security gates.  Of course - that gets you to the corner so all those hotels would be the same walk - it is slightly longer than it looks. My wife prefered the breakfast to me.  I wasn't keen on the fact there was nothing fresh.  Even most of the fruit was frozen and most yanks can point out frozen Eggo when they see one.  I had to resort to the next door Starbucks for
Manager Response: none

Summary: My stay at the Hyatt house was extraordinary. I’ve been called a needy guest and all my needs were met by the hotel staff. The front desk customer service was exceptional. I had an unusual and unexpected request and Hannah at the front desk was able to meet that need and get the request handled in a timely fashion. From extra covers to drinks at the bar. I really enjoyed my stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this hotel with our 2 kids while enjoying a weekend trip to Disneyland. I am giving this hotel a 5 because of the location, low cost(relative to other hotels near Disneyland), and the great customer service. The staff was great, and we loved that they had complimentary breakfast, this saved us time and $.  The room we had was a suite style with a small kitchen with refrigerator and microwave, and nice island countertop. The one recommendation I would make is to request a room on the top floor, we heard noise during the night from another guest above us.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Functional Hotel with perfect Disney Location
Summary: Stayed in the hotel on vacation with 2 children.  Prompt, friendly check-in after long trip form UK. We took the bunk-bed room, which in reflection was a mistake, a rather narrow oddly shaped room that was too small for 4 people. Room is functional with what we call a 'deep-fried' feel - lots of dirt resistant browns!  We stayed for 3 nights ( checking out a night early to continue our road trip ).  We didn't unpack our cases as the room bizarrely has a single 1 foot wide hanging space.  It was probably the first hotel that seemed determined to not makeup the childrens beds everyday. Suspect it was because they were pretty tricky to make in such a confined space.  Used the pool couple of days, a barman and pop-up bar appeared on the Sunday which was great, but only one day of 3.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I’m normally a Marriott person but ended up here as a last minute trip.  The young lady at the front desk, Alexa, was very sweet and welcoming. Even though I was a bit flustered from my trip it didn’t faze her and she was very friendly the entire time. That’s good customer service. It doesn’t seem like they have a full time bartender but Richard the Asst Gen Mgr stepped in and made me the best pomegranate margarita I’ve ever had. He was very attentive and made me feel very welcome from the moment I walked in. The whole staff was really nice, come to think of it. The pool area was a little small but clean and well-kept. I didn’t mind so much as I had it for a few hours to myself while the families were at Disneyland. Overall, nice place. Would stay again if I needed to.

Summary: We recently stayed at this hotel while visiting family in the area. It is conveniently located near Disneyland. It is also in walking distance to the Garden Walk, lots of restaurants and a Walgreens is just steps away. This hotel is beautiful, safe, well maintained and comfortable to stay at with children. Breakfast was delicious and the pool is clean. I recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to spend a few days in the area. We enjoyed our time there and will definitely return. Thank you Richard AGM and Staff for making our stay memorable.

Summary: I feel this hotel is poorly managed. I saw things in disrepair or cleanliness that should not be occurring at a fairly new hotel. Also my reservation was screwed up and front desk was not helpful and made me fight it out with reservations; wouldn't grant a 1 hour late check out with a sick child; ran my card after I called down and asked them not to as cash was being applied; and then I was double charged on a DEBIT CARD for the stay with a mediocre response to credit it back, causing my bank to return multiple items due to their incompetence.

Summary: Our room was enormous, with 3 big beds, a full kitchen and a large bathroom. It was clean and very close to Disneyland. The value was excellent. Hyatt House is a perfect alternative to more expensive Disneyland hotels.

Summary: Walking distance to Disneyland, though a call-shuttle would be nice, after a long day in the parks. Convenient and friendly. Super clean and awesome hot breakfast everyday. Recommend for anyone coming to Disneyland for a bit.

Summary: Room a little small for 4 (never mind 6). Clean room though pool area could do with a clean. Expensive parking and $50 charge per hour for late check out. Mix up at checkout regarding payment sorted after showing proof of prepayment.

Summary: We have stayed at the hotel before last year and really enjoyed it so we came back this year.  The service is the best you could ask for. Anytime we come to Disneyland we always stay there and will continue to stay there

We also received complimentary WiFi due to being members as well and with no minimum number of devices which was great cuz the whole family has their devices to connect. Summary: This is a perfect hotel for families visiting Disneyland, the family rooms with seperate rooms for kids with bunk beds makes it comfortable for a longer stay. Coffees, teas & juice all incl.  The hotel is walking distance to Disneyland theme parks and downtown Disney. Lots of restaurants within walking distance including Cheesecake factory. There is a Walgreens and Starbucks in the same building which is very convenient for snacking and good coffee. The hotel has a pool area which we did not use. And the hotel offers free parking!  Overall great choice and we will stay here again.

The bus is unpredictable and unfriendly at night if you have small children.  The bus driver wouldn’t let us board at 10 pm as we had a 2 year old with us.  This of course has nothing to do with the wonderful staff and wonderful breakfast the hotel offers.

We turned it up because we had to keep some things cool and it took a full 24 hours to cool down. We have stayed here before, 3 years ago, and LOVED it. I don't know if the hotel has been poorly managed or if we just got an unlucky room. We liked being so close to Disneyland. Having complimentary breakfast is wonderful. They have an underground car park which is approx $20 plus tax. Staff at lobby are friendly and helpful. There is a pool on the second floor and a small bar. The bartender needs to work on customer service as he wasn’t very welcoming nor helpful to recommend on some cocktails.  Rooms with two queen beds are spacious. Downside, is the pull out sofa bed being close to the door which makes it awkward to come in and out of the room. Very tight space. The sofa bed itself can fit three children so I had the queen bed to myself 🙂

Summary: Perfect Location (crossroads) ART stops, Dining, etc. bring above a Starbucks, Blaze Pizza and Pharmacy a plus... breakfast large selection of average quality.  Staff friendly and helpful. Was able to get Early check-in and store bags and use facilities as couldn’t get late checkout.

We bought tickets at 140+$ as it was a memorial weekend .  Breakfast area is vast , good & won't feel conjusted. Some waffles, hot breakfast , nothing great but nothing bad. Patch work on the wall is noticeable was 5 minutes late for breakfast was told there is a pancake house next door . lady bartender was really nice , room was almost $300.00 a night parking was taken by Walgreen patrons would not recommend this hotel .

I'm so sorry to hear you missed out on our wonderful breakfast, as we always voluntarily extend our breakfast hours at least 30 minutes past the close time of 9:30am. Once the food has been out for a certain length of time, as much as we welcome late comers to eat, we are mandated to remove the food for both safety and health quality by a certain time. In regards to the parking, it does concern me that you felt your parking charge was taken by a Walgreen patron, as all parking charges are charged to the guestroom folio and not taken individually outside. If you would like to share your parking experience with me further so I can research it, please feel free to email me at debbie.plueger@hyatt.com.

Summary Heading: Hyatt House Saves the Day (or night)!
Summary: We were booked at a hotel near Disneyland only to find on arrival at 9:30 PM that the hotel had overbooked. HH was near and had vacancy.  The staff was amazing, helpful and caring.  Our new Disney home!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Service wasnt very good.  Skip the free breakfast it wasnt very good and gave my whole family stomach ache.  AC vents no matter how you adjust them blow right on you, so sleep wasnt the greates .    Only good point was it was walking distance to Disney.  And parking was a nice underground garage.
Manager Response: We take great pride in the service and accommodations we provide to each and every guest, so anything short does not live up to the standards that we believe in. We are sorry that we did not exceed your expectations with the hotel service. Your comments will help us as we continually work to improve our guest experience. You are a valued guest and your feedback is sincerely appreciated.

Summary Heading: Clean and Modern Hyatt House!  10-15 minute walk to Disney!
Summary: This was our first stay at the Hyatt House across from Disneyland.  Customer service by Shannon and Hannah was EXCELLENT.  Upon arrival, we were all tired from a long drive.  Shannon in particular was wonderful and her incredible energy and service helped to recharge us all.  Our room was clean and spacious and I was pleasantly surprised by the full kitchenette!  I would not hesitate to book another stay at this hotel!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place, 10 minute walk from Disney
Summary: Very clean upscale place to stay while on vacation at Disneyland.  We love the fact that it was only a 10 minute walk from Disney.  The place is very clean.  We were able to charge our Tesla at the hotel which is a big plus.  It would be nice if they had more Tesla chargers even in the downstairs garage.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very great place to stay!! Super clean, parking is great and about a 10 min walk to Disneyland!! This hotel had really good breakfast, service and very spacious rooms. I would recommend to anyone who is planning a trip to Disneyland!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location, easy access. Convenient to Disney and other amenities. Great staff. Clean spacious comfortable rooms. Great options for family’s with children and disabilities. Hyatt Place is a great Hyatt brand and lives up to the Hyatt reputation for excellence.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If your visiting Disneyland you must stay here 😊. The staff is the most enjoyable part. At all times we are greeted attended to and made to feel welcomed. I choose this place every time we come to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our stay was very pleasant and enjoyable.  Rosemary in the dining area and Hannah and Olivia from the front desk made our trip extra special. Rosemary was all smiles and super nice even though she was extremely busy in the dining area. I highly recommend this hotel and staff.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great overall quality and experience. The rooms were clean and attention to detail was good. Restrooms were extremely clean and beds were comfortable.  The breakfast was delicious and the kitchen crew were really courteous. The crew manager Gabriel was attentive. Great place to stay plus really close to the Disney Parks.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great work everyone at Hyatt House Anaheim
Summary: This is our favorite place to stay in Anaheim. Gabriel and his team do a great job. We always try to stay at this hotel when it's reasonably priced. We visit Anaheim often since we have a Disneyland passholder pass and this is by far our favorite hotel. Thank you Gabriel and Ray for the great stay and the rest of the team included. By far the best hotel in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beware of leaving valuables in room
Summary: At first we were excited to be coming to Cali for our first family trip to Disneyland. We booked a 7-night stay didn’t mind paying the $350 deposit which is $50 for every night we’re here or the extra $20 per day for parking which they only charge b/c Disney charges to park but please understand there’s free breakfast every morning. Plus they have nice family suites or suites with kitchens in as well. And it’s only a good 10 minute walk to the front gates of Disneyland. All that gets them 4 stars but this is where things turned sour for us & why I gave 2 stars overall. After being out in the city for several hours & having not been to Disneyland just yet, we decided to go purchase souvenirs such as shot glasses, shirts, cups & hats to our surprise the shot glasses were stolen.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights on our 1st trip to California. We enjoyed the space in the family suite, the breakfast each morning, and the hot tub. It's an easy walk to Walgreens and of course, Disneyland. We were even able to purchase our tickets at the front desk.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the perfect hotel for those wanting quality but on somewhat of a budget.  Rooms are updated and clean.  The included breakfast was much better than I expected.  Food was very fresh and there was a good selection for an included buffet.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Once again this hotel was amazing..the location is a bonus because it is walking distance to the Disneyland entrance. The hotel has a Starbucks and a Walgreens connected which I find these very convient.  Kind staff and ease of check in/ check out keeps me coming back.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Average room but free breakfast.  Easy walk to Disney
Summary: The room served it purpose, free breakfast for the family and close to Disney. The room was just average and the hallways need some serious updating.  I advise not leaving luggage there after checkout.  Our luggage was placed behind the counter in full view the whole time we were gone and when collecting our bags, the wrong bags were given to us even with our tags.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Hyatt Property close to Disneyland
Summary: The competition among hotels close to Disneyland is an unbelievably competitive one. There are other properties that offer large rooms, various dining options, and a location close to the park's entrance. This one is close to the top of the list, thanks to its generous size in its suites and a nice reception area that offers a great space for breakfast in the morning. The staff is kind and attentive to your needs; as an Explorist, I was granted a room upgrade upon arrival to the property and free water. The room was also kept clean and in good order during our stay. The walk to Disneyland isn't lengthy, but do keep in mind there are a few properties that are right across the street from the parks available at cheaper rates. Still, if you're an active World of Hyatt member, this
Manager Response: none

Summary: Love how the blinds travel in a track so there is no curtain cracks to leak light. Only issue was the closet door which slams shut quickly on its own, which could be a hazard to little ones and the elderly. Loved the room, very modern and clean. The room was on the street side, so it was a little noisy until about 10pm. After that, I had no trouble sleeping.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I recently stayed at the Hyatt House Anaheim as a client (room 455) from Tuesday May 21st to Friday may 24th 2019. During this stay I contracted SCABIES a parasite that is highly contagious who’s symptoms include extreme itch and rash. As soon as this was diagnosed on Monday May 27th I reached out to the Hyatt House Anaheim to alert them of the situation and to make sure that measures would be taken to avoid any further contamination. I spoke at this time with manager Joshua Teregis, cc’d on this email, who told me that measures will be taken immediately to have an expert in decontamination come to assess the problem and obviously destroy the parasite present. He told me that I would be informed as soon as such measure would be in motion. I have spend the past few days receiving
Manager Response: none

Summary: When making reservation I was never told we had to pay for parking until we got there. I mentioned to the front desk lady and she stated that since Disney charges for parking that’s why they charge as well.
Manager Response: My sincere apology that you were not informed of the parking charges at our hotel. I'm not sure how you made your reservation; online or on the phone, but if it were on the phone, then Hyatt Reservations should definitely be informing you of this charge. As with all hotels in the Disney area, there is a parking charge for overnight guests.

Summary: After a busy day and night of amusement parks...returning to our spacious and comfortable room each night was a comforting highlight!  Both the hotel and guest rooms are clean,  safe,  spacious,  modern, comfortable  and near Disneyland. The daily hearty complimentary breakfast was the added bonus! Will definitely stay here again!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel staff do a great job and are all very friendly.  Had an enjoyable stay and was able to get to Disneyland early because of the proximity and the breakfast.  I will be staying here again next year.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Category 4 hotel but lacking in some areas. Had to contact front desk multiple times to fulfill our request of extra pillows but the request was not granted until the day after we checked into the hotel. Some dishes  and bowls in kitchen were not thoroughly washed. Food particles were left on some mixing bowls and dishes which were stored in the cabinets.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review and feedback. I sincerely apology for the issues you experienced while staying at our hotel. It appears that additional training is needed in a few departments to make sure we are offering top notch service and cleanliness. This has been discussed with department heads and is being rectified immediately with the appropriate staff members.

Summary: We went down with the family to see the new star wars "land" so this was a one night in-n-out trip. We got 2 rooms, a King for the wife and I and a dual queen room for the moppets. Rooms were adjoining. The hotel is clean, comfortable, our room was quiet... the dual queen room had a nice kitchenette (which we did not use) and a decent sized fridge. The proximity to "The Land" is excellent. The Hyatt house has everything you need and nothing you don't. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
Manager Response: I want to thank you for choosing to stay with us during your quick trip to Anaheim. There are many hotels to choose from and we truly appreciate your patronage. It was a pleasure to serve you and your family, and we hope that we will have the opportunity again in the near future.

Summary Heading: Excellent place for family when visiting Disney
Summary: Good value, rooms with bunks for kids, rooms clean with all the essentials, great staff. Also the breakfast is complete and has something for everyone. CVS nearby and Blaze Pizza for variety and other needs.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location to Disneyland for family of 4!
Summary: Great hotel located close to Disneyland parks (about 2 large blocks 10-15min walk to the gates). It's also right next to  a reasonably sized Walgreens supermarket. The rooms are very modern and have a full kitchen dishwasher stove top but mini bar size fridge which was plenty for us as we ate out most nights. Breakfast was ok nothing flash eggs sausages bacon toast cereal fruit and yogurt and sometimes pastries. My wife is celiac and therefore requireduest gluten free food. On request thr kitchen were able to make gf bread gg pancakes and even gf french toastI wasn't a fan of the styrofoam cups for coffee and tea.  It seems to be quite the norm in California that I've seen so far. Normal crockery would be fine or at least recycled cups perhaps? Parking is under the hotle.and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean and Nice - spacious rooms with kitchen
Summary: I was in town for a competition and the room was very nice and comfortable and had everything I needed in the kitchen. Was a perfect set up for me, would also be great if you were staying as a family to go to Disneyland, plenty of space for kids and 10 minute drive to downtown disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Hyatt House during a vacation with our ten year old granddaughter. Her only compliant was the TV didn't have enough channels. All other services were very accommodating. The room was clean, and there was enough space for us to move around comfortably. The bathroom was clean and had enough towels for our needs. The only thing I felt we needed was an extra comforter on the beds. During the night when the air came on, (we had the temp set at 74) It got very cold.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I love this Hyatt.  Staff is very helpful and patient.  Breakfast is hot and always replenished.  Coffee is good.  Lobby area and breakfast area is very clean.  Our room was clean and everything was in working condition. I stopped coming to Hyatt a long time ago but I decided to give them a try again.  My faith in Hyatt especially this one has renewed my love for Hyatt.  Now I have two events with Hyatt sales group and working on another one in Monterey.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful and kind review. I will definitely share your feedback with our staff. Our staff works so hard to make sure that every guest enjoys their stay, and that we do our best to exceed their expectation. In addition, it is great to hear that you are giving other Hyatt properties a 2nd chance.

Summary: This is a great property to stay at with your family when visiting Disneyland.  It’s walking  distance to the parks and many restaurant options.  The free daily breakfast is good, convenient and a money saver!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Excellent place to stay, drink, eat, swim, and relax. Very close to Disneyland and California Adventure. This was our 4th year in a row staying and we are looking to year 5 next year. Highly recommend this Hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We went to Disneyland and decided to stay here and were glad we did. We got in later than expected and arrived at the suites late-for family with kids 8pm-we hadn't had dinner, kids were hungry & we were so happy to find that they had food service right at the bar that would deliver to a communal dining room. There were lots of choices on the menu for kids and adults alike, the dining area had plenty of room for a party if 10. Then we quickly check in, grab some snack and water bottles from the snack area next to the front desk and up to our rooms. We were very happy that our rooms were as described. We had a one bedroom with living area & kitchen, it was perfect! In the morning we realized there was a STARBUCKS downstairs (caffeine is a must when traveling with kids) as well as
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We will never stay here again
Summary: The food was gross! Also beware there is a daily parking fee $20 and a daily deposit fee $50. I did not see this information when booking my room. I was informed about this information when checking in.
Manager Response: I want to thank you for choosing to stay with us and appreciate the feedback. It appears that your stay did not live up to the expectations that we strive for, and I would appreciate the opportunity to explain in a bit more detail the charges you mentioned. With our location to the Parks and the Anaheim Convention Center, as with most hotels in the area, we do charge a parking fee. We do list this fee on all of the websites in order to inform our guests so they are not surprised with this charge upon arrival. For the $50 fee, this fee is for guarantee of incidentals and is a fee that all hotels authorize, regardless of city or state. We do not actually charge the card, we only authorize $50 and the fee is not actually charged to the card. This authorization does drop off after departure. I hope in explaining the fees that it gives you a better understanding that these fees our industry-wide and not just at our hotel.

Summary Heading: The next best stay near Disneyland stay!
Summary: Short of staying at a Disney hotel, our stay at the Hyatt house was the next best thing! With ample space for four big luggages in our room, a kitchenette, walking distance to Disneyland and Downtown Disney, near 24 hour Walgreens and CVS pharmacy and other places to eat. Front desk- was very accommodating and helpful. Gave us the best options to our inquiries. Big shout out to Shannon who was very helpful to us, especially when we came in between 1-2am. Rooms- PRO: spacious with kitchenette, fits 4 big luggages  in the room  CONS: bedroom  door and bathroom door didn't hit each other when both are opened at the same time. You can hear if the kids in the upstairs bedroom was running or shouting. Breakfast- good hot and cold choices, suggest to switch it up every 2-3 days. Eating
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your recent stay at our hotel. You are a valued guest and we sincerely appreciate your feedback. It does appear that you had a very positive experience while staying at our hotel, however, you gave us a score of a 1 on our review, which is typically a low score. Perhaps, did you wish to give us a 5, which is the score we typically see with a review such as yours. If so, I hope you are able to take the time to revise the score. Thank you so much!

Summary: I will start by saying that the location of this hotel is great! An easy walk to the parks and across the street from some great restaurants. The service and cleanliness of the hotel however were disappointing. Upon arrival we were given an early check in, parking passes and a promise to text us when our room was available. That never happened. Got back to the hotel that night after visiting the park and they had lost our reservation. They were able to find us a different room thank God after taking all of our information for the second time. We have a family of six and got a room that would accommodate us all. We were exhausted from having been at the park all day and wanted to go to sleep just to find out that our hideaway bed had no sheets, pillows, or blankets! I called down
Manager Response: none

Summary: It was a great stay. My only issue is that in the morning if you’re not out of your room by the time the cleaners pass your room it won’t get cleaned for the day.  You must be out of your room fairly early to catch the cleaners.  Although we were always out of our room by 10am it was still too late.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review. My sincere apologies that your room did not get cleaned during your stay. I am bringing your review to the attention of my Housekeeping Director. Typically, once our housekeepers pass a room with a Do Not Disturb sign on the door, they will then return to the room later in the day to see if the sign was removed. It appears that this may not have been the case during your stay. We will certainly review this matter immediately with our housekeeping department.

Summary: Great hotel!  Very clean.  The 1 bedroom suite was very spacious and provided a barrier from any hallway noise and was a quiet nights sleep!  Great location to the park - about a 10 minute walk or $6 Lyft ride.  Friendly staff.  The included breakfast was okay, it was hot and provided some variety.  Close proximity to Starbucks and IHOP.  Loved that Walgreens was so close.  The price was a bit higher than some hotels in the area, but for what we got I thought was a great price.  We didn't do any cooking but having the kitchen was wonderful and the full size fridge offered lots of space for our leftover food, which we were able to reheat for a couple meals.  Highly recommended hotel!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Of all of the places I've stayed over the last few years, the "complimentary internet" is a joke.  I've run speed tests from the room having speeds measuring in the KB not MB!  I'm not joking one bit.  Imagine my surprise when I logged into the WiFi here and get a solid 10 MB and down!  The room itself is very nice and clean.  customer service is over the top.  I'll definitely come back here.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very happy to stay here, highly recommended
Summary: We stay at 550-sq ft suite and will definitely come back! We have 2 adults and 1 toddler for Memorial Day weekend at Disneyland. Room is clean, stylish and spacious with an awesome view. House host is friendly and helpful. The request for baby crib and blankets gets fulfilled very quickly. Hot breakfast every morning with great deal of choices. Underground garage is bright and delicate, with easy access to room and lobby and cart to unloading luggage. The only downside is walking to Disneyland could take a while(about 2 blocks away). Though it worths the walking for this outstanding facility and service. Great memory for this trip. Highly recommended for a family vacation
Manager Response: none

Summary: I made a reservation on a well known website to this hotel. After leaving I noticed I was charged more then the website said I was going to be charged. Also every other flush on the toilet the flapper would come apart on the one side and the toilet would constantly run
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review. I try to make sure that every website has our correct information, as it is not our intention to hide any fees from our guests. If possible, could you email me directly at debbie.plueger@hyatt.com to let me know which website you booked your reservation. I would definitely want to have any errors corrected immediately. Also, if you could include the room number that you stayed in, as we would want to have our maintenance team fix any issues related to the toilet. Thank You!

Summary: Stayed here the night before transferring to a Disney hotel for a trip to Disneyland. Hotel is in good shape, can walk to Garden Walk, can walk to Disneyland (probably 10-15 min walk). Starbucks just outside the hotel as well as a Walgreens. Good Hyatt beds. Breakfast was fine with decent variety including eggs and bacon, lots of table space and staff was good about clearing dishes away. We were on the lower floor though and could hear the music from the store under us until like midnight so bring ear plugs in case you get stuck on a lower floor (that’s why it’s 4/5 rating). Despite that I would return.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review. I have to say this is the first time that we have heard about the loud music coming from Walgreens. As we do not own or operate the store, we were not aware of how the music may disturb our guests. I will definitely have our hotel management discuss this with the store manager. Thank you for making us aware of this noise issue.

Summary: I recently stayed here for a medical conference and had such a great experience that I wanted to write a review.  I base a lot of my hotel/vacation choices based off TA reviews so I hope this is helpful for others. The check in process was seemless. Joey helped me at the front desk and he was very friendly, helpful and accomodating.  My room was ready right then.  I really appreciated that as I needed to drop my things and hustle over to the conference.  The room was large, comfortable and clean. It had a mini fridge and plenty of storage.  The bed was comfortable and the shower water pressure was great. My only complaint was that my upstairs neighbor started stomping around at 12am.  The daily breakfast was good. The fruit choices were fresh and of good quality.  They
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect for business and family travel
Summary: Stayed here for a conference at Anaheim convention center—easy, short walk to the event, lots of coffee shops, drugstores, and great restaurants nearby, and I can easily see how I would stay here with my husband and 4-year-old for our first trip to Disneyland soon as well.   Lots of both biz travelers and families here. Suites available with 2 queen beds or a king, a room partition, and a queen sleeper sofa behind the partition, full kitchenette. Miserable closet though—too small and stuffy. Rooms are stuffy as well—no opening windows or vents in the rooms.  No in-room mini-bar, but a good full bar with a great food menu downstairs in lobby (no room service, but selection is great to take back up to your room). Small mini-mart for snacks, drinks (alcoholic and non), and
Manager Response: none

Summary: We chose this hotel based on Good Reviews, Proximity to Disney & Complimentary Full Breakfast. There were 10 of us & we reserved 3 separate rooms. Upon check-in we were notified that there had been a leak & we were upgraded to a corner suite. What they didn’t tell us however, is that directly next to us & across from one of our other rooms, was constant loud construction starting daily around 7:30 am possibly earlier. Not sure if it was a result of the leak, but starting on the first morning we woke up to a horrific Sewer smell emanating from our bathroom, so bad we could hardly use or get ready in there, without gagging. We notified the staff, they attempted to clean the drains, it lessened the smell but did not fix the problem. Management never followed up to see if the
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your honest feedback and review. It is disheartening to hear the issues you experienced during your recent stay with us. Unfortunately, the hotel did experience a major leak which has caused one whole wing of our hotel to be closed off. It sounds like this contributed to the smell you experienced. Luckily, the issue regarding the smell has been rectified in the hotel. I will be bringing your review to our staff meeting to discuss with the management team how we can approach the interaction with our guests differently when they've experienced negative issues and how the problem can be resolved with a more positive outcome. My sincere apologies that your stay with us did not meet your expectations, as it definitely did not meet the high standards we set for ourselves. We will take what you've shared and definitely approve upon it. I hope the next time you are in Anaheim, that you will give us another opportunity to exceed your expectations.

Summary: Nice place , stuff very friendly and very clean. They clean our room even for the last night. We left at 6 am but still nice go to bed after long day in spollessly clean room. Our room was 514 and thats probably as good as it can get for this place. We were able watch the fireworks and park ligts. Some rooms facing the pool and thats not what we like.Hot tube such a relieve after parks and pool for kids.We like Hyatt hotels, so far all very good.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I am a hyatt member and always stay at hyatt. This was a family vacation. My son and daughter-in-law had never stayed at Hyatt in California. They will now. Staff is very friendly,rooms are excellent,pool and jacuzzi relaxing. Barbecued some steaks and had dinner in our room. 10 minute walk to Disneyland. Fantastic stay
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice hotel. Close to the parks. Excellent free breakfast every morning with a good selection of hot food.  Also many dining choices close to the hotel.  Rooms were clean and we had a great view of the fireworks from our room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Close to the park, comfortable beds. Faced the road but noise was not noticeable. Staff incredibly friendly and helpful. Nice to be near Starbucks and Walgreens. Lots of tables available during complimentary breakfast.
Manager Response: none

Summary: There isn’t enough good things I can say about our stay at this hotel. We received an awesome room upgrade to a kitchen suite at check in. The hotel is immaculate. When you’re staying you’ll notice that it seems like the floors in the lobby are always either freshly cleaned or being cleaned. The location is a bit farther than some of the “across harbor” hotels nearby, but the hotel itself is so worth the little extra walk, and it’s not that far. The pool and jacuzzi are awesome and open til 10 to soak those tired Disney bones. The staff is simply stellar. I can’t overstate this. One morning my wife and I came down for breakfast just a bit after they’d put everything away. The gentleman who appeared to be in charge of the breakfast went in back and made plates for us and brought
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: close to disneyland, thats it..... average, overpriced
Summary: lumpy beds, dark small rooms, starbucks and pizza downstairs nice. staff is average, not too helpful or caring. morning buffet is only ok, because its free, dirty tables, cold food. location is very close to disney land that is best part of this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Hotel with Large Rooms and Great Breakfasts
Summary: The title says it all.  The rooms are very large and well designed, bigger than some bachelor apartments.  Ours was called “Expanded Studio Kitchen Suite”. Very clean rooms and lobby areas.  Comfy beds. The only change I would make is to put a mirror in the bathroom entry way instead of a not useful framed print.  Helpful staff.  Breakfasts were plentiful and tasty with lots of variety. The Portside Blend coffee is better than the regular roast.  I would definitely stay here again, on a Disney trip, other vacation or business.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is perfect for the price. Nice pool and hot tub. Breakfast in the morning and comfortable beds. Very close to Disneyland.        There is a CVS downstairs and an put door mall down the street with great Restaurants. This is our 2nd time staying here.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the place to stay. Staff is PRO-FRESH-IONAL and accommodating. Had some flowers delivered for my wife and APRIL at the front desk made sure to help me get them to her on Mother’s Day. Had baby girl feeling real special. Good looking out!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: Our park view room allowed us to watch the nightly fireworks at Disneyland.  The room was well maintained and location was perfect for our recent stay.  Daily buffet breakfast was included with our deal and the kitchen enabled us to cook in our room.  Staff were professional and friendly.  This was  a very positive experience for us.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: BEST free breakfast, suites and walking distance to Disneyland!
Summary: We come to Disneyland several times a year and will not stay anywhere else!  We love the Hyatt House, it is clean, the free breakfast is a full buffet with sausage/bacon, waffles/pancakes, scrambled eggs, fruit, yogurt, bananas foster, cereal, toast etc.  It is a mere block and a half from Disney.  We always get the rooms that have a living room area and kitchen.  We will not stay anywhere else & have even began staying at Hyatt House for our travels elsewhere
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Ideal for a trip to Disneyland
Summary: No better place to stay around Disneyland. Spacious room, great breakfast and just a few minute walk away from there. I was there on a business trip at the Anaheim Convention Center which is just a block away from the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location as is walking distance to Disney with great room options for families, hot buffet breakfast and a wonderful pool area for afternoon breaks. We had the family suite and squeezed 6. Loved!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful feedback and review. I am so glad you enjoyed our Family Suite. They are one of our more popular room types. Kids just seem to love the bunkbeds. Should you return to the area, I hope we are given the opportunity to welcome back your family.

Summary Heading: Great Location for a Disneyland Stay
Summary: Great location for our family’s recent trip to Disneyland. Loved  the free morning breakfast. Also loved that the hotel was right next-door to a Walgreens.. very convenient for snacks during our stay . The front desk clerk was helpful in arranging for a return shuttle from the hotel to the Long Beach airport for our group. We were able to store our luggage while we did a half day at Disneyland, and even went back up to check our room when we realized that we had left one of our phone chargers in the kitchen. Overall, a great stay!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words and feedback from your recent stay. It is always wonderful to hear when our guests enjoyed their stay. We hope to have you return in the future, and next time, I hope that we are able to exceed your expectations and earn 5 stars.

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel every time we have visited Disneyland and we've never been disappointed.  The closeness to the parks (without having to pay the resort price) is such a good deal!  Short walk to the parks...probably about 10-15 minutes max. The service of the employees go above and beyond to meet your needs. The breakfast buffet is great and has many options to chose from. If you are on the 3rd floor and above facing Disneyland park, you should be able to see the fireworks at night. Our room has always been clean with zero issues. And we've never had a noise problem either.  There is a Walgreens located below the hotel which makes it SO convenient! Blaze pizza below the hotel is amazing also. Better than the pizza options located in downtown Disney and in the parks.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words. Our staff works so hard to exceed guest's expectations, and it is nice to hear that feedback from our guests. I will definitely be sharing your review with all of the hotel staff. We look forward to welcoming you back again in the near future.

Summary: This is a solid 4.5 stars rating. Took the family for a 10-day stay at this hotel and glad we did. Super catered toward family with small kids. (You can even borrow a white noise machine!). The EV chargers are a plus though!  The only knock to this property is noice/vibration separation between floors is poor. If there is a heavy footed person on the floor above, you can hear all of that and feel the vibration if you are trying to sleep.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We wanted a roomy apartment for our family which is hard to get while we travelled USA from Australia.   The extended apartment with kitchen was pretty good.  It is designed very weird but it at least gave us some space.  The buffet was ok (being from Australia all USA breakfast are quiet different to what we are use to) but clean and nice.  the best thing about the hotel was the pool and hot tub.  I loved it - super clean and the pool was a great temperature.   The hotel is very large so request a room close to the lift (i wish i did as it is a good walk if your at the other end to the lifts).   They also have a bar and snacks which were great.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland trip with kids
Summary: Rooms are spacious with living room area and kitchen. Well worth it when you have kids. Staff were helpful and accommodating. Free breakfast was awesome. The walk to Disneyland is about 10 minutes depending on how fast you walk. (It’s like 2 long blocks)
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best place to stay if you are going to Disneyland!!!!
Summary: Great place to stay if you are going to visit Disney with family.  This hotel is located just a short walk to disnyland park.  The staff are excellent and they take great care of you.  The manager is great and will help you if you have any concerns. We stayed here for a week and loved every minute of it. The rooms are unbelievably clean!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our daughter turned 13 and so we had a big family celebration. Our entire family stayed at Hyatt House and enjoyed it. Hotel is lovely, conveniently located, and has Starbucks, Blaze Pizza & Walgreen on hotel property. The rooms are very spacious and provide everything you could need. Beautiful pool area on 2nd floor. Free daily hot breakfast Buffett was very good. Customer service was fantastic!  The only reason I gave it 4 stars was the bed. The beds are hard and somewhat uncomfortable. If they’d fix that, I’d give 5 stars. We come to Disneyland a lot and now my family only wants to stay here! Thanks to the staff who made our trip so lovely and enjoyable!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great for family visit to Disney!
Summary: We stayed here for a family Disney trip and it was a great hotel for that purpose.  Pros: - less than 10 min walk to Disney gates - across the street from a newly developing shopping area - breakfast buffet was good  - gym was good; cardio equipment, dumbbells, etc. - pool area was nice - having a kitchen was nice  - loved having a suite - underground parking was convenient  - Starbucks, Blaze Pizza, and Walgreens super close  Cons: - bathroom was pretty basic, door opened out to the bedroom and would not stay open - sofa was cheap, uncomfortable   I would not hesitate to stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is perfectly located near Disneyland and downtown Disney.  Additionally the rooms are spacious with a Kitchenette making it easy with children.  Very nice rooftop pool.    The only reason the score is not excellent is the beds are less comfortable than other Hyatt’s we have stayed at.  Not a deal breaker.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hyatt House at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center
Summary: Great place for Families, good free Breakfast starting at 6:30 am,  10 minute walk to Disneyland & California Adventure entrances, nice second floor pool with food and beverage service, great value for a family.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great place! Location was good for attending the theme parks and breakfast was better than most others we have had. The hotel is very clean, very new, and had everything we needed.  Rooms are nicely appointed and updated.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words. Our staff works very hard to ensure every stay exceeds our guest's expectations. I will be sure to share your wonderful review with our hotel staff. We look forward to the opportunity of welcoming you again in the near future.

Summary Heading: We had to request four times
Summary: We stayed at the hotel for three nights during our first trip to Disney. Myself and my husband are loyal customers of Hyatt and had wonderful experience staying at other locations. I don't usually leave reviews unless absolutely necessary. I think I need to at least bring this to management's attention. On our third day, we called and requested comforter sent to the room. First time that I called was around noon. A hour later I had to call them again cause my kids were waiting for the comforter so they could go to sleep. They later had to sleep with shower towel on.  Three hours later, I called and told them I still didn't get the comforter. I asked them to send it to the room thinking they might forgot because they were busy checking people out. Another two hours went by, I
Manager Response: I want to express my sincere apologies for the service you received during your recent stay. The delay in receiving the comforter is unacceptable and not up to the level of service we normally provide for our guests. As much as our front desk and housekeeping departments were busy, no guest should have to request an item 4 times. I can assure you this is not typical. I will be sharing your review with the Front Desk. Although they may be very busy with our guests, our goal is also to convey warmth and a welcome spirit. I do appreciate your kind words for our housekeeping department. They are a hard-working department, but always kind and friendly with our guests. I can assure you that your comments will be discussed.

Summary: Love this place can’t wait to book our next trip, clean spacious, great value, walkable to Disneyland, great staff, easy check in view of fireworks from 5th floor room second stay just as good as the first!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel provides a fabulous place to stay while visiting Disney. It is perfectly located. We had wonderful service by all the staff.   The rooms were generous in size. The hotel had its own laundry room for families to access which was great as we had been travel long for weeks before arriving. The breakfast is also very family friendly. It also has a small store in the lobby which sells lots of basic bits.  Fantastic family hotel
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at this hotel as it is in a great location if you are going to Disneyland.  Hotel is very clean and modern. The rooms are big, we stayed in a one bedroom queen extended suite. There were 4 of us and it didn’t feel crowded. Would definitley stay here again if heading to Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: OK hotel, there is better choice though.
Summary: Nice room and good breakfast. If you are visiting Disneyland, there are hotels that are much closer at similar price. There is a 0.6 miles walk to the Disney gate, which is a bit too long for little kids but a bit short for cab ride considering wait time. Room a bit noisy from traffic.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This property is walking distance to Disneyland.  The room was clean and large enough for the four of us.  They need to run the pool filter system during the day because I had to clean other people's hair off me several times which forced me out of the pool on two different days.  The breakfast was outstanding.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback on our guestrooms and breakfast during your recent stay with us. I am sorry to hear about your experience while you were swimming in the pool. Our Engineering Director took immediate action, and in fact, the pool filter is being replaced today. We look forward to the opportunity to serve you again should you return to the Anaheim area.

Summary: Clean, large rooms. Easy parking. Parking is 18 bucks, but its clean and well lit. Breakfast good. It's about 3/4 of a mile from Disney gates. Not too bad of a walk.  Staff was friendly and helpful. Would stay here again.

We'll definitely book here again!

Summary Heading: Good value for quality and space
Summary: The rooms include kitchenettes complete with electric stove, dishwasher, microwave, and refrigerator.  The bathroom is spacious.  The room we had also had a sofa bed, totaling three!    This is much nicer than the bare-bones inns that rely on short walking distances to Disneyland for the majority of their business.  This is a four star property that with all fees and parking included, will set you back just about $30 more per night than a dated inn directly across from Disney Way that may have fruit flies and/or ants.   Also, there are plentiful tables for breakfast here.  If you're up for a brisk 10 to12 minute walk to Disneyland and don't mind paying a bit more for a lot more hotel, this is a place to strongly consider!

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for a Disneyland trip
Summary: Great location!  Short walk to Disneyland.  Well laid out, large and extremely clean room.  Parking is $20/night at the hotel, which I didn't know until I arrived.  This should be better advertised.  Buffet breakfast had a nice selection.  Remember people, it's a standard, mid-level hotel breakfast.  If you want to be choosier, go to a restaurant.  LOVED the bar in the lobby.  What a nice perk for a parent after an extremely long day at Disneyland.  I was really disappointed to see how many parents choose to let their kids run amok in the hotel.  As in standing on the tables at breakfast, sticking phones in front of their faces at volume 50, letting kids with no social skills get their own food from the buffet, gross. As we were wrapping up dinner, I pulled up the confirmation for the show on my phone and that's when I realized, we were to have printed the tickets prior to arrival.  I panicked, as we had just enough time to get from dinner to the venue - trying to figure out how to print tickets in between was NOT on the agenda. Summary Heading: Fantastic stay - particularly with older kids
Summary: Brilliant choice for family with older kids - TV divider (see photos on website) gave feeling of space for each kid to spread out, so too little kitchen area with bench for laptop etc. Gym downstairs was great escape ( just went down stairs near our room) so too pool, spa, games room, above convenience of Starbucks (my haven to then return poolside to read... bliss). Many places to eat that the family liked which weren’t too expensive - for dinner Cheesecake Factory, McCormick & Schlick (> Happy hr), Bubba gumps and Mimi’s and for lunch Subway & 7/11 for quick on the run sandwiches or wraps going to or coming from Disneyland. They did prefer Earl of Sandwich though in Downtown. Just up the road (bus available) to huge Target for additional groceries like better fruit selection,

When we arrived, we found out we were in a studio with two queen beds.  They were able to shift our reservation to a king without much fuss.    Having a starbucks downstairs is a huge plus for us while traveling.  They also have a walgreens attached to the hotel that we visited a few times.  Again, convenience.    The breakfast downstairs would be nice if traveling with kids.  Has all of the necessities and was kept clean.    We used the parking garage and thought it was very strange to see the housekeeping carts lined up outside of the elevators.  Not only was it an eyesore but it doesn't seem to be the cleanliest place to keep such items.

Summary Heading: Great Deal on a New Hotel at Disneyland!
Summary: We (family of 5) just got back from a weekend at Disneyland and stayed at the Hyatt House Anaheim.  IWe have stayed at 2 of the Disneyland Hotels in the past.  While you don't get the extra magic hour, we saved a lot of money that we were able to use on the MaxPass and other fun stuff!   Frankly, we don't want to wake up early enough to use the magic hour anyway.  We reserved a room with a king size bed, bunk bed and pull out couch.  The couch wasn't very comfortable, so we just had one of our children sleep on the couch with sheets & blankets. (Make sure you ask for comforters - they only provide a very light weight blanket.  It gets colder in the bunk room area because that is where the AC is located.  You will need to keep the doors between the 2 rooms open to keep the king

The room had very loude water pipes did not get much sleep that night. This is where Hyatt redeemed themselves. I asked to be moved to another room and they did. To the 5th top floor. Very quite room. Had a angle view of the disney property and fireworks. In all they do a very good job at the hotel.

Summary Heading: Great option for business and travel
Summary: I had flown in from Sacramento and arrived early, and was surprised to be able to check-in as early as I did. The front desk staff was prompt, courteous, and very helpful. The check-in process was very quick and the underground parking garage is convenient and secure (with the elevator going right up to the lobby and guestroom floors). The elevator requires room key access, which adds to the security of this property. The room had everything that you would need: a safe, microwave, mini-fridge, coffee maker, DirecTV, etc. The furniture appeared to be modern/up-to-date and very clean. And the bed was comfortable as well. Perfect for a business or personal stay!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel w/ an Awesome Staff
Summary: From check in to check out, the staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. The hotel was extremely clean, and had a beautiful lobby. The rooms themselves were also great and seemed brand new with slight wear and tear on corners of furniture. The rooms are a bit smaller than the pictures show, but still very roomy at that. There is a bit of an issue as far as noise goes from people walking in the halls or above you, but very faint and easily slept through. There is a starbucks, personal pizza place, and a walgreens all within the hotel itself. Will definitely be back.

Summary Heading: Almost the perfect hotel but with a huge flaw
Summary: Our third stay at this property, but it's been over 2 year since our last. It was basically brand new when we stayed here last, and it seemed like they were operating like a well-oiled machine now. The front desk agent who checked us in was extremely courteous, professional, and knowledgable. And they had lotion in the rooms this time, which was a very minor grievance I remembered from my last stay.  Stayed in the basic King bed room again.  Clean, well-kept, no complaints. I don't eat breakfast when I travel, but my wife checked out the free breakfast in the mornings and said the food looked decent but that it was very crowded.   We were staying here for Disneyland, and the location is terrific. It's a manageable walk, although we got lazy and took rideshare a couple of times.

Summary Heading: Great option to be within walking distance to the park!
Summary: After much research, I selected this hotel for our family for a 3 day Disney stay.  The area itself isn't the "nicest" part of town but it wasn't too bad.  We only passed a few homeless late in the evening.  We had a 1-bedroom room w/2 queen beds and a pull out sofa in the living room.  Perfect with 2 teenage boys.    The full kitchen was a big plus!  The kitchen had everything you need for leftovers or making a full meal .  Loved the Walgreens downstairs!  This saved $$ when buying water/snacks for the room or park.  Great restaurants also very close in the Anaheim GardenWalk.   Much better quality than the park restaurants.    Breakfast - HUGE breakfast area. Summary: Convenience and new-ness was the deciding factor in choosing this hotel. It is a 15 minute walk to the DLR security checkpoint along tree-lined Harbor Blvd. The front desk folks were professional and courteous, and the lobby is immaculately modern. The elevator requires the room card to access the room floors, a nice security feature. There is underground self-parking for a fee, and the elevator goes from the parking level up to the room floors. The 1st floor is a lobby plus handy stores like a Walgreens drugstore, Starbucks, and a pizza joint; the hotel is also close to many other eateries and other stores – it’s a busy location. The space utilization is the best I've ever scene.  Everything is in the best place possible.  The rooms have many plugs to charge all of your devices each night.  The drawers, closets and places to place your personal items are many.  The bathroom has a huge quartz counter top with storage underneath.  It was very easy for us to stay organized.  The kitchenette has all of the essentials.  The staff is friendly and professional.  There is a Walgreen's directly under the hotel where you can get almost everything you would need and there is a CVS across the street.  Disneyland is a 15 minute walk. Summary: This is our preferred hotel for our Disneyland trips. Staff has always been pleasant.   We prefer the one bedroom option with the pull out in the “living room” space.
