The only complaint I have, because I’ve noticed it repeatedly, is that the floors are pretty dirty. When my toddler was crawling it was gross - he’d have grey knees! Same for the bottoms of our feet. Flip flops for all - no barefeet! If this doesn’t improve on our next trip I may look elsewhere. Just makes me wonder if all the cleaning is subpar. The location is a great, centralized location near anything you might need including convenience stores, gas stations, theme parks, restaurants, fast food, & the convention center. Everything is within walking distance. Staff was wonderful & the breakfast included with the stay was slightly different each day - which made it especially nice & not quite so redundant. We will be planning another trip in the future & intend to stay here for that trip as well. Great place to stay & definitely worth the cost!

Summary Heading: Best Non-Disney Hotel Next to the Disneyland Resort
Summary: Absolutely love this hotel. Free breakfast. Free WiFi. Free parking. Starbucks in the same building. Blaze Pizza downstairs. Walgreens next door. Everything within walking distance... abundance of restaurants, and of course Disneyland and California Adventure which is about a 15-minute walk.  Not the first time here. Rooms are great and of ample size. Anna, of the Hyatt House, upgraded us to a family suite, which included a king size bed, a bunk bed, and a sleeper sofa. It was great. Our kids had a blast. Highly recommend paying the price to get a little privacy away from the kids. Rooms are clean, staff is friendly, and the hotel is newer and their team pays attention to the details. Breakfast is sufficient and always being filled. I give this hotel 5 stars and two thumbs up.

Summary Heading: Better than expected and less than a mile from the Disneyland entrance
Summary: Great experience. We opted for a room that faced away from the main road, so noise was not too bad. The staff was amazing. Our room was clean and didn't smell. 2 queen beds and the fold out couch was perfect for our family of four. Breakfast was real food. Not just some bagels, but eggs, potatoes, bacon, bacon, bacon, coffee, juice and more. Front desk staff was super nice. They found out we were celebrating our 25th anniversary and they went out of their way to make it even more special. You shouldn't be disappointed with this place. A short walk to Disneyland entrance and let the fun begin.

Summary: On a few previous visits to Hyatt House properties, we generally had favorable experiences.  This led to an overall positive opinion of the hotel chain, so we chose it for our two-day visit to Disneyland.  The hotel is located close to the park, with the main gate entry about a leisurely 20-minute walk from the lobby.  It is also new, which is immediately noticeable as you enter.  I like modern hotels, so this was a positive first impression.  Unfortunately, it was all downhill from there.  It started with a request for a room with a bathtub.  My wife likes to take a bath, and we do this sort of request quite frequently.  Modern hotels don’t often have all rooms with bathtubs, only with showers, so we always make a point of requesting this feature.  The guy who was checking us

Summary: Do not necessarily recommend the standard basic Room for a family of 4 as it is very cramped. Were able to upgrade to a bunk bed suite which was much nicer for us with two children. Beds were a little lumpier than what we usually get at a Hyatt but this property is heavily impacted by hotel stays.  The HVAC system blows directly on to the bottom bunk making it almost impossible to sleep in that bed. They do have a pull out sofa that can be slept in, but it would be good if they corrected that that problem. Breakfast was typical hotel chain kind of breakfast food with eating area and was decent. They could improve their coffee quality. They make nice crispy bacon. They had scrambled eggs, sausage, yogurt, oatmeal, fruit, toast, etc. They could use a larger water croc as people

Summary Heading: Great location, family friendly and modern!
Summary: We stayed here with our two children (8&5) in October for 7 nights and we couldn't fault it. The room was huge and we loved having a separate part for the girls to sleep in so that we could watch TV once they were asleep!  The breakfast was a help yourself buffet type which had lots of options such as cereals, toast, fruits, bacon, pancakes, hash browns etc! Our girls loved the option of chocolate milk for breakfast and we loved the takeaway cups to take coffee away with us. The pool was basic but fine for us to relax in for a bit, hot tub was boiling and the gym was great! Lots of options to eat nearby such as the Blaze pizza place downstairs which was delicious. Walgreens perfectly situated to stock up on essentials. Subway across the road, the Cheesecake factory and Bubba

Summary Heading: Fire alarm went off two nights in a row
Summary: I booked this hotel for two nights to stay there with my 4 year old. The first night the heater wasn’t working. The hotel tried to fixed it at 9:30pm (my daughter bedtime). As soon as, the guy left the room, smoke came out and fire alarm went off. Had to evacuate the room and switch to another room at 10pm. My daughter was tired and scared. The second night, I was washing my daughter in the shower after a long day in Disneyland. It was around 9pm that the fire alarm went off AGAIN. I had to wrap my daughter in towels and walk with others to the stairs and go to the lobby. My poor baby was wet, cold and scared. She didn’t want to stay there anymore. I had to leave the hotel at 10 pm and drove to LA to stay at my brothers place. The hotel manager was really relax about what

Summary Heading: Fantastic modern property, super-convenient for Disneyland

My kids used the pool on a couple of afternoons when we took a beak from the parks and the whole pool area was immaculately clean with plenty of fresh towels. Our room was spacious with two queen beds and a little kitchen / sitting area which was ideal for our family. Housekeeping was wonderful and reception staff helpful.  Complimentary breakfast was basic but fine for when you need to eat quickly and head to the parks. Overall a great experience and would definitely recommend for families visiting Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Pleasant stay at the Hyatt House
Summary: Our family of 5 stayed at the Hyatt House in 2 view rooms for NYE 2018.  The location is perfect - close to the parks, the GardenWalk, Starbucks, and iHop.  The hotel is clean and fairly new.  Our rooms were located on the top floor which was great since the view is the best from there - there are some buildings between the Hyatt House and the Matterhorn so the 5th floor offers the least obstruction.  The room was comfortable and fairly large with a small kitchen/dining counter/livingroom combo and 2 queen beds.  Since the hotel is fairly new, the furniture and beds were comfortable.  The bathroom is pretty basic but large enough for two  people at the sinks at the same time.  The room was also clean.  Overall, the Hyatt House is a great value for a family - close to many

The proximity to the Disney park was a HUGE plus for me. However, its 15 min walking distance to the actual entrance. Its 2019. If you dont know how to use Google Maps because you live in a cave, dont blame anyone else about the "surprise" distance from the property. The Disney gates are not across the street.  The real game changer for me was my first point of contact at the property with one of the managers, Bree. Super smart, professional, nice, and caring individual. So helpful! First impressions are everything

The Hyatt buffet breakfast was great. The beds were comfy and the view room was excellent for watching the 9:30pm Disney fireworks each day. Be aware this hotel does not have room service (we arrived at 10:30pm our first night with a hungry 7 year old) which was too late to go out for dinner with a young child, however the front desk were very helpful and gave us a list of nearby restaurants that would delver to the front desk for us. Summary: 6 Months of planning for 11 family members to Disneyland.  We chose the Hyatt House because of it’s location and it’s name.  It didn’t disappoint us.  We chose the double queen view rooms (spectacular), with a kitchen/bar area.  The rooms were spacious, bathroom large, and large sleeper/sofa (we didn’t use) for sitting and enjoying the Seahawks game.  The rooms (adjoining) were ready upon our early arrival (11am) to allow us to head on over to Disneyland (DL) right away.  The Pool and Hot Tub were clean and warm even in December.  The walk to DL is about 10 mins, with 2 major intersections.  If your feet get tired no problem getting a taxi or Uber at DL right outside the gate.  We found after 1 day of DL (8+miles of walking) that those options are great. The taxi/uber was around

Summary: Our family of 5 just returned back home from our week stay at the Hyatt House. It was a great time! Location was ideal- a short 10 minute walk to Disney, a lot of restaurants near by (Bubba Gumps, Cheesecake Factory, etc.). Breakfast was great and had plenty of hot and cold options. Our room was great- clean, comfortable and modern. We especially liked the bunk room for the kids- We could put the kids to sleep and still have our own time to relax before going to sleep. We used the pool and hot tub whenever we had the chance. I'm not sure if the pool was heated or not but for us Canadians it felt warm. ;)  As far as staff goes I have nothing but great things to say about them. Every time we came back to the hotel the staff at the front desk were super friendly-- even some of them
Manager Response: Dear Nadine H, Thank you so much for taking the time to review your recent stay with us! We greatly appreciate your kind words and they will be celebrated with the entire staff! Thank you for choosing to stay at Hyatt House and we hope to welcome you back in the near future and every time you come to the area! If you have any further questions or concerns please feel free to reach out at anytime.

Summary: The hotel decided to clean the carpets outside of our room during our kid's nap time. The hotel did not advise us of this when we booked the room or when we checked in. Our kids could not nap and it ruined our trip to Disneyland. Management did not offer us anything acceptable for this incredible inconvenience.
Manager Response: Dear Eric Y,  Again we truly apologize that your stay with us was anything less than satisfactory. It is our hope that you will give us another opportunity to serve you in the future. If you have any other comments or concerns please feel free to reach out at anytime.

Summary: Good location for our family trip to Disneyland.  Room was small for our family of 5 but it was clean and modern.  The complimentary breakfast was GREAT and kept the kids satisfied all morning.  Enjoyed the gym too.

Summary Heading: Great Anniversary Stay!  Great Staff at this Hotel!
Summary: I have had it on my list to review this hotel for some time.  We stayed at the Anaheim Hyatt House on September 21, 2008 for our anniversary.  The hotel management and staff were AMAZING!! I made a subtle reference that we were there for our anniversary (without kids :).  That evening we were surprised with cheese and fruit and champagne.  The staff went out of there way to make it a memorable stay and we are so grateful for all they did.  This service included management, desk staff, breakfast staff, and others.  We love this location and will return again.    Only a few names that I noticed:  Pauline, Bree, Justine.  Thank you!

Summary: Just home from a visit to Disneyland and stayed here for the first time. When we checked in my son mentioned his birthday was coming. Pauline at the front desk took note of this and when we returned to our room that night we found cupcakes and a cute power ranger (his current obsession) birthday card waiting for him. That alone was worth having stayed there. Add in free breakfast, heated pool and less than a 10 minute walk to the parks and you really can't go wrong!

Summary Heading: Close to Disney could watch fireworks from room
Summary: This Hotel had a great feel about it from the time we walked in we were greeted by Bre who explained to us about the room and Parking plus the free breakfasts. The Hotel was a short walk to Bubba Gump,Cheese cake Factory,California Pizza,Johnny Rockets plus.In the same complex there a Starbucks and  Blaze Fast -fire Pizza restaurant.Across the drive is Walgreens and a CVS.Everything was only footsteps away.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Short walk to House of Blues
Summary: Drove up from San Diego for the night to go to a concert at The House of Blues.  This very nice hotel was close enough to the Garden Walk venue so that we didn't have to drive and deal with parking.  The room was a suite with a separate bedroom, kitchen and very large bathroom.  Modern decor, quiet and good blackout shades for sleeping.  Easy underground parking garage.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Had a drink and light meal at happy hour; food was good and the waitress was so attentive and fun.  We just stayed the night, but I wished it was for a few days.  I would stay here again.  On the way out I saw a cute coffee and pastry place in the same parking lot.

Summary: After careful consideration for our first family trip to the United States, we selected the Hyatt House, and we are so glad we did! Booking was made easy through Costco because of the accurate pictures and descriptions available. The rooms were very clean, spacious and convenient. I liked that there was a kitchenette (although we never had time to cook) with a decent island/table for gathering and a slight partition between the two beds and the sofa pull-out. The decor was classy and well designed. The daily breakfast was an excellent, well-stocked and very much appreciated perk to this hotel. Everything was very clean and there was something for everyone, from the healthy fruit/yogurt/granola station to the bacon, sausage, potatoes and pancake stations. We were impressed. The
Manager Response: none

Summary: A short easy walk to Disney. Close to restaurants - across the street from PF Chang’s, Cheesecake Factory, Roy’s, CPK. Next door to Starbucks, Blaze Pizza. In other words, good options close by. A full complete hot breakfast is free each morning. Rooms are clean. Parking underground. Staff attentive and courteous. I recommend with no hesitation.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay while visiting the Disney Resort with your family
Summary: Overall we were very happy with our decision to stay at the Hyatt House during our 5 day (6 night) trip to the Disney Resort area.The included breakfast was a great start to our day, the room was clean and quiet and we were less than a 15 min walk to the security checkpoints at the resort.  I would also highly recommend Blaze pizza for a quick bite at the end of the night - this was a welcome find!  Walgreens next door has a good selection of snacks and prepared foods (cheaper than the CVS across the street which had a similar selection but higher prices for most items we found)

Summary: This hotel is in a great location.  It is close enough to walk to Disneyland, but also far enough away that the restaurant prices are reasonable.  They have a CVS right next door, to pick up water and snacks, and microwave and mini refrigerators in the rooms.  There is a Starbucks and great pizza place right down stairs.  The rooms were clean, and the staff was friendly and accommodating.  The complimentary breakfast was a nice touch.  It had a full breakfast too, both hot, and cold options.  Parking was $18 per night, but that is to be expected at any hotel in the Disney area.  We would definitely stay again.

Summary: Quiet room and a nice space to unwind. Great workspace at the kitchen island. Loved that there was a mini fridge and freezer in the room! Breakfasts were great and well-run, ready for the herd of kids excited to chow down and get to Disneyland. Parking was a breeze and rates were reasonable given the areas. Decent nearby dinner options within walking distance.  Probably one of the nicer area hotels for families.

Summary: I stayed here with my husband and 5 yo for 6 nights during our recent vacation. We had a suite with a separate bedroom, my son slept on the pull out couch bed which was reasonably comfortable. It has a true separate bedroom (not just a partially divided room like some “suites”), which we appreciated as we all sleep better in our own space and it allows my husband and I to stay up later after the kid is asleep. The suite was large, like a small apartment, and the kitchenette was great with full sized fridge and stovetop. There was a microwave but no oven or toaster. We did cook several simple meals in the room and it was helpful to have the fridge for leftovers also. My husband and son ate often at the continental breakfast and it was adequate. There is also a Starbucks, pizza

Summary: My trip to Los Angeles was very unfortunate.  Not only was I delayed over 3 hours, My original hotel lost my room due to maintenance issues.  I was moved to Hyatt House around 3 am, when I finally arrived from my trip in.  The front reception, Robert, made the transition awesome.  I was tired, frustrated, and more than a little short on temper but he treated me with such a calm manner that I could help but realize that my anger was misguided.  He helped me get checked in and even managed things so I wouldn't have to interrupt my plans to potentially move rooms again.  The room was quite, clean, and everything I needed for my stay.  It was a short walk to the convention center and all-in-all a great experience.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to any friends interested in

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 7 days. Friendly staff,clean rooms,good breakfast.   Good security. Your room key was needed to operate the elevators.  The only thing I found as a negative about the room is that the mattress on the bed was very soft and with my bad back and my wife’s muscular problems we found it very difficult to turn or move once we got into bed. The staff was sorry we had to go through but told us beds were the same in all of the rooms. We ended up sleeping upright on the couch for the next 6 nights.  I would not suggest this hotel if you have issues with really soft mattresses

Summary Heading: Brilliant, highly recommend, please read if you have small children
Summary: We stayed at the Hyatt House in October 2018 during our holiday to Disneyland. The quality of the facility and service was absolutely fantastic. Disneyland is about a 10 minute walk. Something to keep in mind if travelling with children under 5 years old and you plan to spend several long days at Disneyland is that small children will struggle with the walks to and from the Hyatt House. So please plan and set your expectations accordingly.  The only thing stopping me from give a 5 star review is the house staff kept packing up the sofa bed every day, which meant we had to unpack the sofa bed and make the bed again after a long day at Disneyland.  One of our kids was sick during the night and staff were very helpful. I highly recommend the Hyatt House for your trip to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great attentive staff but the rooms were badly set out.
Summary: We stayed in a one bedroom suite at Hyatt House at Anaheim Resort.  The positive things about the hotel are:  1. The reception staff and housekeeping staff were fabulous and always greeted us. 2. The hotel has breakfast included with your stay. 3. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to Disneyland.  Unfortunately the negatives that we found about the hotel were the rooms.  The rooms are badly set up, so unfortunately can't be changed.  The air-conditioning in the lounge/kitchen area worked so well that you could turn it off in mid October but the bedroom was really hot.  The air-conditioning did not go through to the bedroom.  The bathroom did not have a fan so the room steamed up and got really warm.  If the other person was still sleeping in the bedroom and you opened the bathroom

Summary: I booked this hotel for walking distance to Disney and the fact that it had a kitchen so we could keep and heat up milk for our daughter. Friday, upon check-in Paulina was great! She asked us about our stay and if there was anything special we were celebrating. I told her it was our daughters first Disney trip and our anniversary was the day before. She gave us a 1st Disney trip picture for our daughter which was sweet. Then when we returned to the hotel Saturday night there were 2 cards, a "treat" and some champagne. One card was for our daughter and the other for us. She even remembered who my daughters favorite characters where and what year anniversary it was for us! Best service/experience I have ever received at a hotel. I will stay here any time I am in the area from now

Summary: Very good place for a family trip.  Hotel rooms are relatively spacious, free breakfast in the morning has several options, decent pool & fitness center, many food options within walking distance ranging from fast food to restaurants (Cheesecake Factory, Bubba Gump), and within four blocks of Disneyland.  A Target is less than half a mile away if an emergency arises and you need several items.  At this time the hotel is new and clean for this tier of an option.  For a business traveler without family, best to avoid this location.  You are not going to like the noise level and other aspects that are positive for a family.  There is a Hilton and Grand Hyatt in the area that are better for s business person.
Manager Response: Dear Texas-Tech R, Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. We appreciate your feedback and hope to see you again in the future. In the meantime, if you have any further comments or concerns please feel free to contact us at anytime.

Summary: Since my last review in May we have returned to twice to this property.  The location (10 minute walk to Disneyland Resort) and amenities (free breakfast) are a perfect fit for my family,  What sets this property apart is the staff.  Bre at the front desk is a fantastic representative for this hotel - always smiling and enthusiastic.  The staff in the dining area was also great - friendly and very efficient!  I've recommended this property to several acquaintances and will continue to do so.

Summary: Firmness on beds was too firm ( plank feeling). with that aside, hotel rooms were clean. Upside to this hotel is having blaze pizzeria on property. walk to Disney was not bad. (5mile walk each way, 10mi in total). This hotel does offer taxi/ shuttle services. OC bus stop is near hotel.

Summary Heading: In and Out for a Conference
Summary: Well kept, clean, cozy, boutique style hotel with friendly faces everywhere.  I went for a conference and stayed for 3 nights.  It was within easy walking distance to the Convention Center, Downtown Disney, Disneyland and tons of restaurants.  The hotel itself is very clean both inside and outside.  Parking is expensive but easily located in the basement of the hotel.  I used the gym 2 days and although very small, I never had to wait or felt over crowded.  I sat at the pool but did not use it but it was well kept and clean.  The front desk employees always greeted me with a smile and had some recommendations for dinner spots.  Breakfast each morning was included which I found to be wonderful.  Great selection and lots of food.  With kids being the primary guest at this hotel,

Summary: attended a conference an stayed here for 3 nights.  Nice property, especially if you are going to Disneyland (I wasn't).  property was clean and well maintained.  Room was great size, full kitchen, bed was comfortable, nothing fancy, but very nice.   I am a real light sleeper and had a room on the inside and it was very quiet.  Free breakfast was one of the best I have seen with all the usual stuff and a lot of fruit.   very nice having a Starbucks, Walgreens and pizza place (mediocre though) on the first floor.  try the Mexican place across the street in the strip mall.  Staff were all friendly and helpful.  Gym was average.  would stay again.

Summary Heading: Great brand, full kitchen, open areas and roomy suites, clean and low key
Summary: We really liked this hotel. We stayed in a 544 sq ft Queen Studio with 2 beds. It was quiet, clean, easy to navigate, close to the park, with a great full breakfast and lots of other amenities like covered parking (for a fee), lots of food and retail options in same complex (Walgreens, CVS, Starbucks, pizza, etc. Nice pool area on rooftop of 3rd floor. We stayed on the 5th floor (requested) and had no issues with anything. We will be back!
Manager Response: Dear JodieS32737,  I appreciate your feedback from your recent stay here with us here at Hyatt House Anaheim Convention Center. I'm glad we were able to accommodate you and your family throughout your stay including the retail nearby! We look forward to see you in the near future! Please feel free to contact me directly if there is anything I can assist you with.

Summary: Hyatt House is near Disneyland and very easy to access. Rooms are clean and very spacious. We arrived earlier than check in and they were great to get us situated in our room in no time at all. Lobby and breakfast area are welcoming!! Great hotel!
Manager Response: Dear andij16, Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us, we appreciate your kind words and they will be celebrated with the entire team! If you have any other comments or concerns please feel free to reach out to us at anytime. We look forward to seeing you again the near future.

Summary: I wanted to give this hotel and excellent review because the staff are friendly and they went above and beyond incredible service. Special mention to the front desk staff and to Ana at the bar.  Unfortunately, the beds were very uncomfortable and hurt my hips and back.  The pillows were poor quality so we had to ask for multiple pillows in order to be comfortable.  The breakfast was good quality though I might suggest adding salsa for the eggs and maybe consider changing up the variety instead of serving mostly the same thing every morning.  The room decor is very basic and we did see trash that had been left behind from previous guests.  We go to Disneyland frequently and I probably wouldn't stay here again as similar hotels in the area are a bit nicer for the same price.

Summary: We typically book at Hyatt House when we are unable to book a Disney hotel. Although this place has increased its price over the last year, we still love staying here. Staff is friendly and respectful. Hotel is clean (though a bit more wear and tear this year than the previous year). I have recommended most of my friends who have families to stay here and this trip, a few of my friends stayed here and met us at the park. It seems they were all happy with Hyatt House as well. :)  We will be staying again in November.

I doubt I will ever stay anywhere else on repeat visits.  Also, Bre at the front desk is the best!

Summary Heading: Great very new, clean hotel, close to Disney and great breakfast included!
Summary: Had a great experience at this hotel. Walking distance (about 10-15minutes walk) to Disney, rooms and hotel are very new looking and clean.  The morning breakfast was really good, with lots of food options and plenty of seating (and clean as well).  The staff was friendly and helpful once they acknowledged you. This hotel is a bit pricer than other hotels in the area, but it is one of the newest and cleanest I've stayed in that includes breakfast and is walking distance to Disney. They also have a very nice lobby area with a bar (and happy hour specials). They did charge for parking, but it is gated, which makes you feel better about the safety of your car. Would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Best service I have EVER received!
Summary: I have never received such great service at any hotel. It was our son's 10th birthday and the staff had a small gift along with a card and a balloon waiting in the room for us. They upgraded our room and covered our parking. They were so kind and welcoming! The room was very nice and the location was perfect. This is my FAVORITE hotel in Anaheim and we will definitely be back!

Summary: My wife and I recently stayed at the Hyatt House while visiting Disneyland in Anaheim. We flew into Orange County and took a 15 minute Uber ride to the hotel. We arrived quite a bit before the stated check-in time and the staff were nice enough to let us get our room. I always appreciate this when traveling. The room itself didn’t disappoint either. The king bed layout with a sizable couch met all of our needs and was extremely comfortable for our visit. The hotel is a short, 15 minute walk from the gate at Disneyland. We would walk back to our room midday to refresh, after being at the parks, then head back for the evening. Short of staying at a Disney resort for $400/night you will not find a hotel that is nicer or in a better location for a Disneyland stay. Staff was always

Summary: Started our vacation at this hotel,Saturday  September 1 , checked out on the Wednesday. 4 adults 2 kids. Loved this hotel, beautiful room.  We arrived before check in, so they gave us access the the pool/ bar  level.  We had lunch at the pizza place below the hotel, very good 🍕. Starbucks is next door. Spent our afternoon lounging buy the pool & hot tub till 4. Breakfast was amazing, Seattle’s best coffee, juice, scrambled eggs , bacon or sausage, tarter tots, waffles , muffins , fruit , cottage cheese. So many other choices. And they made my daughter in law gluten free waffles every morning. Never a shortage of anything. And plenty of sitting.  We didn’t have a vehicle till our son & family arrived on the Sunday, but it’s not a issue. So many good choices for foods close by,
Manager Response: Dear downtime,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! Summary: I LOVE this hotel!  First of all the customer service is 5 star hotel status! Alex A. was so professional, gracious, caring and went above and beyond to help us get checked in comfortably.... he was wonderful!!!  Second- the hotel is beautiful, clean, and new... the beds are perfect, the pillows just right, tasteful decor, couldn’t hear any other guests at all!!!EVERYTHING PERFECT!  Third- LOCATION! It is such a short walk to Disneyland from this beautiful hotel!   Fourth- the free breakfast was incredible!!!  I highly recommend this wonderful hotel!  Jacquie- Jonathan- and Jaxon

Summary: Great place withing walking to Disneyland & a number of restaurants in a clean, safe neighborhood.  We had 2 teens so we got a Family Suite.  The bunk bed was a little short for my 6'2" son, but there was also a sectional sofa that pulled out.  It was also nice to have the pool table to relax with.  Having the breakfast each morning was nice but it was pretty much the same thing every morning.  We never made it to the afternoon reception so can't say how that was.  Staff were all friendly & helpful, although housekeeping didn't seem to refresh/clean up coffee supplies consistently.
Manager Response: Dear IndyCindy13,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us! Summary: We stayed for a Disneyland vacation. 2 kids 2 adults. The location is perfect. You can walk to Disney in the morning, maybe 10 min walk. We took a cab home a few evenings as we were tired from walking all day and it cost around $5.00.  There are many restaurants close by.  There is a store right beside with water snacks pharmacy items etc.   We had a room with separate bunk room. Well worth it and awesome. Kids would go to sleep and we could enjoy a bit of tv in our room separated by sliding door.   The hotel was very clean.  The breakfast was awesome every morning. It had a variety of hot and cold items. Eggs bacon sausage pancakes cereal yogurt fruit etc. Rotated something different each day for hot items.   The staff were helpful at the front desk.   It was conveniently

Very quiet, we could hear very little from other rooms or outside.  Small detail but I found the AC very quiet too, and blackout curtains made for a good nights sleep. Summary: This was our fifth time in the Disneyland area and our first staying at the Hyatt House.  The staff were fantastic, always friendly and attentive.  We were made to feel welcomed from the moment we checked in.The breakfast was great...better than most "complimentary" breakfasts in the other hotels in the area.  Good selection, great coffee and plenty of seating (we never had to wait for a table).The pool area is very nice and clean.The room was great, very clean and a very comfortable bed.  The only thing I would recommend is a ceiling fan so that after a shower the bathroom would "air out" quicker as the heat/steam hung in the air afterwards.The location was fantastic as well...about a 10 min. walk to the gates of Disneyland.We will definitely be back to this hotel then next

Summary: Great location being only a twenty minute  walk to the Disneyland gates. Breakfast was tasty and decent options. The staff were super helpful and when our bags were delayed from our flight the staff called our room to let us know they'd arrived to the hotel. We will be staying here again on our next trip.

Summary: We've always stayed at the same hotel when in Anaheim but decided to take a risk and try a different place to stay for this visit and we are SO GLAD we did! Friendly staff, good breakfast, clean, tidy rooms and an awesome pool and pool area.  The rooms are quiet too - we were right by the elevators and barely heard a thing. It was so nice staying in a (nearly) sound proof place for once as with all the excited kids around, usually noise is just expected in Anaheim hotels.   Parking was easy, and always plenty of parks available.   Super handy having a Starbucks in the same building, and it is an easy 10 minute walk to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Robotexplosion,    Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us and we will utilize your response to make every guest experience the best it can be. Summary: Great place to stay. Recommend this place highly if you want great rooms and service....stay here.The people are professional and very helpful. The breakfast was excellent and was restocked and hot the entire time of breakfast. Excellent experience!!

Summary: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel and we loved it. The room was clean and had a very nice bed and bathroom. The couch was awesome to sit on at night when we wanted to watch tv and eat. Super close to Disneyland and had great restaurants near by.

Summary: Great breakfast buffet with everyone covered from scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, fresh fruit, yoghurt, breads, cereals, oatmeal, juices, milk and coffee. Everything always refreshed when needed. Dining room clean and vigilant staff keep the tables is pristine condition. And, easy walk to Disneyland!

Summary: I wish we could give this hotel a 10/10 because 5 just isn’t enough. First of all, Bri (at the front desk) is the real rockstar and made our Disney vacation so much more special. She greeted my children by NAME every time we came and went from the hotel lobby! When we were checking out, they were sad that they couldn’t get a picture with Bri :-) maybe next year! She also helped us with our bags & even rescued us with a new key when we found ourselves upstairs and without one.  Exceptional service and marvelous hotel! We are super picky about cleanliness & this hotel exceeded our standards.   Also, we loved the room with bunk beds! It was so perfect for our kids who go to bed early.  Lastly, breakfast was great! Best complimentary breakfast we’ve ever had. Scrambled eggs, bacon

Summary: We came to celebrate all 6 of our birthdays! We only stayed 3 nights. Would have limed to stay 1 more day. I did like that the hotel was located around a lot of amenitities. Made it easy to go right down and get waters at cvs...

Summary Heading: Not the Hyatt House I know and love
Summary: I always stay at either Hyatt House/Place both for work and leisure. I have never had a poor experience- the roooms are always nice, breakfast is great and the atmosphere is higher end. However, this stay was vastly different. The noise above us was so bad security had to be called both nights between 11-2am. It was not the atmosphere I know Hyatt to be at this location. I left rather disappointed. The pool area was the same, with kids running unattended, spilling drinks into the hot tub and using the handicap chair as a jumping off point into the pool. There were kids in the exercise room that were wet, running on the treadmills. Overall, I know Hyatt to be one that has a high level of professionalism and works to maintain an atmosphere of respect but unfortunately, with this
Manager Response: Thank you for completing your trip advisor review regarding your recent stay at our hotel. I apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying. Feedback such as yours assists us in improving our service and property. In addition, please know that your comments and issues will be addressed.   It is our hope that you give us another opportunity to serve you. Again, I apologize for the inconvenience during your stay and hope to see you during your next visit. Summary: I had a great experience with this hotel from the moment I called for information. Bree was very friendly, answered all my questions, and did her best to accommodate my special requests. The 2 queen studio was spacious, clean and beds were comfortable. The location was great- there is a Walgreens below to pick up last minute items and it was a very short walk to Disneyland. Breakfast was simple but delicious and the staff was also friendly. I will stay here again in the future.

Summary Heading: Another excellent stay at Hyatt House
Summary: Hyatt House and Anaheim has become my go-to place for Disneyland. I'm so welcome by the staff, they're all so friendly and call me by name throughout my stay. All you can eat breakfast is phenomenal. The hotel is immaculately clean and smells good. I love the cucumber and mango infused water in the lobby. Guest rooms are very nice and modern. The bed and pillow were more comfortable than mine at home! Newer hotel. And just a 10 minute walk to Disneyland don't even need a shuttle. This place is the best!

Summary: Stayed for four nights at the end of August 2018.  We really liked this hotel. Our room was large and clean. The breakfasts were good with a large choice and with staff at hand to make sure it was all clean and tidy and topped up.  Service was good and it was only a 20 minute easy walk to the gates of Disneyland.  There is a 24 hour Walgreens below and Alamo car hire is a short walk.  If we stay in the area again I wouldn't hesitate to stay here.
Manager Response: Dear DJLGB,  Thank you for taking the time to comment on your recent stay! Your kind words will be celebrated with the entire team! We hope to see you again in the near future! If you have any other comments or concerns don't hesitate to contact us at anytime.

Summary Heading: Solid mid-level hotel walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: Visit Summary: Overall felt the hotel was as-advertised, the staff was very helpful across the board, and was easy enough to walk to Disneyland.  Would stay again.  Parking: Upon arriving to the hotel we parked in the parking lot outside the lobby while we checked in.  After check-in we drove to the underground ramp which was well marked.  The ramp is large and well-lit; plenty of open spaces during our visit.  There were a number of luggage carts to use and the elevators were very close by.  Check-in: We arrived about an hour before official check in time and were warmly greeted by Pauline.  I had pre-checked into our room via the Hyatt app however as an Explorist  wanted to inquire about an upgrade.  Pauline happily checked for open rooms and was able to move us from a
Manager Response: Dear MNCamping,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us! Your comments are greatly appreciated and will be celebrated with Pauline and the entire team! We appreciate the outstanding details you gave about our property! It's reviews like yours that keep our team motivated to continue with our success.  We hope to see you again in the near future! If you have any other questions, comments, or concerns please feel free to reach out to us!

Summary Heading: Ideal for Tesla Owners Visiting Disneyland
Summary: This hotel has 2 Tesla chargers and it is the closest hotel to Disneyland, just across the street from California Adventure, that offers free Tesla charging.  It also sits on top of Walgreen's, which is open 24 hours. I booked the extended studio kitchen suite  (540 sq ft), which has lots of room for our suitcases and food.  We also had two mobility scooters which we conveniently left in the hallway outside our room to charge. Since we had 4 adults and a need for 3 beds, this room worked out very well.  The room was very clean and quiet and has lots of drawers.    The only drawback is that we were placed at the end of the hallway, which was a very long walk to the elevators.  The complimentary breakfast buffet was very good.  They served scrambled eggs, toast, sausage or bacon,

Summary: Loved the location of this place, easy walk to Disneyland, shops, restaurants, you name it! When I checked in, Pauline asked if I was here for any special occasion. After saying it was for my girlfriend's birthday, she arranged to have a generous fruit platter delivered later to the room along with a very nice hand-written card. My girlfriend loved it and I thought it was an extremely nice gesture, thanks Pauline!  The room was also very nice! Loved how spacious and clean it was. The free breakfast was great and we also spent some time at the pool which was relaxing. I would definitely stay here again on my next Disneyland trip!

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel in a great location
Summary: I stayed here with some colleagues for a conference and had a wonderful stay at the Hyatt House. We had a studio suite room which was very spacious. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The hotel also has a nice outdoor pool with lounge chairs if you have time to spend int he sun. The gym was also pretty standard for a hotel gym, 4 newer treadmills, free weights, and bikes and had towels and a water cooler for your use there. The breakfast was very good with daily scrambled eggs, breakfast meat, hashbrowns, and either pancakes, waffles or French toast. They also had nice stations with an oatmeal bar and parfait bar. Everyone at the hotel was extremely friendly and if you’re going to Disney the hotel is about a 15 minute walk from the parks. Very convenient
Manager Response: Dear Lizo1216,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.   I am also glad to know that our staff provided you with friendly and helpful service and the hotel met your satisfaction!  Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary Heading: Great place for a family Disneyland stay.
Summary: Arriving for a 5 day stay we were greeted by a very friendly manager (Bree) who offered us a room upgrade so the kids would have a separate room for a nominal fee of $25.  We found the rooms spacious and perfect for a family of 4. The hotel also has a great pool area and gym. Breakfast was also very good and included in price.  Being a 10 minute walk to Disneyland, restaurants close by and a 24 hr  grocery store on site, I would recommend this place for families.   Thanks again Bree and Daniel for your hospitality and advice on all things Anaheim.
Manager Response: Dear Peter D,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention center.  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with our Bree & Daniel, they truly embodies the hospitality spirit. I will be certain to share your comments with the entire team.  Thank you again, we look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary Heading: Over all was good value for my holiday dollar:
Summary: Most of the front desk staff were very welcoming. Convenient location! Though much of the same menu everyday, the breakfast was a nice touch. We found the room clean and comfortable. Good location for day trips to Disney or to the convention center!
Manager Response: Dear X5379NYpeterl,  Thank you for taking the time to comment on your recent stay with us! We greatly appreciate your feedback and will celebrate it with the entire team! We hope you will come back and stay with us in the future!

Summary Heading: Not the worst, Not the best.
Summary: I’ve always been a fan of Hyatt. This was a 3 day trip with goals to relax along with many pre-planned adventures. We work hard in the fitness industry to live a healthy life style. However, the hotel itself, besides the fact that the room, while clean and spacious, lacked a bit of healthy options on hand. No option to rent movies. The fitness room was as basic as they come and the breakfast we used two out of the three days had no similar options to any of our dietary or allergy needs (and trust me, we know how to get creative). For the prices paid, I had hoped for a bit more customer service, rarely even saw anyone around for the most part of the lobby. The lack of toiletries (ex. Lotion, Shower cap, etc) was disappointing... but even with that missing, we hoped there would at
Manager Response: Dear kgiannni,  Thank you for taking the time to comment on your recent experience with us. I am very sorry for the inconveniences you faced, and I will share your feedback with my team. I hope you will come and visit us again!

Summary: Hyatt House is located within 10 to 15 minutes walk of Disneyland park and attractions which was very convenient because, around Disney closing time, while people using cars and app cabs were still trying to locate their vehicles and navigate their way out of the massive parking lots we had already walked back to the hotel! Starbucks and a 24-hour Walgreens are adjacent to the hotel, and many other restaurants and convenience stores are all around the hotel.  Rooms were good and comfortable with excellent linen and mattresses, and a functional kitchenette with fridge, dishwasher, coffee maker, stove and microwave, and well stocked with crockery, cutlery and cookware.  The full breakfast buffet had a large and well cooked selection of items, however refilling items like bacon was

Summary: The new Hyatt House was fantastic for our recent trip to Disneyland.  The suites were large and clean.  The staff were great.  Very nice pool area and workout room.  And the morning breakfast buffet was amazing.
Manager Response: Dear jscherr,  Thank you for taking the time to comment on your recent stay with us! We greatly appreciate your feedback and will celebrate it with the entire team!  We hope you will come back and stay with us in the future!

Summary Heading: gluten free breakfast made by chef george
Summary: Amazing location within short walking distance to Disneyland. Rooms are very clean and very quiet. Only complaint would be is that the room we booked (king bed with bunk beds and sofa bed) would be a bit small for 5-6 people. Would be perfect for 4 or less. The breakfast area is huge and run very efficiently. Was very impressed with how the breakfast staff took food allergies seriously. Chef George came out to talk with my wife about her special needs and specifically made her a gluten free breakfast. Very very impressed. Most hotels just give you a list of what is gluten free and let you figure things out. Will definitely be back
Manager Response: Dear 814glennm,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.   It is our staffs mission to provide extraordinary service to our guests.  Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: Loved the location of this place. Walking distance to Disneyland. CVS , Walgreens ,Starbucks & ihop downstairs! Staff sent up cupcake & card to celebrate my daughter’s birthday! That was sweet! Room & hotel were very clean all day, every day!
Manager Response: Dear mctorres66,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention Center. We our fortunate to have Starbucks, Wallgreens, CVS, Disneyland and I-Hop  right out our back door.  It also gives me great pleasure to see that our staff was able to assist in making your daughters birthday special.  Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: We happily spent a week in a king bedroom suite with kitchen for our Disney vacation. The location was perfect distance to the park, easily walkable for a six year old and grandmother. We spent morning and evenings at the parks, and used the room to rest and swim during the hottest hours of the day. There are plenty of restaurants nearby, and Starbucks, pizza, and pharmacy in adjacent buildings. The hotel offered a full breakfast with tea and coffee in the morning, which was helpful to quickly get out the door in the morning. The only criticism I have is that the mini fridge in our room had an awful smell, and the air circulation in the hotel was not ideal because windows did not open. Aside from that, the room was serviced everyday, the staff was friendly. We would come again.
Manager Response: Dear Hugjessica,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am please to see that you were able to enjoy your stay with us at the Hyatt House Resort/Convention Center.   Thank you for your kind words regarding our staff, I have shared your feedback.Feedback such as yours assists us in improving our service and property. In addition, please know that your comments and issues will be addressed.  We look forward to having the opportunity to serve you the next time your travels bring you to Anaheim.

Summary: This is a great place to stay and commute to Disney land. The staff let us check in 3 hrs earlier than our check in time which was a bonus. Place is clean and rooms are bigger than most of the hotels I have been to in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Dear Ashishpawn,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay with us at the Hyatt House Resort/Convention Center.  I am so glad that we were able to accommodate an earlier check in for your arrival.  We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again when your travels bring you to Anaheim.

Summary: Stayed here for 2 nights, as we just needed a base for Disneyland. Location is great, 10 minutes walking to the park. Room was modern and clean, and free breakfast is always a plus. Right next to a Walgreens and across the street from CVS and 7-11, so everything is close by. The only thing I didn't like is the $21 or so charge per night for parking, as their parking structure is giant and it just seems like a money grab for no reason. Other than that, it was a nice way to use our Hyatt credit card free nights, and we'd be back.
Manager Response: Dear Yoshapman,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am please to see that you were able to enjoy your stay with us at the Hyatt House Resort/Convention Center. We are fortunate to have these amenities withing walking distance of our hotel.  We look forward to having the opportunity to serve you again when your travels bring you to Anaheim.

Summary: My 1st stay @ Hyatt House; the room, location, & conveniences all exceeded my expectations.  It's within walking distance to Disneyland & close to Starbucks, Blaze pizza, Subway & Walgreens.  The rooms are quiet, spacious & comfortable. A full breakfast was included too.  I'd definitely stay here again.

I am please to see that you had to opportunity to enjoy of complimentary buffet.  We look forward to serving you again when your travels bring you to Anaheim.

Summary: The resort is clean and inviting.  Staff were very helpful and pleasant.  They had great selections for breakfast and dining area was kept clean at all times.  Can't wait to stay here again when we plan to go to Disneyland. The rooms were so spacious and up to date. Definitely recommend this place!
Manager Response: Dear Rosettep209,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us!
