We look forward to having the opportunity to serve you the next time your travels bring you to Anaheim.

Summary: The hotel was amazing, pool was nice, free breakfast was great, room was fantastic. 3 blocks from Disneyland and surrounded by restaurants and really anything else you could want or need is close by. We will choose this hotel again!
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention center. We are lucky enough to have these extra amenities just in our backyard.  Thank you again, we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: Hyatt House Anaheim is great place, central to Anaheim and Buena Park attractions. This hotel offers service and a great room with comfortable beds. pool and whirlpool are delights, one of the hottest hot tubs on Harbor Blvd hotels
Manager Response: Dear Thomas J B  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention center.  Thank you again, we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: We have just returned from an 8 day break to Anaheim. We stayed 4 nights at Disney Grand Californian and 4 nights at Hyatt House. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at both but Hyatt House was so much better value and the accommodations a lot better.  The room was very spacious and modern with very comfortable beds. The kitchen and fridge was also very handy. We were given 2 free bottles of water each day. The bathroom was large and modern. No complaints at all with the room.   Housekeeping was a bit hit and miss though. One day our room was serviced by 11 and the next day it wasn’t done by 5 so I had to ring front desk and ask for it to be done. It still took another hour after my call to get it done. The following day they changed the bedding but just left the sheets on the bed
Manager Response: Dear pinkbanana,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention center. I am please to see you were able to enjoy our amenities as well as enjoying your time at Disneyland.  Thank you again, we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: This hotel is probably the best option for those looking for a balance between value and quality. Walking distance to Disneyland... with a Starbucks and Walgreens beneath the hotel... it couldnt be more convenient...  Hotel is very new as well, so everything works perfectly... ie, shower, AC, etc...  Staff was excellent and more polite than Disney's own cast members...  One minor issue and it was addressed in mere minutes of notifying the front desk.... very happy and will stay again on our next trip...  Also liked the security features of the hotel too as the main entrance would lock at night and you simply use your key to open the door....
Manager Response: Dear Cd1234567890,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention Center. We our fortunate to have Starbucks, Wallgreens right out our back door.  It also gives me great pleasure to see that our staff was able to assist in your minor issue in a timely manner.  Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: We love this hotel. The breakfast is great, the staff is accommodating and very friendly, the rooms are clean and thenlocation to disneyland is only about a 15 min walk. The price is a little high but worth it!
Manager Response: Dear pvjoyc2008,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.   It is our staffs mission to provide extraordinary service to our guests.  Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: Clean hotel with modern, ocean-themed decor.  Loved the kids having their own room with sliding doors just off our room.  Convenient 10-15 min walk to Disney parks.  Staff was very friendly and helpful, especially Daniel who put together a complimentary bagged breakfast for me when I had to leave early for the airport, before the hot breakfast was available.
Manager Response: Dear Jason S,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention center.  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with Daniel, he truly embodies the hospitality spirit. I will be certain to share your comments with Daniel.  Thank you again, we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: Brand new hotel. Staff friendly and efficient. The rooms are great with a full kitchen and they are mini suites Happy hour needs work but it’s great they have microwaves and stove with small refrigerator  They even have dishwasher and plates.... glassware and flatware. If you are a HYATT REWARDS member only 8000 points...great deal if you have a family
Manager Response: Dear 534lennyc,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention center.  I will share your feedback about our happy hour with our food and beverage team.  Thank you again, we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: This hotel experience was one of the best I have ever had. We stayed 5 days.  The hotel itself was really nice, pool was on the second floor rooftop style. the staff were super professional and helpful.  They accepted my food order and unpacked it for me, while we were at Disneyland.  Made tour of LA reservations, delivers towels in minutes when I needed more.  The room was very clean, breakfast offered a nice selection and abundance.  Walking distance to Disneyland.  The Walgreen downstairs as reasonable priced.  Great pizza, build your own, and a Starbucks below.  Happy hour at the bar.  This is a really great hotel!My only complaint is the local water in Anaheim is absolutely disgusting, even at the park.  Buy lots of water before you enter the park, it's expensive.
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention center. We are lucky to have Walgreens and Disneyland in our backyard.  If only I could change the weather for you during your stay!  Thank you again, we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: Excellent staff, pool area, and breakfast buffet.  However, our room configuration was very frustrating.  The bedroom door and bathroom door were in a constant battle.  We just wanted to remove one from it's hinges and throw it out the window.  Horrific design!!!  So much in fact, we will think twice before booking with Hyatt in the future, yet we know Hyatt is an excellent brand.
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention center.  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with our staff, I have shared this feedback with all of them.  I am sorry about the battle encounter with the two doors, we are looking into this.  Thank you again, we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: I Chose Hotel because it seemed close to Disney. It was only like two blocks away and the walking distance is very pleasant, I don't don't have to pay for parking @ the park, and yet the park is close. Hotel was very clean and the Room was tastefully decorated. The beds were very comfortable. The breakfast was very good and the choices were perfect. We were very happy with our choice because it is close to everything. A drug store in the same street and within walking distance. Place to et are within and walking distance. Hotel is very central located.
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention center. We are lucky to have so many attractions within walking distance from our front door.  I am pleased to see that our room was to your liking as well as our complimentary breakfast buffet.  Thank you again, we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary Heading: Beautiful property, great location and amazing staff!!
Summary: I am writing this review the day before I leave because I can't wait until I get home!  We make family Disney visits several times a year, as we have annual passes. I wanted to choose a hotel closer to the park this trip and decided on Hyatt House at Anaheim Resort and Convention Center. BEST DECISION EVER! Short walk to and from Disneyland, wonderful free breakfast and hotel staff that go the extra mile to make sure your stay is delightful! April, Janielle and Bre have all made me a believer in this Hyatt House location! If I owned a hotel, I'd steal them all to work for me!!
Manager Response: Dear SleepingInSeattle,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention center.  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with April, Janielle and Bre, they truly embodies the hospitality spirit. I will be certain to share your comments with them,  Thank you again, we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: This trip was to celebrate my granddaughter's 5th birthday so we were looking for a hotel near Disney and this is the perfect hotel our room faced Disney so we were able to see the fireworks every night, how awesome.  The hotel staff were awesome, genuine and very friendly. I highly recommend this hotel for your next vacation.
Manager Response: Dear fdwhite,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention center.  I am also glad to know that our staff provided you with friendly and helpful service.  Thank you again, we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary Heading: Very much worth of its 4-star rating!
Summary: This hotel has it all: location, amenities, great, clean rooms, and excellent food! Just a couple blocks from Disney, as well as the Convention Center, we booked this place for a brief weekend getaway to Anaheim. We were extraordinarily impressed with the breakfast buffet--which featured everything from cinnamon toast to potatoes and oatmeal--and the terrific service, not to mention the location (there's a 24-hr Walgreens next door, as well as a Starbucks)! Definitely four stars for this property.
Manager Response: Dear j_b_l802304,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at Hyatt House at Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.  Thank you again! We look forward to seeing you again soon. Should you need anything at all, please do not hesitate to contact me.  Justine Burnside Front Office Manager

Summary: My daughter and I decided to head down to So. Cal for a spur of the moment Disneyland trip. Because it was only a two day trip I knew we wouldn’t be lounging around in our room much so I wanted something reasonable. I was able to get a 1 bedroom kitchen “suite” for $209 a night. Now let’s get to the review  Distance to Disneyland: definitely walking distance it actually took us longer to get an Uber when we were being lazy. I would say a good two long blocks walking to the park. There is no shuttle to the park but you honestly don’t need one.  Staff: everyone in the hotel was friendly and I never had to wait for assistance   Tickets: I was able to purchase my tickets at the front desk   Nearby: Across the street there is a cvs and Walgreens for late night snacks or maybe a
Manager Response: Dear AngelaND1982,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention center.  I am sorry to see that the pictures of your room type were misleading, I will be looking into this to ensure we have the proper photos of our rooms.  Thank you as well for your feedback of all the amenities that we have that are right out our back door. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: We had a great stay at the Hyatt House Anaheim. It was the closest Hyatt to Disneyland and an easy walk to/from the park. Conveniently there is a Walgreens and a few restaurants co-located with the hotel. Room was great, wife and I slept on the King bed and my preschooler took the sofa bed. We had a view of the fireworks too, which was magical to see from our room.  Staff was always lovely at every interaction.  The breakfast was among the better self-serve hotel breakfasts I've had, Hyatt House properties tend to be top-notch for the continental breakfast.  I appreciated that I was able to purchase my Disney tickets from the front desk, saving myself another line in the park.  Car parking is easy and plentiful in a secure and well-lit garage.    Next time our travels take us to
Manager Response: Dear Scott H,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us. I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.  I am pleased to see you were able to utilize the purchasing of your Disney tickets at our property! I have also shared your feedback with our chefs about our morning buffet.  Thank you again! We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: I was on vacation with my family , we decided to take the hotel up on it’s free breakfast , both of my kids have peanut and tree nut  allergies . Like always I have to talk with the chef before my kids can eat anywhere , it was my good fortune that Jorge was the chief on duty . This man went out of his way to make my kids a  special breakfast in the kitchen  aside from the buffet . I can’t express how much that meant to all of us .. now you have a customer for life in me. Thanks again Jorge!
Manager Response: Dear sassysaedragon79,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention center.  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with our chef Jorge, he truly embodies the hospitality spirit. I will be certain to share your comments with Jorge.  Thank you again, we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: Great hotel!  Parking is easy.  The room was spacious and clean.  Nicely decorated and organized.  The breakfast was better than any hotel breakfast we’ve had before.  Great location!  There are several bus options to the Disneyland park, but it isn’t necessary because the walk is an easy 10-15 minutes.
Manager Response: Dear gregm75460,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Reosrt/Convention Center.  We our fortunate to be walking distance from Disneyland Park. Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: When we go to Disneyland we always stay at this hotel. It is nice a clean with beautiful room. It is always a great experience . We will continue to stay here. The breakfast is nice and there is a Starbucks right next door .
Manager Response: Dear Jana s,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention Center. We our fortunate to have Starbucks right out our back door  Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: I booked this hotel a few weeks before we arrived -  realising I should’ve done so earlier as the hotels in the area get booked up fast! The staff were delightful throughout - no mean feat, when most of the clientele are families on a Disney mission and it’s very busy at times.  The rooms was very spacious, clean and well equipped - shame we couldn’t stay longer. Breakfast was fine - through no fault of the hotel’s, as usual, some people behave as though it’s their last hour on earth and they will never eat again. Quite vile behaviour (piling plates high with bacon in case it runs out, barging last to get to the last French toast etc). A good 15-20 minute walk to Disney.
Manager Response: Dear Alive27,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.  I am also glad to know that our staff provided you with friendly and helpful service and the amenities were to your satisfaction.  Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: This hotel is ok. I’m going to give it 2.5- 3 stars. We arrived at 2pm in the afternoon. Now, we did not expect our room to be ready whatsoever. They told us they would text us when it was ready and that check in was 4 with a wait list. We Have been up since 3am with 2 young children. Ok. No problem. We can find something to do for 2 more hours. Well, our room wasn’t ready till after 5. Being a high turn around hotel, maybe there is a need for more cleaning staff and not relying on the minimum amount to clean hundreds of rooms? Every other hotel we have talked to in the Disney area try to have rooms ready for your arrival, if not shortly after.  Our room was never cleaned before 430pm. Today, at 5:15 I had to call and request our room to be made up. When you pull a full day
Manager Response: Dear Ohsigh,  I want to thank you for choosing to stay with us and appreciate your feedback. My sincere apologies that your room was not properly refreshed in a timely matter, as well as ready for your check in experience. I have shared your feedback with our executive housekeeper to ensure she speaks with our housekeeping staff to exceed our guest expectations.  I realize we cannot change your experience I would certainly appreciate another opportunity to welcome you back as our guest. Please contact me directly and I will be happy to assist with your arrangements.   Sincerely,  Justine Burnside  Front Office Manager

Summary Heading: Room Not Serviced, Furnishings in Poor Condition
Summary: I am currently writing this from a dirty hotel room (August 21)  after returning late from the parks on the third day of no one servicing our room. As it had not been serviced the previous two days, my husband specifically stopped by the desk before we left during the late afternoon and asked for it to be serviced. They assured him it would be done, but we returned and it had not been done again. We were out of the room each day before coming back for a midday break for a couple of hours. I was told the rooms are generally serviced between 10am and 12pm. We had to request more towels and a large trash bag, which they brought to us so I could bag up the trash. Not a very nice way to finish the night after a long day. The sofa in our room also had a huge rip/hole under one
Manager Response: Dear ckotulski,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am disappointment that we did not attend to your needs in a timely matter. I have shared this review with our front desk team, engineering and housekeeping team.   We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again and ensure that you have a memorable stay.

Summary: Decent hotel close to Disneyland will stay again. Also conveniently has a Starbucks a blaze pizza and a Walgreens right next to it. Underground secure parking is nice. Stayed in the one bedroom suite with the Disney view Perfect for my family of six.
Manager Response: Dear vaness61,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention Center. We our fortunate to have Starbucks, Wallgreens and Blaze Pizza right out our back door  Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: We LOVE this hotel! The accommodations are fabulous for families or individuals with extended stays. Our room had a kitchen with everything you need already stocked.  The room was very spacious and smelled clean when we entered. Location is right across the street from Disneyland, California Adventure, and Downtown Disney. Our family was there to see a show at the House of Blue at the Garden Walk and it was walking distance. The staff was friendly and accommodating. There is a full hot breakfast available daily and it was delicious. There is a Starbucks and a Pizza place connected to the property and a Walgreens next door so it covered a lot of our bases for this trip.  There is also a pool, gym, and laundry facility on property, but we didn’t check it out.  It’s just nice to
Manager Response: Dear catfimple,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention Center. We our fortunate to have Starbucks, Disneyland, California Adventure, and the Garden Walk right out our back door.  I am pleased to see that you were able to see the amenities on property as well.  Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: On 8/10 we came back from Disneyland at 4:00pm to find the room was somewhat serviced but not finished. My kids took naps and the lady attempted to finish the room by  knocking on the door and finishing it, but I had to turn her away because the kids were sleeping by then. So my wife had to make the beds with clean sheets herself. On 8/11 we came from Disneyland around 3:30pm and found the room was not serviced at all. That day I had to ask for extra towels and toilet paper after a second request and never got the room serviced. Further, my wife had to take the garbage out herself. The staff did not seem to care that the room was not serviced and never apologized for any inconvenience, instead said that room service was running behind and offered to service it in the evening. I
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great service, we had a wonderful experience, it was my sons birthday we were having breakfast in the hotel and Ray our breakfast host did something amazing bringing a small cake to my son with the candle, we really appreciate the details and the breakfast was delicious!!! We had a great time! Brea at the front desk was also very nice. The room that we got to stay in was very modern, beautiful, and clean! We totally recomendable staying at this hotel and we will be coming again!  - the Estrada family
Manager Response: Dear Maria D,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/ Convention Center.  It give me great joy to see what Ray was able to give our son for his Birthday, as well as Brea. I will be certain to share your comments with Ray & Brea.  Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary Heading: Amazing Staff and Best place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: From the minute we checked in we were so impressed with the staff. Karen checked us in and was able to upgrade us to a larger room. She answered all of our questions and never made us feel rushed.  Throughout our stay, every employee was smiling and greeted us.  Pauline at the front desk took care of us when I lost my ticket for the garage and she also checked us out and asked how our stay was and took the time to listen to me talk about how sad I was leaving my daughter there for the Disney College Program. By time I left, I felt that Pauline was a friend and I hope both her and Karen are there when we return in October. The free breakfast was perfect and the staff was nice, patient, and seemed to enjoy their job even though there were so many guests and children running
Manager Response: Dear MSSC1987,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention Center. We our fortunate to have such a short walk to two great locations.  Thank you for recognizing Karen and Pauline. They both enjoy their work and strives to provide outstanding and helpful service to all of our guests. I will be certain to share your comments with them!   Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary Heading: Nice room with kitchenette overlooking Disneyland
Summary: Overall, nice, clean hotel & room.  Our room overlooked Disneyland.  Fun to see the fireworks each night.  A bit noisy a couple of nights with neighbors above & adjacent.  Very limited closet space.  It was just the two of us.
Manager Response: Dear Casadelray,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.   I am sincerely sorry to hear that there were nosy neighbors during your stay! Please always make the front desk staff aware so we can address those concerns.  I am happy to see you were able to enjoy the magical  firework show each night.  Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: Great location and an easy walk to Disneyland.  Rooms are spacious and clean. Breakfast was great, especially Chef George!  He's more than happy to make an omlette for you. There's a Starbuks and Blaze Pizza connected.
Manager Response: Dear Tricia P,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention Center. We our fortunate to have Starbucks and Blaze Pizza right out our back door.  I am glad to see you were able to enjoy our complimentary breakfast served by Chef George.  I will be certain to share your comments with Chef George!   Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary Heading: Great location and well run property
Summary: The location of this property is really good for those visiting the parks.  The hotel is new and has a clean modern feel. The front desk is friendly and helpful and the rooms accommodate families very well.  This hotel runs breakfast efficiently and there is enough space to serve a crowd.
Manager Response: Dear Kathy542  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention Center.   I am also glad to know that our staff provided you with friendly and helpful service and the hotel met your satisfaction!  Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: Stop reading this and just book it already! I booked the hotel for the proximaty to Disneyland. It was easily walkable even fine to walk at midnight when the park closed because plenty of people were out at that hour it felt safe. The room was spacious and bed was cozy! We chose a room with the kitchen which was very helpful and included every possibly item to prepare food.
Manager Response: Dear Jamie L,  Thank you for writing a review regarding your recent stay with us! I am very happy to hear that you enjoyed staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention Center. We our fortunate to have such a short walk to Disneyland.  I am pleased to see that you were able to utilize the amenities on property as well.  Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay for Disney Trip!!
Summary: My daughter and I traveled to Disneyland to celebrate her 30th birthday. We had the best time at Hyatt house Anaheim. We enjoyed our walk 1 mile walk each morning to the park, the hot breakfast buffet was perfect! We love the eggs, oatmeal, toast, sausage and coffee options.   It was such a good breakfast that we could skip lunch, saving money, and planned a fun dinner in the park for each night.  Our room was lovely, full kitchen including microwave and refrigerator and all the dishes we would need. We paid extra for a Disney view, but couldn’t really see Disney from our room,  so I wouldn’t recommend paying the extra money for the view, at least for the room we stayed in. The pool area and gym are very nice, clean and quiet. The staff were friendly and accommodating.  We had
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were here for a Disney visit. There were 5 of us that stayed in this room. It was a true 1 bedroom suite. I was pleasantly surprised at house new and clean this suite was, it was also very spacious and within walking distance to the Disney main entrance.
Manager Response: none

Summary: They have a biggest room in the area that we want to stay. Staffs are working very hard to support the place as well as the condition of your stay. Breakfast is included and actually good quality. It was a pleasure stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We loved everything about this hotel. Right when we arrived early from a 13 hr flight, Kelsey was so kind enough to let us check in early into our room as we were incredibly exhausted. The room was very modern, big and comfortable. The particular room we got was on the corner of a busy street so a bit noisy but really that was the only negative. The free breakfast was pretty good and overall found the staff at Hyatt House awesome, especially Kelsey. Location was really good too, just walking distance to Disneyland and also very close to a lot of great restaurants on Katella. Would definitely stay again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We are currently lodged here for our annual family vacation at Disneyland, there is no place better than this hotel with the feel of friendliness and the best Chef ever.  Chef Jorge made and the crew are excellent, courteous and they check on you on your table to ensure you're having the best meal. The concierge and staff are always sweet and looking for every reason to making your stay better. My family cannot forget this vacation ever. Located at a walking distance to the Disneyland parks, we took a break noon, went back to our room and returned to the park later to continue our fun. Highly recommended!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Spent 13 nights in July. Hyatt House didn’t live up to reviews about friendly and helpful staff on desk on arrival and I thought oh no. After travelling for about 16 hours with a 6 year old and 3 year old, I had to lug all suitcases onto a trolley while my husband checked in. Throughout, the staff, other than girl at the bar by the pool, I didn’t think any staff really went out of their way or were particularly friendly. However the location is great for both Disneyland and a number of eating venues outside of DL. Blaze Pizza below hotel super yummy, reasonably priced and open late. GardenWalk just down street with lots of choice. 10 minute walk to security for DL. Close enough to come back for a swim in the afternoon on a hot day and then head back to DL for evening. Pool bar
Manager Response: none

Summary: Would have rated much higher if not for the ridiculous practice of deactivating room keys exactly at 12 noon check out.  In my attempt to check out as close to noon as possible, I grabbed one of the limited luggage carts downstairs. At exactly 12 PM, all of our room keys were deactivated and I was unable to re-enter the room to grab belongings and go. HH wasn't able to clean the room any faster as a result, not to mention it's not a good way to win a customer. I will think twice about staying again, even though property is in a great location with free breakfast and nicely laid out rooms.
Manager Response: I want to thank you for choosing to stay with us and appreciate your feedback. My sincere apologies regarding your room key deactivating at 12pm. As our checkout is at 12pm, when the key is activated at check-in, our system automatically de-activates it with the checkout date and time through our system. Our staff does not physically de-activate the keys each day at noon for departing guests. Having said that, I can definitely understand how frustrating that was for you when trying to remove the last of your belongings. It's disappointing to hear that you left our hotel frustrated. I will certainly bring this to the attention of our Management Team and see what we can do to eliminate this frustration for our guests.

Summary: Just want to say a special thank you to Chef George for accomodating my picky daughter with those pancakes!  Also want to thank the young lady at the front desk for helping me with my rental car (sorry I didn't get your name!) on wednesday!  Would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed in a suite with our family of five.  This was a great value, especially with the Starbucks and Blaze pizza downstairs. We didn't use the in room kitchen because we were disorganized, but it was nicely appointed and would save even more if you use it.  Plus the hotel is nice, giving a great value.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had to wait longer than expected to check in as did other groups who waited in lobby for rooms to be ready. Nightly rate increased by $100 per night to pay for parking and add on taxes. Definitely not
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we are very sorry we did not exceed your expectations with the hotel service. I would like to explain our check-in policies and credit card authorization procedures. For guests that arrive much earlier than our 4pm check-in time, as you did, our front desk does their very best to provide a room as quickly as possible. As you were informed, we cannot always guarantee that your room will become available earlier, but our staff tries their best to accommodate this request. Unfortunately, this is not always possible, as was in your case. However, you were able to check-in by 4pm. In regards to the $100 per night in fees, all of our reservation websites, as well as our reservations department, explains our taxes and parking charges at the time the reservation is made. There is a $50 authorization towards your credit card upon check-in to cover any incidentals that you may charge to the guestroom folio. This is just an authorization and not an actual charge on your card. If no incidentals are charged to your room during your stay, then the authorization is released by the hotel upon checkout.

Summary Heading: A Great Stay - Close to Disneyland
Summary: My Wife and I stayed at the Hyatt House Anaheim Resort/Convention Center for four nights in July 2018. We booked the most basic King Room which happened to have an excellent view of the fireworks at Disneyland (they occurred nightly at 9:30 during our stay).   The room was nice and spacious and met our needs. We enjoyed the bed and bathroom. The furniture was in good repair, having a fridge was nice, and everything was clean. We stayed on the top floor of the hotel and found our room to be very quiet. There was definitely noise when families would return from Disneyland/DCA late at night - but that's no fault of Hyatt (Parents - a friendly reminder that your Children are likely capable of moving through hallways without running and screaming).  The hotel is well situated. We
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a great hotel, impeccably clean and catering for families. Ideal stay for Disney Land, just walk up the road about 15 mts.  So convenient is Walgreens under neath and Starbucks. All staff were happy and helpful. Nice pool to cool off in after fun at  the parks. A good breakfast is provided.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel is clean and updated. The beds were so comfy. We started in a family suite with one king bed, bunkbeds and a sofa bed. There were 5 of us and it worked out great.  Great pool area which was clean and relaxing.  We especially liked that there was a free breakfast buffet which offered a great breakfast selection. Hotel was a 10 min walk to Disney. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Top notch hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: Stayed with my family of five to visit Disneyland. Friendly staff, quick check-in, impeccable room with plenty of room for us all on the two double beds and pull-out bed. Kitchenette was a great bonus for midday break for lunches, plus freezer to freeze bottles of water for the 100'F heat! The pool was really nice and the perfect break from Disneyland. Great location only 10 minute walk from the park, with lots of helpful amenities nearby (Walgreens underneath the hotel was visited frequently!). We even caught an LA Angels baseball game one evening - only 10 minute Uber away. Breakfast was a great bonus - huge buffet with something for everyone and set us up nicely for the day. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if/when we come back, thank you!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Exceptional staff and cleanliness!!! Everyone was very friendly and made me feel right at home. Rooms were clean, smelled clean, and felt comfortable. The only drawback was the pull-out couch. It felt like pure springs, could not even dare sleep on it. Everything else was great!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a great time.  We will definitely stay here again.  Staff was very hospitable.  Rooms were spacious and comfortable.  We had a view of the fireworks.  Close to all kinds of restaurants.  Fitness room and pool are appropriate for this type of hotel.  The best place to stay for a Disneyland trip.  Walking distance to the entrance.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Visit to Hyatt House close to Disneyland
Summary: We had a great time staying at Hyatt house while visiting Disneyland. Since we spent most of out time at the park,the hotel was pretty much used for sleeping purpose. In that respect we were very satisfied. But the complementary breakfast lacked variety.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family stayed for 6 nights and this hotel was wonderful!  George, the chef, went above and beyond every morning for our gluten free needs!!  The only negative thing to report is the street noise and spotty housekeeping.  The room was super clean, but we had to ask for additional towels every night.  Everything else was fantastic!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: courteous service, very clean, central location, would recommend
Summary: courteous service, very clean, central location, would recommend!  Disneyland, the Anahiem Gardenwalk, and many nearby quality restaurants are within walking distance.  There's a Walgreens open 24 hours right next door for convenience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The place was great,friendly and clean loved having Walgreens so close unfortunately no shuttle provided but we took a lift to Disneyland. The room was great a full kitchen  with everything we need would definitely come here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here in July 2018. It is within walking distance of Disneyland. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The included breakfast is great since it allows you to eat before heading out for the day.  Also Blaze Pizza is on site and a great value.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great room, great staff. I felt very comfortable. The breakfast buffet was great!  A really nice variety of hot and cold foods. Something for everyone.  Short walking distance from Disney and California Adventure Park.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Family suite is great. Breakfast was pretty good. Very clean. Walking distance to Disneyland.  Overall, a nice place to stay.   The only thing I didn’t like is that they didn’t disclose the resort tax when I booked the room and parking is $18 a day. If you don’t do dairy milk, they don’t have any other option.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Easy walking distance right up Harbor to Disneyland makes this a good choice for families visiting the park.  All amenities are walkable as well, including an attached Starbucks, Blaze pizza, and pharmacy.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed 4 nights during spring break week.  Arrived to the hotel to find that the room I booked did not have the kitchenette (note all rooms do not include this feature if booking via a third party site). Front desk was helpful and processed a room upgrade no problem.  Our room had two queen beds and a separate living room with a pull out couch. The kitchen was decent size and although we did not use the stove or dishwasher, the mini fridge and microwave were worth every penny.  The underground parking garage was easy in/out.  We did not utilize the pool or breakfast.  During our stay we had a problem with noise from the above floor.  It sounded like children jumping off furniture, and it lasted throughout the night. We called the front desk twice and they said they sent security
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good for Families Being Close and Going to Disneyland - That is all.
Summary: - Very nice and helpful staff! - Good for families that wish to be within walking distance to Disneyland. - Everything else about the hotel is average at best. - Food menu (4 items) is a major thumbs down and complete after thought.
Manager Response: I want to thank you for choosing to stay with us and appreciate the feedback. It appears that your stay did not live up to the expectations that we strive for each day. Although you did not give any details as to exactly what areas are average at best, I will share your response with our Executive team to make sure our staff is delivering outstanding customer service with our guests each day. In regards to the 4 food items, it appears that you are referring to our Happy Hour menu that does only offer 4 items. We do have a full menu at H Bar and menus are provided throughout the bar and lobby area. Our staff would have been more than happy to order any items for you off of either menu.

Summary Heading: Wonderfull location for those visiting Disneyland
Summary: very good hotel, staff are very friendly, the breakfast does have a good variety, the room cleanliness was good, supermarket almost attached to the hotel and it is open 24/7, lovely Starbucks and pizza restaurant within the hotel premises
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very nice and large rooms, walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: I stay at this hotel every year. Some rooms have kitchens.  They have washer and dryers for laundry which is very nice if you are on a long trip.  All the rooms are very nice and large.  Its walking distance to Disneyland.  You do need to pay a resort fee and for parking.  Only reason for sleep quality was that we had very noisy neighbors with 9 kids.  Hotel did it's best and offered us another room
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Hyatt House is within walking distance to the Disneyland/California Adventure Parks.  The Suits are fabulous and accommodates large families, breakfast is included each day of your stay and it is great!  The room was amazing with a view of the fireworks display from Disney every night!!!  The staff is happy, the pool was awesome, the location in general was perfect! Great place to stay at a great price!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this fairly new property during our daughter's 4-day volleyball tournament at the convention center.  It was within walking distance to both the Gardenwalk the convention center.  We had a room with a king bed, twin bunks and a pull out sofabed.  The room was equipped with a small fridge, microwave and coffee pot.  Beds were comfortable and there was adequate space for all 6 of us and our belongings. The free breakfast was probably the best hotel buffet I've ever had.  Lots of selections and the staff were constantly replenishing the offerings.  They even had a chocolate milk machine which my kids loved and the coffee was piping hot.  The pool on the second floor was very nice and they had a small bar out there that also sold ice cream bars for the kids.  I also
Manager Response: none

Summary: Parking nightmare, staff unprepared to handle it, room was short a bunkbed but was efficient for MY family's needs. Clean, comfortable, decent breakfast minus the waffles. Within walking distance of Disneyland and California Adventure as well as other shopping and dining.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your recent stay at our hotel. I'm sincerely sorry for your frustration regarding parking at the hotel. As we have a large parking area, at times when the hotel is filled with families during a sold out situation, we've experienced more cars than normal. In regards to your statement of being short a bunk bed, I apologize that I don't quite understand what this is in reference to. Not all of our guestrooms have bunk beds, only the Family Suites. Did you perhaps receive a different room type expecting that it would also have a bunk bed? I would love to understand your concern. Please feel free to email me with clarification at debbie.plueger@hyatt.com.

Summary: Arrival: There were 5-6 people in line to checkin when we arrived but it moved quickly with three people working the desk to take care of the checkins.  We got some free bottles of water and easy directions to our room.  Room: The room was cleaned well with no leftover debris and everything in its place.  The beds were comfortable and the no issues with excess lighting in the bedroom at night.  The sleeper sofa was worse than most sleeper sofas, sleeping on the floor is a better option.  Soundproofing is good with no noise heard from either neighbor and no sounds of door slamming from the hallway.  The kitchen is outfitted with most everything you'd need if you wanted to prep simple meals in the room.    Breakfast:  The free breakfast is fairly cheap but the food quality is
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the hotel that we always stay at when we go to Disneyland. Beautifully decorated, rooms are always immaculate, nice choice of easy affordable food nearby for the kids. Walgreens and Starbucks directly below is very convenient. Kids love the pool. All of that plus friendly and capable staff. Consistently top notch.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed for four nights in this hotel in a Disney resort view room. It was about a 10-15 minute walk to Disneyland from here. The bed in this hotel was one of the most comfortable that I have ever slept in. The room was clean and breakfast had a good selection. We would stay again!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good Quality Hotel Within Walking Distance of Disneyland
Summary: Hyatt House is one of a number of Hyatt hotels near Disneyland (which can be confusing for transportation companies so be careful).  The hotel is a good quality family hotel within 5 to 10 minutes walking distance of Disneyland, with lots of dining options within walking distance including on the property.  The hotel is well managed, comfortable and with spacious rooms.  A good choice for families.  Good pool and laundry facilities.  The reception area can be busy at times when groups are arriving or leaving.
Manager Response: Thank you for your lovely review. We are glad that you appreciated many aspects of our hotel. At times our front desk can be rather busy, but our front desk staff does an amazing job in taking care of everyone's needs in an timely manner while delivering excellent customer service to each guest. We look forward to having you visit us again in the future, and we hope next time we can earn a 5 from you. Kind regards from all of our staff.

Summary Heading: Very nice place to stay with the family
Summary: Great location, clean rooms and very friendly staff.   We enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  Close to Disney, food, convinient stores and more.   Highly recommend this hotel.   Very easy to get to.  Only 2 years old.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Paulina on the front desk was very friendly and helpful! She takes the time to get to know you and make you feel welcome! Excellent breakfast and helpful staff there as well. Clean and comfy rooms! Great view of the fireworks at Disneyland!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent Location / Good Breakfast / Large Rooms for Families
Summary: We would highly recommend this for families visiting Disneyland parks.  This hotel is in an excellent location, close enough that we could come back to our room for a mid-day break.  The suites are large, though somewhat sterile in decor - ours had a separate living area (with pull out) and full kitchen, which provided enough space for the kids to separate. I found the decor to be somewhat sterile, but still very nice.  There is a full breakfast included with your stay (same each day, but good variety) which is a must when traveling with kids!  For lunch or dinner, there is a pizza place in the building and /or several restaurants within walking distance.  The pool is simple - a large in-ground - but there is a pool bar set up each afternoon.  Overall, this is a very good
Manager Response: none

Summary: Eight day stay at the Hyatt House was awesome!!! The breakfast was amazing! They have a Walgreens, Starbucks, and Blaze Pizza which made it extra amazing.  Great stay, can't wait to stay there again in the future.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I strongly recommend this hotel, every time I travel I always stay at Hyatt Regency, Hyatt House, or Hyatt Place and I've never been disappointed this one in particular was very clean, the staff was very friendly and they made me feel like I was at home. I strongly recommend this hotel... Plus it's walking distance to Disney
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location near Disneyland and family friendly
Summary: great location near Disneyland and family friendly. We love the bunk beds. Our room has mini refrigerator and microwave which is great. Also, great that blaze pizza and Starbucks are within the hotel premises.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Walking distance to Disneyland. Breakfast was average. No waffle/pancakes.Found little stain on the bedsheet.
Summary: Stayed ovenright only to see a friend.  Booked room with view but both of the windows were blocked by 2 tall Palm trees. Did not complain anymore since we onlly stayed overnight. Staff on duty that day were not very attentive to customer’s  concerns. Our needs were unmet. Overall, it was still a good hotel for family.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your recent stay at our hotel. I apologize that we did not meet your expectations and felt that our staff was not very attentive. Your comments will help us as we continually work to improve our guest experience. It also appears, now that we've been open for 2 years, that some of the palm trees have grown and no longer allow views from the guestroom. I will be bringing this to my Front Office Manager's attention in order to change the view types in our system. I hope that you will give us another opportunity if you're ever staying in the Anaheim area again.

Summary: This is walking distance from the park, and a short driving distance to Downtown Disney.  The staff was welcome and friendly, everyone from the front desk to the maintenance crew.  The parking was phenomenal, it's under ground, well lit, and color coated by area of the lot.  It felt a little like Disneyland, and I was okay with that.  Some people had a problem with the parking slip that lets you in and out, you just have to let the slip go from your fingers, and it will come back.  The king room was big and clean. It was a little expensive, but for the area, it was typical.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Came early from the Queen Mary to spend the day at Disney. Bre checked us in and gave us the parking pass so we could leave the car there and walk to the park (15 minutes only) and invited us to have breakfast first! His was extra nice because we were planning to pay for breakfast on the way to the park. Bre has a contagious smile and upbeat demeanor. Great first impression of the hotel.   After a very long day we walked back to the hotel and finished checking in. The room was clean, spacious, and had a great view of the Disney fireworks! We slept well and didn’t hear any neighbors. The shower amenities were top notch!   I would highly recommend this hotel if in the area. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great hotel with nice breakfast buffet and family suites with bunk beds and pull out sofa bed for kids. Close to Disneyland and California Adventure so we walked and didn’t need a shuttle. We love Hyatt hotels.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the kind review of our property. We look forward to having you back in the area!

Summary: The hotel is walking distance to the Disney parks and the rooms large and comfortable. The staff were great and always obliging. The breakfast is very basic and the room it is served in has no ambience, its more about cramming people in for a quick breakfast.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Happy with the service.  Staff was very helpful.  Room was clean and no issue.  Overall good experience.  Breakfast was okay and simple, but glad to have it as part of the room rate.  Location is convenient.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not a good value and poor customer service
Summary: Not worth the price. Paid a "discounted" price for a family suite for my daughters volleyball tournament. Her teammates had bigger rooms for $100 cheaper.  Was told one thing and when we arrived nothing was as it was said. Maybe this was miscommunication with the coach who booked the room or maybe not. Either way it was not rectified. I cried when I saw how small our room was for the price we paid. I’ve never paid so much for a tiny room in my life. I travel extensively for work and I’ve had much bigger suites for just myself for much less, let alone multiple people. I had to repeatedly ask for more towels daily. Sometimes more than once. Housekeeping had asked my son to leave the room two days in a row, so they could clean it but refused to let him in when they were done. Said
Manager Response: I want to thank you for choosing to stay with us and appreciate the feedback. It appears that your stay did not live up to the expectations that we strive for, and I would appreciate to explain a couple of your issues. In regards to your guestroom rate, as you did not book your guestroom through the group block, but with a AAA rate, you did receive the room type that you specifically booked while making the reservation. I'm sorry that you felt the room was small, but your team's coach did negotiate a group rate for our larger rooms, which is why they received our Studios. As your room was not booked through the proper channels to receive the group rate, you did receive the rate that was quoted to you at the time your reservation was made. I would like to offer my sincere apologies that you did not feel that your guestroom was cleaned appropriately. I spoke to our Director of Houskeeping and the 2 housekeepers that cleaned your room regarding this issue. I also asked the housekeepers why your son was not allowed to re-enter the room after they cleaned it. According to our housekeepers and their supervisor, there were no children in the room when they went to clean it. If your son approached the housekeeper afterwards, they would not be able to let your son in due to not knowing if he is an occupant of that room. This is done for the safety of all of our guests in the hotel. When your husband approached the front desk, Alyssa, our supervisor did apologize for the service issues and communicated to your husband that she is happy to offer one drink and one meal at our H Bar on a complimentary basis. As he requested more compensation, she reiterated to him that she is offering him only one drink and one meal and he agreed to that. The reason our supervisor called you regarding the meals was that you told the bartender that all of the meals were to be free, which is not what Alyssa communicated to your husband. The supervisor did, in fact, end up discounting your meals by 50%.

Summary: This hotel was convenient for Disney and significantly cheaper than the onsite Disney hotels of course. We made a good choice here because the hotel was easily walkable to both Disney parks and DT Disney.   In terms of the hotel itself, the rooms are spacious, comfortable and fairly quiet. The hotel facilities are fine and breakfast was OK. Staff were friendly, polite and efficient. I’d happily stay here again as it met expectations.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful review regarding our hotel, guestrooms, and staff. Of course, we are disappointed that we did not receive 5 stars based on this positive feedback, however, we hope that we have an opportunity to WOW you during your next stay in order to earn the 5 stars.

Summary: We stayed here while we visited Disneyland. The family room was good for the 4 of us. The pool facility was handy. The check-in time of 4pm was inconvenient given we arrived from Australia at 6.30 am. This late check-in time seems to be an American thing, we’ve experienced it a few times now, but never this late in other places we’ve travelled. Staff were ok,  it didn’t go out of their way.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us during your recent visit to Disneyland. A 4pm check-in time is quite the norm here in the U.S. Since our checkout time is 12noon, our housekeeping staff definitely needs enough time to clean the rooms appropriately for the next guests, especially during our very busy seasons when we are sold out each day. I normally suggest to our Australian visitors to book the night before their arrival to guarantee that their room will be ready when they arrive at 6:30am in the morning. We do try our best to check guests in prior to the 4pm check-in time, but it is a bit more difficult when the hotel is sold out. I'm disappointed to hear that you felt our staff was just okay. We pride ourselves in delivering outstanding and friendly service. I will definitely be discussing your review with our Front Office Manager.

Summary: There was a delay in checking into our room, but we did arrive early. The room itself was pretty much as described and had dishwasher, full size fridge, cooktop plates, cutlery etc. There was some noise from the room above on the first night of our stay, but it didn’t bother us too much. We paid for a Disney view room which gave us a view of the nighttime fireworks at Disney. I’m not sure We’d pay the extra money next time. We walked to Disney from the hotel each day of our stay - approx 15 mins. If you’ve got a car, then I suggest going to the Packing House for a meal. Lots to choose from, great quality food at a good price. The kids loved the buffet breakfast, plenty to choose from. An enjoyable stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: A pleasent suprise finding this hotel. Staff at front desk were some of the best ever.. rooms were lovely comfortable and unique. A great value. One of the best we've stayed at in the area and that includes the Disneyland Hotel. Look forward to returning .
Manager Response: none

Summary: What a rollercoaster visit this has turned out to be. Having arrived early morning from a long flight we were told to come back at 2pm for our room. When we came back at 2pm we were told the room was still not ready and to wait whilst they contacted housekeeping. An hour later the two very rude front desk staff thankfully ignored me meaning the duty manager, Alex got involved. He saved us (as we were Then told it would be 5pm before our room was ready as they were full the night prior- thanks for the early advice!!!) he let us have a different room to have a nap and shower in before moving us to our room at 530. Great save Alex. But... since then it has gone down hill. As a party of 3 we are using both beds and the sofa bed. The bedding on the sofa bed once pulled out was
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Right in the thick of things
Summary: This Hyatt House is located within walking distance of the convention center, Disney Resort, Garden Walk, and a host of restaurants.  It may be one of Hyatt's less luxurious properties, but you would never know it.  The rooms are well appointed.  The staff is Hyatt's usual friendly, helpful, and discreet quality.   Highly recommend this location for your next Disney or convention center outing.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect choice for a trip to Disney
Summary: Convenient location, we enjoyed the morning walks to Disney! They also offer a hot breakfast in the morning.  The rooms are clean, and the staff are really nice as well.  Also there are a lot of eating places nearby and a Starbucks in the same building.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hyatt House always delivers a wonderful stay, with larger sized room options, full free buffet breakfast, a large laundry room, more than adequate fitness center, personable staff and a good value for the price.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We visited the hotel in late May as part of our visit to Disneyland. We were a part of six including two small children. The hotel lived up to our expectations, good location it is a ten minute walk to the main gate. It is also well placed with a number restaurants in the area and a Walgreens 1 minute away.  Rooms were good with no distractions so we had no problem sleeping. The wifi worked well and we enjoyed the breakfast every morning. One of our party hired an electric scooter and the staff were very helpful. Would I stay there again? YES!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed in a family room. One king, twin bunks and full pull out couch. Nice size to accommodate our family of 6. Short walk to Disney and dining. Starbucks in the building was an added perk for this mom of 4!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for a trip to Disneyland. Absolutely beautiful hotel! I believe this is a newer property as well. Disney is about a 10 minute walk. Our room came with 2 queen beds, a cooktop, dishwasher and mini fridge. I think this hotel is absolutely fabulous!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stopped at the bar to kill some time while our daughters were at vidcon. Richard at the bar was awesome. This will definitely be our go to place when we are in town. Thanks Richard, we will be back!!  :)
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fun times at the Hyatt House bar
Summary: My friend and I had a few hours to kill in Anaheim and ended up at the Hyatt House bar. Richard the bar tender was fabulous!  He took great care of us and made delicious drinks while we waited. It was a very inviting and fun location to spend the early afternoon!  Thank you.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a good stay at Hyatt House in our recent trip to Anaheim.   The hotel was in fine condition, and our standard room was clean.  The hot breakfasts were excellent (scrambled eggs, sausage, pancakes, fruit, oatmeal, yogurt, fruit compote, etc.) and there was plenty of space in the dining room.  We also utilized the BBQ area near the pool which was perfect for our party of 20+.  Those were all well-appreciated but for our small standard 3rd floor room (with a pull out bed as the second bed rather than a queen), I did not feel that the $185 rate plus $18/day for parking was a good value.  It simply did not feel as if we got our money's worth for such a huge tab when we checked out.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your recent stay at our hotel. I truly appreciate the nice comments about the amenities our hotel has to offer. In regards to your room size, it appears that you did book our smaller room type. The hotel does offer spacious studios and one-bedroom suites that range in size from 490-600 square feet.

Summary: The location is perfect but the quality of the bath room was not good at all.The cleaning was not good.the coffee machine was dirty . After I checked out and received final receipt  ,They charged about $50.I called to ask about it but nobody answered me.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Rooms were nice and large. Hotel is big and it takes awhile to get to your room.  Breakfast room is very large and the food was just okay but it was fine. Pool space was very nice.  We will return.  Having food and grocery right there was great.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Close to Disneyland, within 15 minute walking distance.  Great buffet breakfast!  Clean rooms, basic kitchen needs included (mini fridge, microwave,  etc).  Parking was expensive, but underground lot was big and safe.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a great stay at this hotel.  Best complimentary breakfast we have ever had at a hotel.  Great service from all the staff.  We have already recommended this hotel to family and friends.  Looking forward to staying at another Hyatt in the future.
Manager Response: none

Summary: A nice hotel for families near Disneyland. I like the contemporary style decor. Also walking distance to lots of restaurants and Walgreens. Like hotel is equipped with a kitchen and laundry. Free breakfast included.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Walking distance to disneyland.  Huge breakfast area.  Clean rooms.  Loved the family suite w bunkbeds in a separate area w tv and sofa for the kids. Nice pool area.  Great value.  Will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is within easy walking distance of Disneyland.  The hotel is modern and very clean.  Great breakfast to start the day. Maid service is excellent.  Staff attentive to all our needs.  Great value!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had a reasonably good 6 days stay in May 18. The breakfast was reasonably fine but felt terrible having the same menu for 6 days. The Housekeeping was good and the linen etc was very clean. The front staffs were very helpfull.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Only 2 blocks from Disneyland, delicious free breakfast & super clean! I’m so glad we decided to stay at this hotel during our family Disney trip. We arrived a little early and had to wait for check in since our room wasn’t ready which wasn’t an issue because the lobby is super comfortable and the bar served amazing drinks. Since our room wasn’t ready 15 minutes after check in, our room was upgraded to a bigger one! It was a really nice gesture considering it was only 15 minutes late and we didn’t mind waiting. Would recommend this hotel to family & friends and would definitely stay here again on our next Disney trip!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family stayed at the Hyatt House for our Disneyland trip. Months before, I spoke with Pauline who helped book transportation to/from the airport, along with all confirmations.  She also made sure we had accommodations for our grandchild. I was taken aback upon arrival  when Pauline remembered me from our phone conversations. She made sure that we were comfortable, happy, and satisfied during our 3 night stay. Additionally, Daniel was great and Monica at the bar was pleasant and helpful. The hotel is pristine and has a buffet breakfast grand enough to please anyone! Also.....Starbucks on the corner, 24 hr Walgreens AND walking distance to Disneyland! Can’t wait to go back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Perfect for my sons birthday they really put time in to surprise me and my kids, they decorated the room for my sons 15th birthday! I was amazed with level of service and positive vibes. Great time and we will be back again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Booked a 3-night stay. I spent more to give kids the experience of bunk beds. Loved the clean smell and that the kids' suite was closed off by a set of sliding doors and they had plenty of room to spread out. Adult portion of room needed a good chair and space for sitting/tv watching. Bright, open parking garage that smelled good too! Convenient Walgreen's next door.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location Excellent for Disneyland Vaccation Stays. Quick Check-in. Housekeeping & Breakfast food quality can definitely be improved. Nice dinning options in the Vicinity. Overall Happy Experience. Cheers!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This Hyatt is the best yet!
Summary: The staff and hotel are well above standard. Rooms clean, modern and comfortable. Walking distance to Disneyland in 12 minutes. Victoria, he lead hostess was beyond helpful. After I left my wedding ring in the safe, she found it and called me as I was on the road. I came back and recovered my ring. Thank God for her efficiency and integrity. They serve a great free breakfast that you should not miss. You will not find a better hotel and value anywhere in Anaheim. Honestly It really doesn't get any better than this.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This place is in the best location for conferences and going to disneyland.  Awesome staff and place. I would take the family back to here with out a problem.  Also like that the room i was in had bunk beds for the kids!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at the hotel over Memorial Day weekend the hotel was crowded and overbooked. We arrived  30 minutes before official check in and was told my room was ready! We were on the 5th floor, which would have given us a view of the fireworks at Disney,  but never able to  watch them from  there. Except for a little trek to get to our room,  excellent stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Amazing stay at this great establishment!!!
Summary: Words cannot express how grateful we are for choosing this hotel while visiting Disneyland. I believe Customer Service is one of the most important aspects of hospitality and when staff goes above and beyond to please their customers means the world to me. Especially, I would like to mention and give a big thank you to Chef George for going the extra mile to make sure my family had a well-balanced meal since we aren't able to eat some of the things in the buffet. This guy deserves appreciation for his assistance in making sure everyone was taken care even in the most hectic environment of hungry people. Because of him, I will recommend this hotel to everyone I know.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Fabulous stay! Love the staff and the detail they provide. Made us feel right at home! They brought us all the extra amenities we asked for and breakfast every morning was wonderful! We asked to have our room face the fireworks and they had a great room waiting for us when we arrived!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Good location to Disneyland.  Rooms are comfortable and clean. Some of the front desk staff weren't very helpful or friendly.  Our requests put on the reservation were ignored--early check-in, location on a high floor and needed a crib.  It took 2 phone calls to get a crib brought to us.   We were told we would receive texts when our rooms were ready--we never received a text.  The elevators and hallways were uncomfortably warm--as if there is no AC.  The walls are pretty thin...we could hear noise from rooms on either side of us.  And as is typical with anything close to Disney, the hallways are VERY noisy from early morning to late at night.  I get that kids are excited to be at Disneyland and I love their enthusiasm, but parents, can't you teach your kids that running,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your recent stay at our hotel. I apologize that you feel that your requests were ignored, but I can share with you that we do everything that we can to accommodate the requests of our guests. Please know that we are not always able to provide early check-in and guarantee a high floor due to our high occupancy. As we were very busy during your stay with us, it makes it a bit more difficult to check in guests early when the guests departing have not yet checked out of their rooms. It then takes time for our housekeeping department to clean the rooms appropriately to prepare for the arrival of new guests. However, it appears that our staff did not meet your expectations regarding your request for a crib or even in contacting you when your room was ready. We are very disappointed in ourselves when we did not provide the level of service that is expected of us. For this, I sincerely apologize. There is no good excuse for our failure in this area. I truly hope that you will give us another opportunity to WOW you when visiting the Anaheim area again.

Summary Heading: If you don’t have an option stay here
Summary: I booked a room for four adults and was alloted a queen with two bunk beds, which were meant for kids. Why did they sell it to four adults? Wrong practice. When contacted front desk was told the other room can be given but for 180 usd additional per night. Any ways we managed two nights there and finally we were given a one bedroom with sleeper sofa which was like sleeping on iron rods. Changed 20 usd In addition. Staff was very rude except for one. Breakfast area was like charity food and I’ll mannered staff. Hey everyone there paid for this it wasn’t a charity for homeless. I will recommend stay here if you don’t have any option.
Manager Response: I want to thank you for choosing to stay with us and appreciate your feedback. It appears that your stay did not live up to the expectations that we strive for and I would appreciate the opportunity to discuss in more details the issues that occurred. The room type that you were given with the bunk beds is specifically the room type that you booked. The hotel did not allot you into our Kid's Suite, that is the room type you personally booked. When you approached the front desk to request a room change, the only room type we had available was our Specialty Suites, which is the reason the price was significantly more. After 2 days, our front desk made you aware that we now had available a one-bedroom suite, which you chose to accept. I'm sorry that you were disappointed in our breakfast, as we try our best to provide a nice, warm buffet breakfast with a large variety of items to choose from. Most guests are quite delighted by the variety and have wonderful things to say about how good the breakfast is.

Summary: We, a group of 4 including a 2 year old, a pregnant woman and a senior, checked in Anaheim Hyatt House on 27th at around 9am. We were told that the hotel was full the previous night and we were the third on the wait list. We were waiting in the hotel until 3:16pm and haven’t got a room at that time.  We found out that multiple group of guests who were behind us on the wait list have already checked in before us. So we talked to the front desk Victoria asked her about the situation. She didn’t say anything other than we need to wait till 4pm, and she threatened to ask us to leave the hotel. She did tell us that the guest who were in room 570 have checked out before 1pm, but she’s not sure when. We eventually got checked in at 3:52pm. My ultimate question is why can’t the hotel
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very nice and clean hotel . Only about 12 -15 minutes walk to the disneyland . The breakfast was very good . There is a Starbucks , a pizza place as well as a Walgreens within the hotel property.  The rooms were clean and spacious .
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best hotel experience, and amazing food
Summary: I can not say enough great things about the Hyatt House. They were incredibly accomidating, friendly, and knowledgable. We  loved every minute of our stay. Our room was so comfortable and slept out family of 4 just right. Impeccable cleanliness, 8 min walk to Disneyland. The breakfast spread was TOP NOTCH, better than any restraunt.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently stayed here on our trip to Disneyland it’s our 3rd time at this hotel.  Last year when we stayed here we did encounter the ant issue in the bathroom but it was quickly addressed and we saw no sign of this on this stay.  If it was not we would not have come back.  All in all a great convient hotel. 10 min walk to Disney and right by a Walgreens and blaze pizza.  The hotel does get busy so early check in is not always possible.  George and Margarita were wonderful when we arrived late for breakfast one morning they let us in and were very accommodating to our need. Thank you both!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: so happy I found this hotel
Summary: Stayed with my family at this hotel. Perfect 10 minute walk to Disneyland.  The suite was spacious with thoughtful amenities, esp kitchen.  Love the sitting area, generous sized queen beds, fluffly bedding.  The modern kitchen and room design were tops.  Hotel had great hot breakfast which I wasnt expecting, bacon, eggs, cereal, etc.  Hotel has parking, close to walgreens for needed essentials, an IHOP and a pizza place.  Would definitely return and recommend this hotel for larger famillies and extended stays.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was the PERFECT hotel for our family trip to Disneyland. Easy walking distance to the parks (about 0.5 miles--our 7 and 9 year old made the walk daily with no problems), very clean rooms, and fantastic service from every single staff member we came into contact with.  ROOM: As a family of 6 (me, hubs, and four kids ages 1-9), we often find it hard to find a hotel that can comfortably accommodate us, but we were more than comfortable in the 1 bedroom suite we booked. It was two rooms--a living room & kitchenette in one, with a separate 2-bed bedroom and a very spacious bathroom.  The space is minimally decorated but has a very tidy, streamlined feel to it. We were pleasantly surprised to get a partial view of DCA, and could see the fireworks nightly if we got at the right

The lobby is nice and they have a pleasant bar (the best part of the entire hotel).  We got into our hotel room, fairly nice, but small.  We walked to Downtown Disney and had a wonderful evening.  The next morning we were up early and went downstairs for breakfast.  The Hyatt has a great, big room set up for breakfast and it was very pleasant. The kitchenette and island area was well equipped with everything you would need to make your own breakfast, but why would you when the free breakfast was so exceptional. Until I find a better option, which would be very difficult, this will be the hotel I'll choose when I go to Disneyland.

Manager Response: I am disappointed to hear about your experience while staying at our hotel. Your room should have been serviced each day of your stay. The breakfast was fresh and had more options than the average free hotel breakfast. The staff were all very friendly and always greeted me pleasantly...even on a 5am coffee run to sbux. Manager Response: We take great pride in the service and accommodations we provide to each and every guest, so anything short of that does not live up to the standards that we believe in.
