You stated that you called the 800 reservations number and were quoted a rate of $125. Our front desk supervisor did his best to make a walk-in reservation for you, but unfortunately, in his system, it did not show any rate at $125. When making a reservation, we have to be able to pull a rate code that matches the rate that you were quoted. Our supervisor wanted you to be able to receive this reduced rate, but could not seem to make the reservation in our system at that rate. He suggested you call the 800 reservations number again and make the reservation through their agent in order to receive the reduced rate. Once that was completed, he even apologized for the inconvenience and offered you a complimentary upgrade into our Studio Suite. He did his best to help you and make sure that you received the reduced rate that you were quoted. In regards to the breakfast, at no time have we ever closed the breakfast down early. In fact, knowing that our guests tend to come down a bit later in the morning, if anything, we tend to keep the breakfast open 15-20 minutes later than what is posted.

Summary: First off i should say that i choose this hotel because of its proximity to Disneyland, it is only a long block and a half from the hotel to Disneyland. When we headed up to our room we literally had to walk half a mile to our room from the elevator! No joke, it was an 8-10 minute walk! We were exhausted by the time we got to the door! Customer service was poor, it took 3 days to get extra pillows! Not one employee even apologized!! I won't be
Manager Response: I want to thank you for choosing to stay with us and appreciate the feedback. It appears that your stay did not live up to the expectations that we strive for and I would appreciate the opportunity to discuss in more details. You are correct, we do not offer shuttle service from the airport, as is the case with every hotel in the Anaheim area. There are quite a few shuttles that service the Anaheim area from the area airports. As you stated, we are located close to the Disney Parks and within walking distance. We do not provide shuttle service (as most other hotels also do not provide shuttles) due to our proximity, but you can catch the Anaheim Resort Transit, which is the resort area transit that all hotels in the area utilize. We do have long hallways, but I believe you have exaggerated a bit on the time, as I walked the halls today and it literally takes 2 minutes from the elevator to the furthest room in the hotel. I do understand though that when walking with children or luggage it may seem longer.

Summary: Got everything you expect when you stay at hyatt ..great service ,good location.free breakfast was AWESOME .The ability for hyatt to loan you everything from a stroller to head phones was a blessing especially traveling with a 2 and 7 yr old ..easy access to restaurants and convience stores steps oyt the front door was perfect
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: Staffs are friendly and courteous. Room is fresh, clean and huge enough to accomodate a family of 5. The breakfast is very good but should be better extended till 11am.Will surely come back and stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The secret in Anaheim that frequent visitors don't want you to know about
Summary: My family and I (2 kids: 8 and 5) have visited Disneyland 3 times since 2014 and have stayed at three different locations.  First time, directly opposite the gate at Best Western Plus Park Place Inn & Mini-Suites; Second time, 3 blocks away at Hyatt Place; This time at Hyatt House.  By far and away, Hyatt House blows them all out of the water more than a ride on Splash Mountain.  This hotel is located directly across from the well-known CVS at the famous intersection of W Katella Ave & S Harbor Blvd (South-Eastern corner of Disneyland) and is a mere 0.7mile/1km or 10-15min walk from the lobby to the park's security checkpoint.  The hotel itself is only a couple of years old (it was literally scaffolding and covers on our last visit in 2015) so everything still looks new and
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the nice feedback! We greatly appreciate all of the kind words and we will make sure to pass along your words of praise to our staff. We always try to keep our rooms updated and fresh, we appreciate you for noticing that. Thank you again for your kind recommendation, we always love when guests love us so much that they want to tell their friends.

Summary: Great location and great facilities. Would definitely choose this hotel again! The Bunk beds and seperate area for kids was perfect for a family. It was an Easy walk to Disneyland and lots of restaurants close by to choose from.

Summary: Upon checkin was told our room was overbooked and was given a room with bunk beds. Was told we needed a full kitchen and was moved again to a room with one. The room had a bad smell and was very warm. Another negative occured when we requested the room to be refreshed while away at Disney. We returned at 5pm to find the room untouched. We did not want them to start cleaning while we were in the room because the kids needed to nap so we asked for the trash removed and. Ew towels. When we asked again for the room to be refreshed the cleaning lady looked pissed and glared at me as I walked out of the room. Upon returning to the room again she only poorly cleaned the kitchen floor and left the carpet areas untouched and beds not made. The room again smelled foul as the air from the
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is located about 2 blocks away from Disneyland so roughly about a 10-15 minute walk to the park. We liked how there was a Walgreens and a CSV store nearby and, there were also other amenities and restaurants near the hotel. When we first got to the hotel, we requested for a "quiet" room away from the elevators and the stairs because our son is a very light sleeper. Denise was the staff member who checked us in and she did her best to accommodate our request. It was not an easy task as the hotel was very busy. After waiting for about 45 minutes, Denise generously offered us an upgraded room at no additional charge as the standard room she originally planned to book for us was not yet ready. Denise upgraded us to a bedroom suite on the top floor away from the elevators
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stay in this hotel every time I go to Disney. I love the fresh and clean atmosphere and the breakfast is always delicious and hits the spot. It has a lot of selections. My sons play volleyball also and it’s also conveniently close to the sports center and we can catch Disney after their games. My husband now refuses to stay anywhere else because none other can compare. Love!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Family suite is small but sweet!
Summary: We stayed for 3 nights in November and were pleased with our choice. Everything is relatively new and clean. The beds were decently comfortable and our kids loved sleeping in the bunk beds. Towels and sheets are on the thread count lower end for a Hyatt brand. The location of this hotel is close enough to the parks that one of us could bring our toddler back for naptime which was great. Breakfast is good for a hotel buffet -- a lot of the food tastes pretty processed though (example: the scrambled eggs had kind of a fake butter taste to them). The parking garage was spacious enough but there were no electric vehicle chargers which was a bummer. Having Walgreens downstairs was also a lifesaver. Overall it was good value for a suite-style accommodation within walking distance to
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed everywhere in Anaheim, and once they built this property and I stayed there for the first time I was hooked. I will never stay anywhere else. The food, the location, the staff. AWESOME! They even have a Starbucks and Blaze Pizza downstairs but the free buffet breakfast is so amazing you just might only eat one or two meals a day! The staff always remembers me even on the phone. The moment I get to this hotel my stress level is cut in half because I feel like I am at home. I usually stay at Hyatt and I consider this the best overall property.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great clean hotel. Good walking distance to Disneyland. Kids loved the rooms and the pool. Breakfast was good.Would stay and recommend this hotel again if we went back to Disneyland. Has a pharmacy and convenience store next door

Summary: Very close to Disneyland 10 minute walk to gate. Was Clean,quiet,nicely furnished. Staff was polite and professional. Would stay there again over the very expensive on Disneyland  property hotels.  Give it a try.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your experience about your recent stay at our hotel. You are a most valued guest and we truly appreciate your wonderful feedback. We hope to welcome you back in the near future.

Summary: We’ve always loved this hotel. We came here when it first opened and now we visit at least once a year but the most recent trip was a let down. We were trying to hard wire our devices but were informed by the “engineer” on duty that there are no Ethernet ports on the premises. One of the outlets didn’t work next to the bed either and they won’t bring loaner items to your room. We were in one of the furthest rooms from the front desk and I would have to go out of my way to pick up extra items we needed. It’s just been such a bummer.  Now the saving grace is the cleanliness. The rooms are well maintained and it’s close to Disney. It’s just not practical from a business stand point if “there are no Ethernet ports on the premises”

Summary: Couldn't ask for a friendlier staff. Well appointed rooms, great breakfast w/GOOD coffee. Great location for quick walk to Disney. Only negative (not Hyatt's fault) is inceasing presence of homeless. Guess that's an Orange County/California thing.
Manager Response: Thank your for staying with us during your recent stay to Disneyland. I will be sure to share your review with our staff. We strive to exceed the expectations of our guests and truly appreciated your review.

Summary: Hyatt nailed this one, close proximity to park and well trained courteous staff.  Bunk bed room was large and free breakfast was included.  Wish they had bacon, omelette station or pancakes also.  Loved my stay!

Summary Heading: Had a nice stay at the hyatt
Summary: We stayed here for a few days in December.  Front desk employees were friendly and helpful.  Room was clean.  The free breakfast was good.  I love the huge area they had for it.  The pool area was nice.  The location was convenient...easy walk to Disneyland.   Would book again if we are ever in the area again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Family vacation with two teenagers to Disneyland and surrounding area.  Proximity of hotel to the park was good. Hotel was clean and room size and layout was amazing.   Would stay again.

Summary: This hotel was great - the lobby is so big and open, very clean! The seating for the breakfast was also very open, we never had a problem finding a table and never had to wait for food, and the breakfast was great!   Room although already showing a bit of wear and tear was nice and big, it was great having a fridge and microwave and the walk to Disney wasn’t too bad at all! A bath tub would have been nice (as we have a 2 year old) but wasn’t too much a problem. Was also great having a Starbucks and Walgreens on site, and the pizza (blaze) was so good!

Summary: My family stayed here during our Disney trip.  I couldn't have found a better place to stay.  It was convenient, clean and my husband loved the fact that the parking was accessible via elevator.  The breakfast was great with lots of selections.

Summary: Nice hotel but very loud.  You can hear everyone around you and not good cleaning of rooms  The breakfast was good except for the fruit its either old of not ripe.  The parking is good and its walking distance to disney

Summary: Hyatt House is in a great location, 10min walk to Disneyland. It's very clean, comfy beds and good breakfast. Is conveniently located near Walgreens, I hop and the yummy blaze pizza. We loved our week long stay.

Summary: The Hyatt House is incredible. It is perfectly in the middle of the convention center and Disneyland as well as other great restaurants and hotels. The guest rooms were beautiful and housekeeping always made sure to leave the room as clean as possible. The staff members at the front desk and food area were very polite and always had a warm greeting. I highly recommend this to anyone visiting Disneyland or attending a conference!!

Summary: My family and I moved to this hotel after the first one we booked turned out to be a huge disappointment. We called first thing in the morning and were advised that we were able to check in early which was fantastic. We booked a one bedroom suite which was a perfect size for our family of 4. The room was very modern and clean, with a kitchenette and coffee maker etc. The bathroom was also huge.  The hotel is in an excellent location - only a 10 min walk to Disneyland or if you don’t feel like walking you can catch the shuttle from the hotel next door. There is a Walgreens, CVS, Starbucks downstairs and other food chains within walking distance.   I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Disney!

Summary: The Hyatt House is a 10 to 15 minute walk to Disney. Every staff member we encountered were friendly and professional. The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. The room has central air and heat, big plus. The complimentary breakfast was the best I've had in a long time. We ate in the hotel one night and the food was delicious and fairly priced. There is a Walgreens right in the same building. We ate at Blaze pizza around the corner, very good. It was a build your own pizza place.We stayed 3 nights total. When I go back, I will definitely stay at the Hyatt House.

Summary Heading: Amazing hotel, walking distance to Disneyland!

We were all able to get into our Pj's and watch the fireworks away from the crowds at Disneyland.  The rooms were very clean and the free breakfast was pretty extensive, not just a continental breakfast that you get at other "free" breakfast hotels. Summary: Hyatt house Disneyland perfect for watching fireworks.  Room charge is more but very reasonable room had full kitchen plus tv got all premium channels hbo showtime max all on dish tv. Starbucks underneath hotel and Walgreens and cvs on both corners

Summary: Generous rooms, generous breakfast . Very helpful staff. Will visit again and will definitely recommend the hotel to our friends and family. Conveniently located near Disneyland. Also having Starbucks and Walgreens in the same building was helpful. Parking was plentiful too.

Summary: Within walking distance to Disney. Food and convience stores right there too! Rooms were comfortable and good for many size families. Free breakfast was great amenity. Would definitely stay again and recommend to others.

Summary: First time stay at a Hyatt house property.  This place seems very new at the time.  Hotel is within a 2 block walk to Disney entrance or California Adventure. Juice machines, plain and chocolate milk and coffee.  We very much enjoyed a big breakfast prior to our trip to Disney each morning.  Our room was nice with a cooktop/microwave/fridge/dishwasher.  Layout of our room was a little strange as behind the door into the bedroom was the door for the bathroom and you could not open both without hitting. But short of that I would stay here again.

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay. Great location to Disneyland with a great breakfast buffet. Very clean, comfortable rooms. We were a group of 5 staying in the family room. We will stay  here again the next time we come to Disneyland.

Summary: The Hyatt House is located about 1/2 mile from the Anaheim Convention Center and very close to Disneyland as well. It keeps everything clean and neat.  My room was great.  Good size, comfortable bed, large bathroom, frig, microwave, large closet and drawer space, and MANY electrical outlets.  The outlets seemed to be everywhere. Maybe 10 or 15 places to plug things into. Amazing.  Would definitely stay here again for meeting in Anaheim.

Summary: This property was perfect for every thing my family needed for our visit and Halloween Party at Disneyland. *Located walking distance to Disneyland *Clean *Free Breakfast *Rooms accomidated multi sleepers *kitchen *Pool- cozy *outlet mall roughly 2miles away *Quiet *Good for singles and families

Summary: We spend 3 nights and we had a great experiemce. The room is very nice and clean. It is at 10 min walking to Disneyland. Brekfast is included. Definetly I recomemd this hotel if you are planning to visit Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great option for families for Disneyland
Summary: Just got back from Hyatt House and had a great experience! Highlights include: -Extensive buffet breakfast with eggs, pancakes, sausage or bacon, hash browns, cold cereal, toast, cut up fresh fruit, oatmeal with toppings, juices & milk. It got pretty busy but the staff was clearing tables as soon as they got up. -great option for families with bunk bed suites & windows facing Disney -full mini kitchens in suites but not bunk bed suites -comfy beds  -motorized scooter rentals for $40/day instead of $50/day at the park -brand new rooms & facilities -attentive staff  -very close proximity to the park - I think we passed only 3 other hotels before we got to the entrance -walking distance to Bubba Gump Shrimp, Press Pizza, and many others -Starbucks next to the lobby $17/night

Summary: Booked this hotel to be close to Disneyland. It is a perfect location. Two blocks from the Park entrance. Parking was 17.00 per night. cheaper then most place. The parking is located under the hotel with an elevator for easy access to the rooms. there is a Walgreens right in front of the hotel which is very convenient. The room was clean and spacious, the bed very comfortable, and the breakfast was excellent which is included. They had the usual breakfast foods using two sides of a room, a coffee/tea/hot chocolate section as well as a section for milk/chocolate milk and juices. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend this hotel.

Summary: I’d do it all over again! Family loved it and it was very family friendly. Courteous staff, great location, and very clean. Check in and check out process was very easy. They even left a surprise for our little one on his bed because it was his birthday! Booking for the next trip now!

Summary: Decided to stay here to be close to Disneyland and this hotel didn’t disappoint! Nice big room and got to face the fireworks that were on around 9.30pm.   Only downside is the room needs more sound insulation as we got a room with connecting doors and could hear the next door neighbors whole conversations and loudness too!  Was really annoying.   Also a kettle in the room would be good too. Overall a nice stay in a nice hotel to stay and close to everything!

Summary Heading: Great hotel but staff is awful...
Summary: Great price and location.  Love the online check in and early check in was amazing.  Lots of breakfast options and it was pretty good!  However a family member left his prescription sunglasses in the room and no one would help him find them.  They left us waiting in the lobby for an hour for someone to talk to and no one came.  He called back the next day and they said they didn’t have them.  It’s close to $1,000 to replace them due to his speciality prescription and no one there even cares.  Very poor customer service.
Manager Response: I want to thank you for choosing to stay with us, and I appreciate your feedback. It appears that your stay did not live up to the expectations that we strive for, and I would appreciate the opportunity to explain in details the issues that you faced. You contacted our Front Desk Supervisor regarding the missing sunglasses. He personally went up to search the room. Unfortunately, he was not able to locate them. He also spoke directly with our Director of Housekeeping and with the housekeeper than cleaned your room upon checkout. Again, neither of these team members found sunglasses in the guestroom. Although I feel that our staff did everything that they could to try and find your sunglasses, I am sorry that you felt no effort was made. It is never our intention to make a guest think that we did not care.

Summary Heading: If you stay ask to be in center area close to elevators because walk is to far from elevators to suites.

Summary Heading: Very good choice for visiting Disneyland
Summary: We stays with two kids and we wanted to live in a large room. Hyatt hotel turned out to be higher than our expectation. We stayed in the very new room with fully equipped kitchen, two large beds and a sofa. So, we could rest when kids were playing and, vice versa. Pool and vortex were not large but pretty clean. Breakfast was free and it was the largest choice we had met in US hotels.  Hotel located very close to Disneyland with several big grocery stores just in several meters from the hotel. It was very convenient because after a day in the park with kids we felt really exhausted. Probably other hotels around are not worse, but the price in Hyatt was very low. As we needed just to have rest for one night with no any other activity in the hotel, we really enjoyed what we got

Summary: Great hotel in close proximity to Disneyland and Downtown Disney. The full kitchen concept was wonderful. We will be sticking to the Hyatt brand as well, we loved everything about it. The walk isn't far, as long as you have kids 5 and over, or you bring a stroller. It is about a 10 minute walk to Downtown Disney. Another plus about this hotel is there is a Walgreens and Starbucks downstairs from the hotel which makes it very convenient to get things. Love love love this hotel!

Summary: Just got back from a 4 night stay in Anaheim to visit Disney. Stayed in a family room with bunk beds, the children loved the fact they had a separate room with own TV too and even better free WIFI across the hotel. Rooms were clean and comfy.  Hotel location was perfect a 10 min walk to Disneyland quick and easy. Also a lot of food places close by to grab dinner out or a supermarket across the parking lot. Summary Heading: Location, cleanliness and awesome breakfast bar!
Summary: We just came back from our first stay at this hotel. We normally book at the Hyatt Regency up the road but we thought we'd give the Hyatt House at Anaheim Resort a shot because of its proximity to the Disney resort. I'm convinced this is the best option for anyone visiting Disney!   LOCATION/AMENITIES : I was tired of waiting for the shuttle that took us to the Hyatt Regency whereas the Hyatt House is a short 15 minute walk from Disneyland. The hotel is also situated close to dining (Cheescake Factory, Bubba Gump, etc) and CVS.   Starbucks is at the base of the hotel, as is a Walgreen. Laundry facilities on the 5th floor and a pool for guests. We didn't need to drive anywhere for anything, it's all very very close.    FOOD: Most Hyatt House breakfast bars including custom

Summary: The hotel was clean. We had a bunk room and the part of the room with the king bed was SMALL. The walls are paper thin. Whenever anyone showered in the rooms around us, it was as loud as our shower in our room. We could hear everything in the rooms near us. The fire alarm went off in the middle of the night (false alarm) and there was no compensation or even any apology. The breakfast was delicious and changed every morning. There were SO many options which was great. The location was great also. Parking was $17/day which is too much considering you are already paying a higher price for this hotel but I think a lot of the hotels around Disney are charging these days. Overall it was a fine hotel. If we found a deal we would stay here again but definitely would t pay a premium

Summary: No recognition for WoH top tier status.  Staff trained to say "no" to typical business traveler snafus like late checkin, online preferences, special needs.   Joe Sixpack probably likes the hotel fine, as the breakfast is good and it is across from Disneyland.  Not ready for business travelers yet.    Staff doesn't "get" road warriors' needs, and resents requests, no matter how simple or well justified.   Felt wholly dissed.   Won't be back.
Manager Response: I want to thank you for choosing to stay with us and appreciate your feedback. It appears that your say did not live up to the expectations that we strive for. I would like to attempt to explain a couple of the issues you faced. Since your online check-in failed (through no fault of the hotel), you credit card information did not come through. Unfortunately, we cannot check in a guest without credit card information. I do understand how inconvenient it was for you to look through your bags for the correct credit card after a very long travel day. However, as a frequent traveler, you do understand that all hotels need some sort of credit card on file for payment prior to any check-in. As our front desk supervisor explained, she only suggested coming back to the front desk at your convenience with the correct credit card in order to avoid charging your personal card. At times it does seem that hotel policies may cause frustrations with our guests, but please understand that our supervisor did her best in trying to explain to you the circumstances.

Summary: As someone who usually does research before I stay I was shocked by the poor experience at this new hotel.  Upon arrival there was a large yellow stain on our fitted sheets. I spent the evening after we returned vacuuming ants out of our bags and laundering everything.  When I notified the front desk of this they stated they would spray the room with an insecticide, this stopped the ants from coming in but didn't kill the ones already cozy in our room. After the room was sprayed I broke out in hives which I assume was a reaction to the insecticide.   Upon checkout I tried to give the hotel the opportunity to address my concerns by emailing their

Typically, when you email customer care, it first goes through the process at Hyatt Corporation before the hotel actually receives the information. Please reach out to the hotel directly or email our Assistant General Manager at richard.rosales@hyatt.com so we are able to discuss the issues you experienced.

Summary: I read the reviews about long hallways and I thought the people were crazy for talking about that. But it's so true! Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was just about perfect! It was a super close walk to Disney. It was clean. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The daily breakfast was amazing - delicious, hot and with a great variety! We all slept great and enjoyed our stay. I would go back.

Summary: Great location, easy walk to Disneyland and area stores/restaurants. Great price for comfortable, clean room. Walgreens next door. Easy access to freeways and other tourist spots.  Free breakfast!  Would stay there again any time.

Summary Heading: Perfect location for Disneyland and SoCal

Summary Heading: Our best Disneyland hotel experience to date!

Summary: We stayed here as a launch point for visits to Disneyland and Disney California Adventure in addition to out of town attractions. The rooms are very large and comfortable. When you stay in a hotel for 5 or more nights (I’m guessing that many of their guests stay as long) a little variety in the breakfast offerings would have been welcome. The selections provided are by and large fresh and tasty, but there is literally no variation on a day to day basis. Would stay here again but would plan on eating breakfast elsewhere during my stay. Quite a shame as it discounts the added value of an on site breakfast.

Summary Heading: Last night of long trip made easy!

Summary: We needed a hotel in the area because we were going to Disneyland.  This hotel is quite new and the room was spacious. I like a firm bed, but my husband prefers a bed that is softer.  I thought the beds were okay, he said they were too firm.  The room was clean overall, but there were a couple of areas that I cleaned myself (kitchen cabinet pulls, etc. were sticky).  If you want a hotel that is within walking distance (12 minute briskly paced walk) of Disneyland and is new and modern, this could be your best bet.  At $160/night, I felt it was a good value.

Service was outstanding as staff went above and beyond what I'd expect from a economical family hotel. Short walk to Disneyland. Great Selection!

Love our suite, great customer service, busy place.  It was my bday wkend, i told the guy at the pool bar it was my bday n after we left the pool n hour later Olivia one of the reception person came n brought me a slice of cheesecake with HB writting on it... What a service.  I will most def stay there again!!

Summary: Loved the location, but service and room readiness need to be worked on. Noticed people consistently waiting for their room to be ready, even later i to the evening.  Breakfast was subpar. The bar looked nice, although we didnt use it. The pool was nice as well. Room cleanliness was hit or miss.
Manager Response: Again, thank you for your feedback and we look forward to when you can stay with us again when you are back in Anaheim!

Summary Heading: Brand new hotel, but you can skip it.
Summary: We were very excited to stay at this brand new hotel, that had bunk beds and free breakfast.  But upon check-in we realized that this hotel already was showing signs of disorganization.  The front desk area was in full view of customers and was messy and dirty.  One gal to check in everyone, at 4pm.  $17 a day to park.  Dirty bathrooms.  And, the bunk bed rooms are the tiniest rooms in the hotel.  No, sound insulation. Hallways are extremely long.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean, but the pictures are deceiving
Summary: Specialty Family Suite w/ Bunk Beds | King Bed (plus sofa bed) was the room we had, although it was very clean, (which to us is the most important, ) it was exceptionally small.  We stayed for 3 nights, and a suite is usually a nice size, but this one was really right.  The breakfast was really good, and complimentary, but for the price, I just wasn't impressed.  Photos on their website are very misleading.  I expected more from Hyatt.  In addition, the staff was not that nice, kind of  cold attitude.  Would I stay there again, ??? For the cleanliness, yes, but not for any other reason.  Oh, and our room view was a brick wall, not pleasing to the eye, sorry Hyatt. Also, computers were down, and they take a copy of your personal info, which is stapled and left in their files
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback, and we are very sorry we did not exceed your expectations with the hotel service. I have shared your review with the Front Desk Manager, and he will definitely discuss your thoughts with his team. In regards to the Kid's Suite, I do want to share that the pictures are true to what the guestroom looks like, and that we have, in no way, altered the pictures to make the room look any different than what it is. Also, after discussing your concern with your personal information, it was communicated to me that the paperwork is not kept forever. The information is kept in a lock cabinet and then shredded after departure. Being located in the heart of the Anaheim Resort area, some guestrooms are going to have views of other buildings. However, 3/4 of our guestrooms do have city views or pool views. We would love the opportunity to welcome you back and truly hope that you will give us another opportunity to exceed your expectations.

Summary: Our first family trip to Disneyland. Hotel stay was perfect so we could enjoy our time at Disneyland.  Easy, short 8min walk. Very convenient having Starbucks and Walgreens at the hotel. Parking is a breeze, always had space. Staff was very friendly.

Summary: Room was ready at our early 1:30 check-in after the flight from Oregon. Perfect view room of the park fireworks. The front desk was fantastic. Thank you Danielle for a great stay. Breakfast was very good with lots of hot food and strong coffee.

Summary Heading: Hyatt House is now MY house!

Summary Heading: Please Don't Tell Anyone About This Place!!!!

Summary: We checked in Monday (7/24), & so far, not disappointed with the  accommodations. The hotel overall is nice & clean. You do have to pay for parking @ the hotel. But remember, almost all hotels around the Disneyland Resort charge for parking. The staff @ front desk are friendly & helpful. Walgreens is right next store & also a CVS across the street. Our room (studio kitchen suite with veiw) is a good size & most important, clean. You can see the fireworks show from the room. The mini kitchen is a plus. It has a stove, microwave, dishwasher & mini fridge. Bathroom is a good size. Housekeeping staff is on it, they'll give you what you need in a jiffy. Hotel lobby is big with a bar. Price of drinks at the is what you'd expect, a little pricey but no different that a club or drinks a

Summary: We stayed two nights in a suite with a king bed, sofa pullout, and bunk beds. The room was very comfortable and roomy (plenty of room for six of us)! The free breakfast was delicious as well. They actually helped people get food if they showed up late.   I wanted to thank Heather & Denise at the front desk for going above and beyond. I got back from Disneyland after midnight with a sandwich. I asked if they had mayonnaise or mustard packets, which they quickly retrieved for me from the kitchen, without any hesitation! It may sound like a small gesture, but it isn't, compared to other hotels that don't help at all. Thank you! We're definitely coming back!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for posting a review about our hotel after your recent stay. We greatly appreciate your feedback on your experience.

Summary Heading: First time trying this location and definitely our last
Summary: We arrived early about 1pm and thought we'd see if our room might be available. We were told our room type was not ready and that they would call us when it was. So we checked in our luggage and headed to Disneyland. We didn't hear from them so we called at 5:30pm and was told our room was ready. We left the park and when we tried to check in they told us that there was no room available.  After 15 minutes of going back and forth with the manager the other front desk clerk said that she was the one that told us our room was ready and that she assigned it to us. Then we were told the parking was sold out and that there were no more stalls. Then after another 5 minutes they told us that it would be okay to park there.  We thought it couldn't get worst but the room they assigned to
Manager Response: I want to thank you for staying with us and appreciate your honest feedback. It appears that your check-in process did not live up to the expectations that we strive for. I do want to explain that there seemed to be some miscommunication on the part of our Front Desk staff. The reason you were told that the room was not available is because the Front Desk agent specifically blocked your room for you when it became available through housekeeping. Once that is done, it takes it off the list that shows available inventory. When you came back to check in, the associate helping you was unaware that your room had been blocked. There definitely was a communication breakdown between the associates which did not allow you a seamless check in. Their intentions were truly to take care of you and make sure that your room did not go to another guest. It was a busy night when you arrived and parking was busy, but again, perhaps it wasn't communicated in the best way possible as to where you should park since there definitely was parking available. Your feedback will help us a we continually work to improve our guest experience, which is always our priority.

Summary Heading: Great hotel!  Convenient location and a good free breakfast.

Summary Heading: Newest and the best hotel outside the Disney bubble! (Read my PRO-TIPS!)
Summary: Lobby: -Beautiful, spacious, great theming, lots of couches, chairs, and tables to sit down and relax.  -There is a bar/eating area as well  Check-in:  Smooth 10 minute check-in, good customer service, answered all our questions (Pro-Tip) I called a few a weeks before our arrival to confirm our reservation (Pro-Tip) I called a few days before to let the front desk know we were checking in after 12am  Breakfast:  Free w/ hotel stay, buffet style, very good selection, 7am-9:30am (M-F), 6:30am-10am (Weekends)  Room Type/View:  #431, 4th floor, 2-queen beds w/ kitchen Views of the pool, parking lot area, and the Red Lion Hotel  Room Info:  -Very nice and contemporary, love the color theming (mostly grey, blueish) -Feels like home away from home -Dark wood vinyl flooring plus carpet

Summary Heading: Nice hotel. Think we caught it on a bad day.

Manager Response: I want to thank you for choosing to stay with us and appreciate the feedback. It appears that your stay did not live up to the expectations that we strive for. The last thing we want to do is give people the impression that we do not care or that we do not empathize with your frustrations. Unfortunately, due to our current weather, it is that time of year that we tend to see ants. The hotel takes many precautions each day to eliminate this issue, however, sometimes these little buggers still find their way into a guestroom. Please know that I will be following up with our staff on how they may be able to handle these types of situations better in the future to make sure that our guests know that we are trying our best to exceed their expectations during their stay at Hyatt House.

Summary: This is a great property and easy access to Disneyland.  Our room was comfortable and clean the entire time of our stay.  We were celebrating our daughter's birthdays and everyone enjoyed their stay.  The staff was courteous and accommodating to our needs.  Will definitely be coming back!

Summary: Wonderful new property!  Amenities are great for families with an infant and who needs to boil/sterilize bottles as kitchenette was stocked.  Staff was able to accommodate multi room requests to be clustered together.

Summary: My family and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, and I have to rate the overall service as poor.  We booked a flight/hotel package through Expedia (we would not do this again), for 5 people.  As we got to the hotel early, our room was not ready, and was asked by hotel staff if they could call us when the room was ready.  We gave our number, but never get called during the day.   When we made it back to the hotel later in the evening, we asked to get checked in, and found the room accommodated 4 people,( 2 queen beds and large chair) not 5 as we had booked.  When I explained the situation, hotel staff said there was no room avail for 5 people, and offered to sell us an additional room.  We decided to make this work.  (NOTE: if you end up w/ the double Queen Den room, and have a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share our experience about your recent stay at our hotel. You are a valued guest, and we are sincerely sorry that we did not exceed your expectations during your stay. In regards to the room type you booked, it only accommodates 4 people. We do experience quite a few guests booking the room type when the information clearly states that it cannot accommodate more than 4 people, then they are dissatisfied at check-in because there is not enough bedding for the whole family. Having said that, I researched Expedia for your room type and found that they had the incorrect number of people listed. This had been corrected in the past, and for some reason they are again showing the incorrect information. I spoke with our front desk and they did assume that the correct information was given to you at the time that you made your reservations with Expedia. Our front desk should have asked you further questions in order to remedy the situation in a manner that was satisfactory to you and your family. Your comments will help us as we continually work to improve our guest satisfaction. Should you ever visit the Anaheim area again, please feel free to contact me personally. We would love the opportunity to make it up to you with an upgrade into our Suites.

Summary: Absolutely LOVED this hotel!!! Walking distance to Disneyland and many shops and restaurants. Rooms were amazingly roomy and clean. Staff was wonderful. Summary: We visited with the kids and went to Disney.  It was very close and the hotel was clean, friendly staff. Overall great experience.  I will stay here on my next visit. Manager Response: I want to thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us. I do wish that the bathroom had a standing shower instead of a bathtub with a shower curtain, but that's a small detail that we were able to overlook. Manager Response: none

Summary: We truly enjoyed our stay here. Rooms were roomy and clean. Staff was friendly and accommodating. There were plenty of options at breakfast. We really enjoyed our stay and the proximity to Disneyland. We will stay here again.

At a super reasonable price, we got a 1BR suite with full kitchen (not to mention a huge bathroom!) and breakfast included, parking, Starbucks, and Walgreens drugstore all onsite, within walking distance of DL's bus entrance (about the same distance from DL Hotel or Paradise Pier hotel to the park). Summary Heading: Great Hotel within walking distance of Disney Parks

We asked for a room that we would be able to see the fireworks and Danielle made it happen.  There's a walgreens right in the parking lot which was very helpful. Manager Response: none

Summary: I love staying here best hotel ever! The hotel is very comfortable and very clean. They have an awesome staff they are very helpful friendly and funny! Everything is close don't need too travel very far for anything and they built a Starbucks downstairs 😁

Summary Heading: Best Hospitality Ever! Can't wait to return!
Summary: My family and I stayed for 5 days and had the most wonderful experience because of the staff. Manager Response: Thank you for your beautiful review. Our staff members are thankful for your kind compliments. We strive to create wonderful memories for every guest.

Summary: This was our first time staying at the Hyatt House in Anaheim and the service was awesome! Great front desk staff and we got upgraded to a corner family suite. Free breakfast was great and convenient.

Anyway, the facility itself is pretty new. The Starbucks downstairs wasn't even open yet. The decor is a bit modern/boring, but again, everything's new. There are four elevators. They weren't the fastest, but we also didn't experience any crazy waits. The hotel's pretty large, so they wisely set up their breakfast area to handle a large crowd. There's
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to Anaheim. Typically, when there seems to be a glitch with the parking gate, our front desk will open the gate immediately so no guests has to wait to exit. Those hotels that do not charge parking typically are located quite a distance from the Parks. I hope you will still consider staying with us again during your next trip to Anaheim. Summary: Overall stay was good. Daily cleaning could have been a little better. Staff at the front was really nice and the majority or the breakfast staff was great. It was a short walk to the parks. We had 1.5 year old in the stoller, 5, 8, and 9 year old walked back and forth no problem. Breakfast food was actually better then expected. We stayed at the Marriott Residence Inn and the Hyatt has better breakfast. Overall we would stay again for the location and value.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I'm glad it was a free night
Summary: I would have been disappointed if I had paid for this room.   Since it was a free night, it suited the purpose.  The room was noisy and the sound of the air conditioner and elevators at night were very loud.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'll make this short: Great staff Great rooms Great breakfast with tons of seating Great location Great bathrooms Great pool with a great bartender  Stop looking for a Disneyland hotel (Or an Anaheim Convention Center hotel)  Stay here.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you are looking for a hotel filled with friendly staff that is a short distance to the entrance gates of Disneyland, this is it! Only a 10 minute walk to Disneyland, this hotel is PERFECT for your trip. Hyatt House has a great variety of rooms. With 2 children, we opted for a room with a king bed and a set of bunk beds (room 402). The bunk beds are located in a separate part of the room that you can close off with sliding doors. There are 2 TV's in the room, one in front of the king bed and one in the child's room along with a sectional couch that also has a pullout bed in it. Great for getting the kids to bed in a nice quiet atmosphere. Parents, you can enjoy yourself after closing the sliding doors ;).   Breakfast is included and is quite good. Waffles, Hashbrowns, eggs,
Manager Response: none

Summary: Super staff!  Very accommodating and even remembered my daughters birthday!  Always smiling and friendly.  Accommodated all of our room requests.  Very clean, quiet and comfortable. Swimming pool area is beautiful and very clean.  I will be staying here again and recommend this hotel to all!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for Disneyland trip complete with spacious rooms, convenience to Disney and Walgreens, and great breakfast
Summary: We loved staying at the Hyatt House Anaheim for our Disneyland vacation.  It took us all of 15 minutes to walk to the parks each day and discovered a GREAT pizza place on our way called "The Pizza Press".  It was also nice to have Walgreens practically inside our hotel so we could get waters and a few other things for the room.  The hot and huge breakfast every morning was so good.  I would recommend this hotel to everyone.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the first time I actually use the blankets and sheets of a hotel room. Clean bathroom, living area, sofa bed, kitchen, just overall clean and fresh. The room does not have that stuffy "hotel room" smell; i love that you can adjust your room temperature to your liking. Nothing better than waking up to delicious complimentary breakfast, there's something for everyone even picky eaters! :) ..visited the heated pool which was a treat for the swimmers in our family and for the kids to release their wiggles before bed...my husband was able to watch the Canelo fight which kept him happy. As a mother of 4, I was able to relax knowing my little ones were in a safe, clean hotel. Will be back! :)
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I don't stay with Hyatt often, but that could change now that we've moved out of town and away from Disneyland, especially with this most recent stay experience. Amazing! Shout out to Keela and Heather at the Front Desk for all that they did to contribute. Granted our reservation was booked last minute, the main goal of the stay was to go to Disneyland and celebrate our twin girls' 1st birthdays. The hotel was not too busy and the staff was still so welcoming and accommodating. I believe we were upgraded to a larger room which had the perfect layout and space for my family of five, the parking situation was made easy during our stay and afterwards, the property was close enough to stroller-walk the babies to and from Disneyland, not to mention breakfast
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here at the end of February with our two children (7 months and 3 years) and stayed in a specialty room with a king bed and bunk beds.  It was an excellent stay.  Very easy walk to the parks, clean room, and fantastic complimentary hot buffet breakfast.  Highly recommend it!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked the wheelchair accessible family suite that stated on the website that it slept 6.  To make room for the accessible suite they had taken the sleeper sofa out so it only slept 4.  The staff was excellent to work with and got our family and additional room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: For the price of my stay, I expected more from this hotel.  I had several issues with the hotel.  On our first night, I called down to the front desk to request a toothbrush for myself and a blanket for my son, who was using the sofabed (only a sheet was provided).  I was assured they would be brought right away.  We fell asleep that night, awoke in the morning, and neither item had arrived.  I called the front desk again that morning prior to leaving for the day and asked that the blanket be delivered before our return that night (I bought a toothbrush at the drugstore next door).  I was assured the blanket would be brought to me right then.  It hadn't arrived by the time we left.  We returned late that night.  No blanket.  I called the front desk again and explained the
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for choosing to stay with us and appreciate your feedback. It appears that you stay did not live up to the expectations that we strive for. I can assure you that your review will be discussed with both our Front Desk staff and our Housekeeping Director to insure that we have corrected the issues that you encountered during your stay. I hope we have an opportunity to welcome you again and showcase our exceptional hospitality.

Summary: We booked two rooms at this hotel for easy convenience of visiting Disney. I was impressed by how clean and tidy the entire hotel was. The rooms were great, comfy beds and pillows. We were road tripping for two weeks and were pleased to see a lovely clean Laundry area available to guests. The detergent dispenser was stuck and waited almost 45 minutes for someone to assist though. There is a convenience store right next door so very handy for snack, toiletries etc. The breakfast was extremely good considering it was complimentary. Enough variety for everyone. The breakfast team were always delightful no matter how busy they were. They only bit I had a problem with was that at check out we were made to wait at least 30 mins for someone to come back from break as we wanted to pay
Manager Response: Thank for choosing Hyatt House during your recent stay, and I truly appreciate your honest feedback. It is quite disappointing to hear that your checkout process was not a good experience. Please know that I am following up with the department heads to review your areas of concern and how we can improve the checkout process when a guest prefers to pay with cash. Please accept my sincere apologies for the delay in your checkout.

Summary: Great new Hyatt House Hotel in Anaheim just a couple of blocks away from Disneyland gates. Very clean and fresh new hotel. Also right across the street from Garden Walk mall with good restaurants such as CPK and Cheesecake Factory. Walgreens right beside hotel and CVS across the street. Breakfast was really good - well stocked and tasty - only issue was no almond milk available. Rooms were large and clean. Room with 2 Queen beds and kitchen had a fully stocked kitchen with pots, pans, cutlery, plates, bowls and a dishwasher. Carafes with cold water and lemons or limes in the lobby were great after getting back from Disney at the end of the afternoon. Also Lux bus main depot is in Garden Walk so if taking a tour to Universal or any other place like that it is a short walk to get
Manager Response: none

Summary: it was a hard decision where to stay in anaheim. i finally decided on hyatt house based on reviews and location.  i wasn't disappointed. the hotel is clean, our room was well laid out (2 queens with couch and small kitchen) and very comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. The walk to Disney was close enough that going back and forth with my 4 year old grandson without a stroller was doable, overall great stay
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had the BEST experience at Hyatt House and enjoyed the beautiful rooms (the boys loved the bunk beds) and awesome breakfast each morning.  The pool was perfect, everything was so clean and we will definitely stay again on our next visit to Anaheim!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: 1 night as our previous hotel was fully booked
Summary: Let me start We moved from Homewood Anaheim Convention Centre to this one for one night as Homewood was full for our last night unfortunately.  So good points:  Very close to Disneyland park better to walk than catch a public transport.  Laundry was only $1 per wash or dry. Self serve.  Clean rooms and very spacious.  Bad points:  We didn't find staff very friendly at all because we came from another hotel that staff were very friendly.  Breakfast is big, spacious but hot food was quite cheap not sausages ( proper) and bacon, etc.  Our room 401 had few issues like an awful smell from the incinerator at the kitchen sink, we've called twice to be fixed and after 40 min someone turned up to fix it.  You can hear everything from other floors as walls are paper thin.  I'm saying
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts on your recent stay with us. I am glad to hear that there were some very positive points while you stayed at Hyatt House, but I appreciate your honesty in the areas that we need to improve. It is reviews like yours that allow us to correct these concerns and to achieve the level of service that our guests deserve. I hope that you will consider staying with us again during your next visit to the Anaheim area to experience these improvements.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel during spring break 2017. Check in was quick and easy. The rooms were well appointed and comfortable. It has a kitchenette that we didn't really use. The mini fridge was convenient to keep cold drinks for the room. On the first night we arrived there we were able to watch the Disneyland fireworks out the window of our room, which was nice. There is a Walgreen's next to the hotel that was extremely convenient. The parking is in an underground garage and had plenty of parking although it was pricey. The free hot breakfast was very good, with eggs, meat, potatoes, cereals and fruits. It was a great way to start each day.  overall a pleasant stay.  .
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for a Disneyland or convention visit
Summary: Hyatt House Anaheim was perfect in every way... from the friendly check-in staff to the clean, comfortable room. The included breakfast was a great perk to an already excellent experience. It's only a couple blocks from Disneyland in one direction and the convention center in the other - easily walkable - another plus!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Mixed-use nature of this hotel structure allowed property to address more needs of guests (Walgreens, Starbucks, etc...).  Outdoor pool deck, bar, and seating areas (2nd level) has unifying layout that made it feel more welcoming.  Reception desk staff appeared to be (genuinely) knowledgeable about transportation options (area shuttles, public transit routes, car-hires).  Housekeeping staff appeared to be very helpful when asked for assistance.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is only 9 months old & is very modern & clean. A short 10 minute walk to Disney's main gates which was perfect. Nice hot breakfast buffet & spacious seating & lounge area. Love the exercise room & pool area. Staff are very friendly & accomodating.  Stayed there for 7 nights & had a good stay. They missed cleaning our room one day but were quick to connect with us with fresh towels, etc. Good location to lots of restaurants across the street. Would highly recommend this hotel
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Brand new, walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel "suite" was perfect for our family. The bedroom allowed privacy and extra space, the full-kitchen allowed us to bring in groceries and save some money by eating-in, and the full hot breakfast every morning was awesome!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful review. We are thrilled that you enjoyed your stay with us and hope that we have an opportunity to welcome you back in the future.

Summary: Great stay.  Great Hotel with great amenities. Really close to Disneyland. My daughter mentioned we were there for her birthday and Hostess surprised us the next day with balloons and chocolates in our room. My daughter was so happy. Breakfast is great and staff is wonderful. Will stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great, clean hotel within walking distance to Disneyland!
Summary: I just recently had the pleasure of staying at the Hyatt House in Anaheim.  Chetena checked us in and was so welcoming. Our room was spacious and clean.  It was nice to have a kitchen and living room separate from the bedrooms. The breakfast that is included everyday is wonderful and has great variety...eggs, toast, muffins ,variety of cold cereal, (pancakes ,waffles, or French toast), fruit, oatmeal, potatoes, bacon, sausage, and yogurt .  The staff that worked to breakfast were very friendly and kept everything well stocked.  Disneyland is about a 15 minute walk, unfortunately there is no shuttle but the walk is an easy one. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The reason for our stay was a vacation to disneyland. As a single mother of 2 boys that kept me busy all day at disneyland it was great to be able to take breaks and head back to the room with an amazing kitchen area to save some money by eating in! Also gave us (mostly me) a chance to recharge with a quick nap in the separate bedroom area! Great pool as well! We will definitely be back and I highly recommend to anyone looking in the area!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Breakfast was included the day we checked in and the morning of our stay, rooms were comfortable for our family of 5. Walk to Disney was doable - even late at night. You don't need your car. Great get away.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great trip to Disney at the Hyatt House
Summary: The hotel was great.  The person that stood out the most was Isidro.  He went far and above to make our stay great.  He even delivered a cake to my 8-year-old on her bday.  Isidro even remembered the next day she danced at Disney and asked how it went.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words and especially acknowledging Isidro in the review. It warms our hearts when we hear that our staff helped create a special moment for you and your family. It is always our goal make each guest feel welcomed and to acknowledge the special celebrations that they may experience while visiting our hotel. We hope that we have an opportunity to welcome you and your family back again in the future.

Summary: The location is situated perfectly in walking distance of everything you would need and/or see. The breakfast was a great start to our mornings. Our room had a kitchen which came in very handy for late day meals. We used the hotels complimentery grocery shopping service. This was very helpful. Our room was very spacious for us and three boys. We stayed in the Dbl Queen Studio. The pool and hot tub, need I say more. Loved all the staff!!! Great place. We will be back
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind review. We greatly appreciate the consideration in choosing to stay with us! We look forward to your next stay.

Summary Heading: Short walk to Disneyland and nice hotel
Summary: Nice friendly staff and clean hotel. This is an easy walk to Disneyland. The breakfast was just ok, not great. The fruit was the best part. And the coffee wasn't good. The pool is nice and so are the rooms. Starbucks is opening right next door which will be a plus for coffee drinkers. And Walgreens is next door too, if you forget something or want to grab water before heading into the park.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in the family room with twin bunk beds and a pull out couch and a king bed.  It was very comfortable for us.  The free breakfast worked well because we wanted to get out early to head to the happiest place on Earth.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel was nice, I was there on business but it looked like it would be a great place for families.  The breakfast was good, with a great selection.  The bartender was wonderful and happy hour was great.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great family hotel for Anaheim stay
Summary: This was a great option for a Disneyland visit with my family. 10 minute walk to theme part entrance, close to CVS and Walgreens and staff were very friendly. The daily breakfast is also a great option with quality produce. My only issue is the hotel is very noisy. We could hear people above us running up and down corridor and people in rooms next door. This is a Shame as given new hotel possibly could have done more to soundproof however I would still reccomend.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect Location for our Disneyland Family Vacation
Summary: The hotel had everything we were looking forward to make our Disney vacation complete. It was conveniently located to the park, had a great pool for the kids, a cocktail lounge for the adults, and a great breakfast every morning. The rooms were well designed, spacious, clean, and comfortable. We really loved having a suite with a large living area so we could all visit and have pizza at the end of a tired day at the park. All in all, perfect in every way!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is beautiful, very elegant and super clean. employees very professional , polite, and friendly.. I really love the dining area, breakfast was delicious. A special thanks to Rey for all his attentions... I will definitely come back..
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice enough to stay at again
Summary: We rented a One Bedroom and a Studio.  The difference is that the Studio is just one big room with a semi divider between the living room and sleeping area.  We stayed in the Studio while my son’s family had a One Bedroom.  The online pictures are actually representative of the rooms.  The rooms have very little in the way of frills.  They are clean and functional.  Pros:  -	Nice enough room.  We had plenty of room for two people. -	Kitchen would have been fine if we had eaten there. -	TV was fine. -	Beds were comfortable.  However, after walking 12 miles per day I probably could have slept on a slab of wood and thought it was great. -	The bathroom was fine. -	Breakfast was okay.  Nothing fancy.  Eggs, bacon, sausage, etc, with breads, etc, and fruit, plus juices. -	The staff
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here one night. All the hotels at beach line were booked Saturday night so we ended here (Spring Break...). But what a positive surprise, in short - a great hotel. Expensive but worth it. Rooms modern and functional, interior nice and not the traditional boring American standard :). We slept very well in comfortable beds. Some noise from the road, however not too much disturbing. Breakfast buffet very good. Service level good throughout. Sad that parking is not included, in the promised land of cars. All in all a very good experience! Give me a deal and I am back :)
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great a Hotel Within Walking Distance of The House of Mouse
Summary: Everything was great, as to be expected from this hotel brand. Super convenient to Disneyland and several restaurants. Keela and Isidro were awesome representatives of the hotel and their brand. They were delightfully friendly upon check in. The pool was advertised as heated, it didn't feel warm or heated when we used it. Other than the pool, the hotel is a great option if you're visiting nearby attractions.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: great facility but poor house keeping
Summary: Stayed 4 nights total. Accidentally messed up the floor first night but the house keeping did not even clean up after two days. We have to make a special request to the front desk. Overall, the stay was ok, great walking distance to Disney and new room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very satisfied with this hotel. Met all our needs, comfortable, clean and affordable. Staff very friendly. Good breakfast, garage parking and super nice pool area. Short walk to Disneyland and for those that need shuttle it's right next door at Red Lion.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Pleasant stay at the Hyatt House
Summary: Very nice hotel with spacious and clean rooms.  We stayed in the one bedroom suite with a kitchen.  The bathroom was spacious. There was adequate storage for our clothes. We loved Chaterra at the front desk.  She was so pleasant and accomodating.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed 5th floor facing street. A little noise but nothing to worry about. Couldn't see fireworks bc there only happen on the weekends off peak season.  Hotel felt new and clean and I'm very picky about cleanliness. Love bedroom separate from LR/kitchen. Wonderful housekeeping service - place was immaculate every day. Used laundry on 5th flr very convenient. 2 washing machines and many dryers. i think it was 1 dollar or 1.50 per machine. quarters at the front desk. Breakfast was excellent and the breakfast staff was on top of it and very friendly to the kids. Lots of cut fruit grapefruit, oranges, melons, pineapple.  Kind of a long walk to disneyland but I would stay here again given the value of this place.  Disney channels on the 2 tvs in the suite. Walgreens just downstairs
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family visited California for our daughter's birthday, and we stayed at the Hyatt House. The staff was amazing and even delivered a birthday cake to our room. The rooms were also very clean and very nicely detailed.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good Value, Good Breakfast, Good Stay
Summary: Very happy with our stay. The entire hotel is clean and well decorated. The staff was friendly especially at breakfast which was surprising given how busy they were and how many requests they had to handle. The breakfast was plentiful and they did not run out of things. We stayed in a 2 queen bed suite with a kitchenette and the room was plenty big and the kitchen was well stocked. The shower had excellent pressure and the beds were comfortable.   We walked to Disney and it was about a 10-15 min walk. After a day at the park we opted to uber back which was $5.50 and was well worth it with the kids. The pool was on the 2nd level and had waitress service. They said the pool was heated but it was still a bit brisk but not bad for April. We utilized the walgreens next door and when
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had an amazing stay at the Hyatt House. It was very convenient that there are not one buy two pharmacies right downstairs as we travelled with children and needed many things for them we forgot to pack. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was awesome. There was a wide selection of things to eat and drink. The rooms were gorgeous and kept very clean.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Beds are comfortable. New facility. Quiet and sound proof even you're next to the street. Spacious. Service is great. Food is great. Very convinient if you go to Disneyland. Make sure to adjust your room temp so you won't need thick blankets. Bunk beds has thin blanket. You can always ask for extra blankets
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was very clean and the staff were all very professional. We stayed only one night prior to staying on property at Disneyland.  If we make another trip in the future to Disneyland and chose to stay off of Disney property this is a hotel we would stay in.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is top notch! The employees all seemed to like their jobs and were very helpful! The hotel felt like a sanctuary away from Disneyland and at the end of a long day that was great!  We enjoyed the selection at breakfast which included bacon, sausage, eggs, fruit, cereals, toast and pastries.  Breakfast was very busy but still the food was promptly refilled when things ran out.  The pool area was very nice and someone even approached and asked us if we had a drink order. The walk to Disney isn't too bad but it was my least favorite part, and not as convenient as staying right across from the parks with only one stoplight. I believe we had to use three crosswalks between this hotel and Disney. If you are a light sleeper request a room facing the pool and not the road, it
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hyatt House is the place to go when visiting Disneyland
Summary: The Hyatt House is a nice, clean, family friendly, and close place to stay near Disneyland. It has spacious rooms, great staff, and is close to nearby stores (Walgreens, CVS, Target, outlet shopping 10 minutes away) We booked a room with a king size bed, which also came with a sleeper sofa but we felt it maybe better to have a room with 2 beds (we have a 5YO and 3YO) Clarissa, the manager, understood our concerns and upgraded us, no charge. We got to stay in a fabulous suite with 1 bedroom and 2 queen beds, full size kitchen and living room. It was roomy, clean, modern and quiet. We appreciate Clarissa's help and loved the room we stayed. Thanks for making our first family trip memorable!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this hotel. Rooms were clean and quiet. Location was 15 minute walk to Disney and we had a Wallgreen's right next to the hotel. Staff was friendly and very accommodating. Parking was located underground and very convenient to access from the elevator.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The beds were very comfortable, the room was clean and pleasant. The staff was very accommodating and extremely nice given they were swarmed with people everyday going to Disneyland. It was especially busy during our trip because of Spring Break, but the staff wasn't phased by the crowds asking for more items during the breakfast. It's amazing what a "Free" breakfast does to the general public, especially as the minutes to the end of breakfast comes near. The staff stayed calm, professional, and courteous to everyone. I can't say enough about how polite the staff was.   The hotel is in close proximity to Disneyland entrance, about .5 mile away. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the rooms and hotel was still in new condition. Also, a nice benefit to be above the Walgreen's to
Manager Response: none

Summary: The website says, "Convenient location in the Anaheim Resort District – Right across the street from Disneyland® and around the corner from the Anaheim Convention Center".  Well, it kind of is "right across the street", but from the hotel it is over 1 mile from the hotel to the front gate of Disneyland, so this was very misleading.  It took 20-25 minutes to walk, which seems VERY long at the end of a long day of walking.  "Free amenities for your stay – Daily Morning Spread, hotel-wide Wi-Fi, 24-hour fitness center access, an outdoor pool and more" - There is a "Daily Morning Spread", but it is only available to 9:30 on weekdays.  Our last day there, they ran out of forks and spoons, and bacon.  They also start shutting everything down about 9:15.  They had scrambled eggs,
Manager Response: I want to thank you for choosing to stay with us and appreciate your feedback. Our breakfast is served from 6:30am-9:30am weekdays and 7am-10pm weekends. When the hotel is sold out, the breakfast can get very busy. I am not quite sure why our breakfast team would have started closing things down early, as typically that is never the case. If anything, our team tends to keep the breakfast open for an additional 10-15 minutes to accommodate late arrivals to breakfast. I will definitely discuss this with our team. We never want to shut down the breakfast earlier than the dedicated breakfast hours. After a long day at the Disney Parks, any walk back to the hotel can seem like miles. The hotel is actually located 1/2 mile from the Park and usually takes about 10-15 minutes. With small children, it could definitely take 20-25 minutes due to the slower pace. For guests that prefer not to make the walk, the hotel does sell tickets for the ART bus, which will take you directly to the Parks.

Summary: Walking distance to Disneyland.  Booked room with bunk bed and the kids were very pleased. Room was clean and comfortable. Front desk staff was friendly and accommodating to every request. Overall, will stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Not one bad thing to say. Even pool area is great with bar/food service during the day. Plenty of towels. Room was great with mini kitchen. Walgreens is RIGHT down stairs too. Front desk staff saw great!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: First time at Hyatt House--Overall a very nice stay
Summary: Have stayed at Hotel Indigo our last couple of trips to Disneyland, and have been very pleased with it. Decided to try the Hyatt House because I found a great price and the ability to sleep three kids in the bunk room (bunk and sofa bed) without two having to share a bed was a bonus for us.   Overall, our stay was very pleasant. We interacted with the staff at the front desk and the wait staff in the breakfast room, and everyone was very helpful and friendly.   As many have mentioned, the hotel is quite new, so the rooms were in pretty good shape. Cleaning was decent, although there was three dimensional "stuff" on the framed photos on the wall, so those might have not been on the checklist for housekeeping to look at. I knew from other reviews that the top bunk wouldn't be made
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review and feedback regarding the bunk beds. I am going to share your comments with my Housekeeping Director, as well as the Executive team. I hope we have an opportunity to welcome you back in the near future.

Summary Heading: Positive overall but a few areas for improvement.
Summary: Property is new, clean. Lovely staff but overwhelmed with number of guests at various intervals - check-in, check-out, morning afternoon, evening. Nice gym and pool area. Good parking option, availability and price for the area. Good breakfast buffet with lots of options. Very family oriented given proximity to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very close to Disneyland, clean, friendly staff, free breakfast. We would definitely stay there again! We got the kids suit and the kids loved having "their own room" plus they had the view of the fireworks
Manager Response: Thank you again for your wonderful review and we look forward to having you stay with us again when you are in the Anaheim area!

Summary: Everything on our stay was great. Its about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland, but a couple times we took a car service($10 worth every penny when your tired). Hotel staff was so helpful and friendly. The breakfast was really good. Everything tasted fresh and yummy. They are buliding a starbucks and there is a Walgreens literally in the same parki g lot which was great. We will definitely be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Excellent location for folks visiting Disneyland.  Easy to get in and out.  Overall a very good hotel.  Fan control in the room did not work.  Needs one more mirror and water pressure in the bathroom needs to be upgraded.  Will recommend this hotel to others.  Very friendly staff and customer care.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for a cheer competition. And I was so glad we did! We had stayed at the SpringHill suites 2weeks before and had a horrible experience with bad customer service! Well Hyatt House has won me over! Stay here! Don't put up with bad customer service!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed one night while visiting Disneyland and California Adventure. Front desk was extremely welcoming and helpful. Our room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. The breakfast was outstanding - hot and cold items, replenished quickly, and something for everyone. Perfect before heading over to the parks for a full day. It was about a 15 minute walk to the park and lots of people were heading that way on the sidewalks. No need to drive at all, which was even more relaxing. Will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Was a very good place to stay while we were at Disneyland. Only a half mile from entrance to park.  Keela and the other staff were friendly and helpful when we had questions. It was nice to have a hot breakfast each morning. Only down side was there wasn't a Coke fountain for my morning addiction.  The room was nice but a little cramped to get around in could possibly use 100 ft^2 more.  All in all it was a good place to stay and I would stay again if I have the chance.
Manager Response: I want to thank you for choosing to stay with us and appreciate the feedback. Unfortunately, we do not have a soda station at breakfast, but I can understand your desire for one, as I also prefer a soda in the morning. We do have the H Market and hope that you were able to purchase a Coke there to enjoy each morning.

Summary: Excellent accommodations.  The hotel room was very clean and spacious.  The staff were friendly and the pool bar was amazing (great addition).  Also, Alex the bartender was very personable.  It was great that he remembered my family and I from our previous stay.  Will definitely come back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I looked at every hotel before choosing this one. It didn't disappoint! The location is good about a 10 minute walk to main gate of Disney. Has a Walgreens in the parking lot and a CVS across the street. There are also many restaurants nearby. We enjoyed the Subway across the street. The included breakfast was very good and a good way to start the day. We used the kitchen and stocked up on food at Target. Beds comfy and rooms nice and clean. We were on 4th floor facing Disney and could see fireworks. Pool was nice with lots of chairs and umbrellas. This hotel was great for us.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Clean, friendly, close to Disney and exactly what I expect form a Hyatt property.  The front desk went out of their way to answer questions and help us upgrade for our last night to a great view room.  Breakfast was good, very organized and gave you a positive start to your day.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Was told hotel was only 9 months old but seemed older. Breakfast was good and staff cleaning the tables did an exceptional job of wiping tables down so next guests can sit to eat.  Would stay again BUT ask to stay on top floor to prevent the loud banging from people staying above and hearing toilets flushed.    This location is not a bad walk (15min) from hotel to gates of Disney BUT if you have kids younger then 8 years old it might be a difficult walk back to hotel after a long day at Disney.   I had to piggyback my kids back to hotel after days 2 and 3 at Disney...
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your recent stay with us.
