We try our best to make sure that our guests are not disturbed such activity and for the most part, we have been quite successful. If you could share with me the room number that you were in, I would like to have our engineer check the guestrooms located above. It seems a bit unusual for the toilet to flush as many times as you heard it and perhaps something needs to be fixed.

We used the pool a couple of times during our stay and it was wonderful! It wasn't busy at all, there was plenty of seating and even better, there was poolside drink service! Used the fitness center also which was large, clean and modern with great equipment to choose from.

Summary: I always love Hyatt hotels. The quality is always amazing. The hotel was very nicely decorated, secure, and had a super friendly staff. We stayed in a room that had a kitchenette. There was a two burner stove top, a full size fridge, sink, cupboards with dishes, a microwave, and a dishwasher. There was a small table/bar separating the kitchenette with the living area. We used it to eat and also to do work on computers. The living area had a large, comfortable couch with pillows and foot rests and a sizable TV. Through a door was our bedroom with two queen sized beds and a bathroom. The bedroom had two dressers and a closet. The whole room was spacious, had a lot of storage, and a ton of outlets. We also had a thermostat in the room. The room was very clean. Each morning they
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wonderful start to a beautiful marriage!
Summary: We came to start our mini moon with our 3 yr old son and to enjoy Disney together. We splurged on a hotel room to take advantage of the multiple day pass and was pleasantly surprised to find a new hotel with such amazing rates. Upon arrival we were so impressed with the hotel. Lobby was beautiful and the staff was so friendly and accommodating! Not only did they congratulate us on our nuptials on check in but they also left a lovely and thoughtful hand written note with a great gift of wine and snacks to enjoy after our long day. I've NEVER received such amazing customer service at a hotel before. It really made us feel so special. We'll definitely be back! Thank you Hyatt!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff at the hotel was amazing!! They were friendly and greeted everyone when we came in every time. They went above and beyond in making sure our team was comfortable during our stay there. I would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at this hotel recently with my family for our visit to Disneyland.  We were in a King Family suite, which has a king bed, a bunk bed, and a pull out sofa, it was perfect for our family of 5.  The hotel is less than a 10 min. walk from Disney, If your children are over 5 they will be fine with the walk, younger than that you'll want a stroller.  After a full day at Disney a stroller for the walk back is probably advisable, Uber or Taxi is $6-$9.  The hotel is brand new and is very clean, the guestrooms are nice, the pool area is quite nice as well for not being a "resort" style hotel.  Management was helpful with any requests we had.  The free buffet breakfast is good for a free buffet.  It gets rather crowded in the mornings but they do a pretty good job at keeping up
Manager Response: none

Summary: I love the convenient location. This property is walking distance to Disney, dining and Walgreens. The rooms are clean and family friendly. The best is the buffet breakfast. It had a good variety for the entire family. I would come again for sure.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My stay at this hotel was very pleasant. Room was clean and modern. Breakfast was awesome! Staff was very courteous. The room was big enough to accommodate my whole family. Wifi access was dependable and fast. We were able to use our Roku without any problems.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just checked in and it seems nice and clean....I know the sheets are clean because you have to make your own beds! We have bunk beds and sheets are on top of the mattress. We asked if that was how it's done and we're told yes. This seems peculiar to me.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and we look forward to when you can stay with us again when you are back in Anaheim!

Summary: This is a great hotel for big families. We are a family of 5, worked well once we got the upgrade. Bunk bed room was not going to work, we needed the pull out couch. The kitchen has everything you are ever going to need, but the fridge is small, bring a cooler. This hotel was really great.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Open for about six months, this Hyatt House is a intelligently designed, well executed, efficiently  run delightful place to stay.  If I had paid the normal room rate of $250 a night for my 1 BR suite, I would have rated the hotel a 5, but since I paid an inflated $450 a night rate during a busy convention, the value/luxury for the money just does not justify a 5.  If you are sensitive to traffic noise, be sure to request a room on the back side of the hotel.  Rooms on the front side are over an extremely busy road.  My room was on the side of the hotel, as far back from the road as you can be and I still needed to use ear plugs to block out the traffic.    The rooms are modern and tastefully constructed out of faux materials (wood, stone, etc) but it all ties together nicely
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very close to Disneyland, 10 minute walk. All new and clean. Would stay there again. Very nice pool area. Free breakfast that was good with a lot of options that were filling. It was also very quiet even though there were a lot of families.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Wonderful stay with walking distance to Disneyland and other fun restaurants. There was 13 of us and we all loved the 3 hotel rooms we got. We had 2 queens suites with full kitchen and one king with bunk beds that the kids loved!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt House it was very clean the Staff Pleasant
Summary: I would recommend staying at this hotel with your family we enjoyed ourselves the area was nice and family-friendly the breakfast was great overall we had a great time was in walking distance to everything in Disneyland
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best Disney Area Hotel Hands Down!
Summary: This hotel is fabulous!  Beautiful lobby specially stocked with ice water for those long days at Disney.  I also liked the security aspect of having to use your key card to get on the elevators.  The room was large and spacious, and the kitchen gave it extra appeal!  Beautiful view on the 5th floor!  My family is already asking when we can go back!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for this wonderful review. Your opinion is very important to us and our staff. We hope to see you back again soon!

Summary: Breakfast was amazing - great selection of hot food. Pool was heated and hot  tub was large and great. Clean rooms. A little further than other hotels around disneyland but breakfast is a make or break for us and this did not disappoint. Will be back!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review. We look forward to welcoming you family back again in the near future!

Summary: Fresh and welcoming. We can't say a single negative about this friendly and convenient Hotel.  Modern and comfortable accommodations are perfect for Disney Guests or business in the area. It's geared to the early to bed early to rise crowd so don't expect too much activity at the casual lobby "Bar".  Breakfast is included and at first glance simple-a slight variation daily but still plenty of choices on hot beverages, juice, milk, eggs, meat, breads, cereal and yoghurt. The fresh fruit was especially excellent (grapefruit supremes, melons, pineapple) and all deliciously ripe.  The basic room is spacious and well laid out. Outlets everywhere, lots of towels, comfortable bed and sitting area, kettle, tea etc., microwave. ALL of the Staff is friendly, helpful and pleasant. Timmy (a
Manager Response: Thank you very much for this lovely review and the beautiful compliments. We are all very proud of our hotel and appreciate your kind words. Timmy is definitely a real asset to our hotel, and he always makes our guests feel so welcomed. We hope that will be able to welcome you and your family back in the near future!

Summary: This hotel is roughly 10 minutes from Disneyland and about $10 for taxi.  No shuttle service but not a deal breaker for us.  Easy walk and very safe at night.  Hotel is clean and front desk provided good customer service. Walgreens was a plus for any items to pick up before entering the park.  Breakfast was reasonable.  We didn't need to rent a car the entire trip with many amenities near the hotel. Overall, we enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Timmy and his staff are incredible.  From the minute you walk in they make you feel like family.  Great hotel, breakfast is amazing, and quality is 5 diamond plus!  Will always stay here!  Our 3 year old feels like home here with the big rooms, couch and tv!  You also get every channel possible on the TV.  This is definitely our home away from home.  Cannot say enough about this place!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a brand new hotel, probably like 6 months old. Very Clean, big, offers free breakfast every morning.  The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because I had some issues with housekeeping. We ran out of toilet paper, coffee, and one day they didn't leave any towels. Didn't discover that until I was in the shower. Lucky me.  There were 2 beds and they only made one up each time with the warmer covers. They also took any money you had laying around. What i mean by that was that we left a tip on the bed for housekeeping and they ended up taking our change (my 7 year olds change for the penny presses) that was on the kitchen island. I was not pleased with that. Loved the location, there are restaurants and shops all around. Pool and hot tub were a big hit and sometimes it
Manager Response: I want to thank you for your review and feedback. My apologies that our housekeeping department did not offer the appropriate service during your stay. I am sincerely sorry that they assumed the change on the counter was also a tip. I will be sharing your comments with our housekeeping department to rectify the concerns that you shared.

Summary: I cannot say enough about this Hyatt hotel. I got a great rate, with easy walking distance to Disneyland. The rooms were clean and large. The breakfast was excellent for a hotel breakfast. Plenty of hot items, lots of seating, and fresh fruit. The staff was friendly and always looking to help. Everything was excellent.  You can't go wrong with this place.
Manager Response: none

Summary: So glad there are more options for Disneyland hotels. We stayed in a 2Q studio suite, which was comfy and had all the amenities we could ask for.  Breakfast was really decent, better than I expected for the morning craziness before hitting Disneyland crowd. Of course we had to wait a bit for a table, for food/plates to be replenished, especially if we were on the later side of the morning. What else were we expecting given almost everyone's there for Disneyland?! Given that, the staff was amazing! They all worked hard to clear/clean the tables and refresh the food. And the coffee was always hot and available and good, so very appreciated!!  We had a quiet room but it was way, way at the end of the hall and around the corner, whew! I wished we had booked sooner to get a 1BR
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice, clean and comfortable hotel. Great access to Disneyland and the breakfast is delicious for being free. Staff is very welcoming also and they certainly went above and beyond to make me and my fiance feel welcome for our 1 night stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were here for a trip to Disney and this hotel was perfect. We were in walking distance with a Walgreens and cvs near by. We had different food options to choose from. I will most definitely be staying at this hotel on my next trip.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel and room was modern and clean. Breakfast was complementary and sufficient. Staff was super friendly and accommodating, they went the extra mile to make the stay extra special.  Just be aware that parking is 17 dlls per night.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Family Friendly, Clean, Close to Disneyland!
Summary: We stayed in two rooms this past week at the Hyatt House, Convention Center Anaheim. The rooms were well suited for family needs, the food diverse and healthy, and the staff friendly and understanding of special needs. So close to Disneyland you can get there in 5 min!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Customer Service - Close walk to Disney - Very family friendly
Summary: This hotel completely met my expectations! We were a family of 5 (2 adults and 3 kids under age 12) visiting Disneyland for 6 nights. The front desk staff (especially Isidro - I can't say enough on how helpful, kind, and just all around amazing customer service we received from Isidro) was so friendly and accommodating. Our room was not ready at check-in time and before I could say anything they offered an upgrade to a room with a Disneyland view and a credit to have dinner and drinks while we waited. The breakfast was wonderful and the wait staff was so friendly and helpful. The room was very spacious and clean. Housekeeping went above and beyond and ran the dishes in the dishwasher while we were out. The walk to the park was very short,(less than 15 minutes to the security
Manager Response: none

Summary: The only thing that was upsetting was when we were told we would receive a call/text when our room was ready, which we never receive. Once we got back to our hotel to put the kids to bed, we realized the top bunk bed was not made, when I talked to the manager they informed me it is a liability to have their staff make the top bed, I found it more of a liability for me to get up to make the bed. why offer a bed that you have to make yourself as a guest?!?!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel for families attending Disneyland
Summary: Myself and my family of 4 stayed here in January 2017. The hotel is very clean, staff are extremely helpful and it's only 5-10 minutes walk from the entrance to Disneyland and California Adventure park.   For families of 4, do yourself a favour and book a room with bunks for the kids. The room itself is not massive but the kids having their own bed was a great change from the hassle of the kids sharing a queen size bed in the usual 2-bed set up. There is a sliding door between the main bed area and the bunks room.   Lots of restaurants within walking distance if you chose to eat somewhere other than the parks.   Whilst the buffet breakfast doesn't have the greatest variety, it will put something in your stomach before you hit the usual eateries at Disneyland. Oh and try and get
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Room smelled and sheets on sofa bed were not cleaned/changed prior to our stay
Summary: Bathroom smelled of urine, sofa sleeper sheets were dirty not changed prior to our arrival. Random woman called at 3am and then arrived a shhort time later banging on the next rooms door and then proceeded to yell at the man who let her in..Breakfast hot food was cold and no place to sit once you got your food too little seating area for so many people trying to eat at the same time.
Manager Response: I want to thank you for your feedback that you have shared. It appears that your stay did not live up to the expectations that we strive for. Your review will definitely be shared with our Housekeeping Director. I do want to share that as unsettling as it must have been for you to be woken up at 3 am and to have a woman banging on the next room's door, unfortunately, those situations are a bit difficult for the hotel to control. We try our best to handle the situation immediately once it's been reported to us. The last thing I would like to share is that during the busy season our breakfast area can get rather busy. Many times you will see the management staff assist in the breakfast area, just to make sure our guests always have a place to sit. We feel that, as managers, we work as a team with every department to make our guests feel that we are here to make their stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible.

Summary: This is a great place to stay with kids. The breakfast is really good, plenty of options. The room was very big and had plenty of room for all of us. The sleeper sofa isn't very big and not comfortable at all. However, I found the couch to be very comfortable to sleep on so it was fine for me and I have back problems.   Staff was very friendly and helpful. Overall it was a great experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: It was super close to Disney Land!  The rooms were clean.  The staff was friendly.  The only negative comment would be that the food is a little expensive for what they offered and the selection is not very big.  They have a great breakfast that was included in our stay which is great way to start your day!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A great place for families to stay!
Summary: Excellent staff. Great room. Heated pool. Delicious breakfast included. Wonderful stay! Kids enjoyed swimming and playing in roof deck pool. We enjoyed the lounge for drinks and snacks. Excellent staff very attentive.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We visited this property when it was full and had a great time. A quick 10 min walk to Disney, great free hot breakfast with ample seating, super comfy beds, pleasant and helpful staff, generous room size for a family of five, quick check in and out, you need a room key to access the elevators which is a plus for security, the Walgreens downstairs is super convenient, 5 min walk to Anaheim Garden Walk for plentiful dining options, no complaints here. Already booked our next stay here.

Summary: This is a newer hotel.  There is usually fresh water in the lobby during the day, but not at night when people want it.  I don't see many people leaving filling up on water, but typically at night people want something to drink.  There is no signage at check in to show what hotel you're at, just simple plain white brick.  Not bad, but its very plain.  Check in they have lap tops on a wobbly stand.  It appeared the staff there were not at all comfortable using these lap tops, and quite frankly it looks kinda cheap compared to other hotels.    There is a hotel lobby bar, and lobby bar it is.  It basically is right in the middle of the lobby.  Bartender is very friendly and makes good drinks.  However, this is not a place you feel like you want to hang out long at all. We actually
Manager Response: none

Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.  It happened to be the only weekend apparently in the last 20 years it rained there, but being from Washington it was just a little drizzle.  And we managed to survive.  The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to accommodate us.  The pool was great, and if my feet wouldn't have been so sore, I'm sure I would have said the same about the workout room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Should be called the Frat House. People smoking pot right outside the front door, partying late into the night. The room was nice though minus the broken bathroom fan. Biggest will not be passed over issue is it be 3 days since we checked out and now extra charges are piling up. One added the day we left for $100 another added today for $139. We checked out on time, left our room immaculate, pre paid for the hotel including their insane $80+ additional taxes and fees. Did not rent movies, no mini bar in room, didn't even drink their coffee! Even washed our own dishes! Would not recommend them to anyone!

Summary Heading: Nice environment, close to Disneyland and convention center
Summary: We had a family suite and it was well equipped to sleep four to six people.  There was plenty of space and a refrigerator and microwave.  It was a great place and the location was perfect for us as we were there for both disneyland and a convention.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: One of the nicest hotels near Disney
Summary: i stayed here with my husband in a king den suite for our anniversary trip to Disneyland. We were overall very pleased with our stay. The hotel is in a great location near a lot of shopping, restaurants, and bars. The walk to disney was about a 1/2 mile, which was rough after a long day in the ark, but the hotel offers a shuttle to the park for a small fee. Otherwise, the location was perfect and the walgreens downstairs was a lifesaver.  The hotel was very clean, and had  a lot of nice amenities. Our room was fantastic and had a sectional couch, very modern and clean, and the shower was HUGE!

Summary Heading: Horrible pillows and paper thin walls!
Summary: I had high expectations for this hotel since it is new. In that sense, everything was great. Too bad the very uncomfortable pillows and paper thin walls will keep me from staying there again. I'm going to return to the Hyatt Regency Orange County next time I'm in Anaheim. It's a much better hotel and higher quality of experience. On a positive note, the staff was very nice and awesome!
Manager Response: none

Summary: If your having a hard time deciding between SpringHill Suites and Hyatt House. Let me point you in the right direction. I have stayed at the SpringHill Suites, but after staying at the Hyatt House I can tell you without a doubt it is the best. Here are some of the positive points.  -Spacious Suites -Secure elevator use with room key card -Full kitchen with island table -Pull out sofa for two -Air Conditioner works fast  -Bed has soft top with firm support -Free breakfast for all guest -DirecTV with lots of HD movies. -Underground self parking -Walgreens onsite -Good dining and bar drinks.  The most important point is the people working behind the desk and housekeeping. I had the pleasure of meeting Rapi (Hotel Host) who made the whole experience perfect despite having some
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very convenient location to the park, with great amenities surrounding property. Nice and new property, with very helpful staff. Traveled with our family, and the majority of the clientele were families. Great breakfast buffet, very nice pool, and quiet rooms. Very nice to have a kitchenette to prepare meals for the park, or when we got back if we needed to (our family has special food needs). We will definitely use this property again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great stay for family $5 uber to downtown Disney. Great staff. Hotel room was a mini suite with all the things a family needs for a great stay. We will definitely stay here again. When you want a nice place but do not need the hype of the Disney hotels this is perfect.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great breakfast and location to Disneyland
Summary: Great place to walk to park! Awesome breakfast, but right now bar food and drinks not great. However there is plenty of restaurants in a 2 block area around hotel. I would stay again and recommend it to family and friends  Rooms were clean and well decorated, pull outs uncomfortable but they usually are.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The fact that they have a complementary fridge and free wifi was already a plus! Great room service and the employees that work there are so nice and welcoming. Im very particular when it comes to hotel that I will be staying at. Shoutout to Jamie at the front desk too, super sweet. Definitely staying here again :)
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location for Disneyland. Great breakfast in Morning. Staff was courteous and friendly. Only complaint would be at times we were able to hear movement in rooms around us. This would be first on our list when we return to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Price was decent. Distance from park was good. Staff was amazing. Hotel was clean and stores were close. Many varieties of food were a plus. Would stay again every time we go to dland. Will recommend to others.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: My expectations must have been too high.
Summary: Pros: Amazing location to Disney and area restaurants. Convenience of Walgreens adjacent to hotel. New and shiny throughout, excellent customer service and buffet breakfast great before a long day at the Parks. Mini kitchen so nice, especially if you're making quick meals on your stay. Cons: Rooms not thoroughly clean enough. Had 2 different rooms on our 2-night stay and both weren't cleaned well enough. Ring marks on counter, food remnants on floor, smoke smell in 1 room, glitter on sofa, found the prior guests food in the cabinets. I just don't want to feel like others have been there before me--fingerprints/smudges throughout and popcorn kernels on the floor. ICK
Manager Response: My apologies for your disappointment in the cleanliness of your room during your stay. I have shared your review with our Housekeeping Director, and he will be sure to remedy the situation so it does not happen again. Summary: Hotel looks nice and is nice.  Room relatively updated and good size with kitchen.  Had 3 kids with us and we fit nicely.  Front desk personnel were excellent. They took care of all my kids' requests and always in a good mood.  About .5 miles to Disney gate, so close enough.  Great value.

Summary Heading: Great hotel stay and walking distance to Disney
Summary: We had an incredible stay at the hotel, which made our trip to Disney even better. Timmy, the manager went above and beyond to make our stay great, including upgrading our room (as we are platinum members).  The hotel was like new, and the hotel room actually didn't even feel like anyone had stayed there before. Very clean.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: First stay at Hyatt House and very positive!
Summary: Great location and clean hotel that offers breakfast to guests. They also have small suites available which is a rare option in the disney area. This hotel was quiet compared to the many others we have stayed at when visiting Disneyland😊
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful feedback. I am glad to hear you enjoyed our suites, which is a great option for families.

Summary Heading: PROFESSIONAL ABOVE AND BEYOND CUSTOMER SERVICE FROM JASSLYNN THE CHECK IN HOST
Summary: Arrived at the Hyatt House at 9:00 am. Friday morning. Been on the road since 5:00 driving  threw rain all morning long on our way to Disneyland. Pretty bummed out because of the weather. The first person i see at the Hyatt House is a host named Jasslynn, she greets my family and myself and ask what she can do for us. I let her know we will be staying there 2 nights and leaving on Sunday. I know check in is at 4:00 I jokingly  ask if our room is ready? she replies no but i have a room ready for you and your family, and I'm also going to up grade it to a suite! I can't believe it.Then on top of that she tells me to keep my car where it is and gather your family and have breakfast at the breakfast buffet!! Now my kids are excited,my wife and I are excited and our day/vacation/trip
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback and the kind words regarding Jasslynn. She has been with us since we opened, and she is a great asset to our team, as well as the rest of our front desk staff. I will definitely share your kind and thoughtful words with Jasslynn. We are so glad that you had a wonderful time staying with us, and we hope to see you and your family again soon.

Summary: I had to go only 4 stars, because the customer service wasn't the best. They kept me waiting for 45 minutes, when I wanted to put my baby to bed. When I called back, they told me there were no cribs available. Which is fine, I just wish they had called me back immediately when they found out there were none left to let me know. Instead of just blow me off.
Manager Response: My apologies for the frustration you experienced during your stay. The hotel has been very busy and unfortunately, all of the cribs had already been requested by other families. It is our goal to take your feedback and implement procedures where our guests do not have to wait 45 minutes to hear about a crib and that the response is more immediate.

Summary: We had a pretty great stay at the hyatt. Rapi was an amazing front desk attendant. He went out of his way to make sure we were taken care of. The only negative of the hotel was the people above were up pretty late at night and had children that would run around and were very disruptive. It might have just been bad luck bit who knows.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I used Hyatt points to book this hotel and it was such a great experience I would've paid for it!  First of, the hotel is pretty new and who doesn't like that?  My family and I stayed for 3 nights and was given a complimentary upgrade to a 2 Queen suite that was perfect!  The staff was super nice and accommodating and the breakfast was great!  There were a lot of people and they kept the food coming!  There's a Walgreens pretty much attached to the hotel so that was super convenient and best of all, the walk to Disney was super quick!  We'd definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was located behind Walgreen and was about 5 minutes good walk to Disneyland. The room was clean and spacious. There were some eating and cooking utensils for people who wants to cook. The complimentary breakfast was standard but refilled all the time. However, it seemed the dining space was packed most of the time but maybe because we were there in holiday season. We would give 5 stars if there wasn't a billing problem. We were charged by mistake for room charges that we had prepaid before. When we complained the front desk about it, I was told that the charges has been erased. I asked her to make sure about it because I did not stay in US so it would be troublesome for me to take care of it if there was a problem. But, it happened and even though the hotel refunded it

Summary: Staying at the Hyatt House made all the difference in our trip to Disneyland.  The early check-in was super-helpful, the extended parking was very convenient and the inclusive breakfast was really impressive/filling! We appreciated how easy going the Staff was, and willing to help make things easier.  And it truly is an easy, short walk to the Park.  We were happy we chose the Hyatt House.

Summary: I was very pleased with my 3 night stay at the Hyatt House. I had a 2 Queen suite that was very spacious with a small kitchen and seating area. Everything in the hotel was clean and new.  The hotel offers a free breakfast with limited options, but I appreciated the convenience. If you need to pick up any last minute items Walgreens is located on the first floor.  The walk to Disneyland was 10+ minutes, you have to cross through 3 intersections so the timing of the lights can slow you down. I would definitely stay here again when visiting Disneyland.

Summary: The hotel was in a perfect location if you were going to Disney. You could easily walk to the parks and to Disney village.  The staff was extremely courteous. Everything was very clean. We could even see the Disney fireworks from our window. We would definitely go again. Just remember to price in the cost of parking your car when coming up with your total cost.

Summary: My company stayed at the Hyatt House during a conference.  This was the third time I had been in the area for a conference and found Hyatt House to be our best accommodation yet.  The location is within walking distance to convention center and restaurants.  And the hotel rooms were spacious.  I would recommend this hotel for future business travel.

Summary: Terrific breakfast. Comfortable room. And only ten minutes walk to Disney. It's actually faster to leave your car here and walk to the park than park at Disney ramp and take shuttle. I would stay here again.

Summary: We were on our all girls, first ever trip to Disneyland. The Hyatt House is within a few minutes walk of the entrance to both Disneyland and California Adventure. The hotel is modern, clean, and secure. The selections for breakfast were amazing, great coffee and friendly helpful staff.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice stay at a modern hotel
Summary: The Hyatt House is one of the newer properties that have been added to the Anaheim area.  It offers a lot of pluses with very few minuses.  The location is great on the corner of Harbor and Katella.  It has easy highway and surface street access and is a 5-10 minute walk to Disneyland.  The property is well appointed and connected to a Walgreen's, which is a plus.  A complimentary breakfast is offered which is good, but not exceptional in quality.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  Parking is available on site and is easy to access from the main elevators.  The parking fee ($17/night) is reasonable, but be sure to discuss your parking needs with the front desk when you check-in and check out.  We overstayed the time on our parking pass and were charged an additional $45!   The

Summary: Very neat, clean and quiet hotel. I enjoyed my interaction with Adrian at 2:30am. He was very empathetic to my situation and got me into my room in a timely manner. Thank you! I have stayed at many Hyatts and they do not disappoint.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We spent 3 days for our disneyland trip. It is a very close walk to the Disney park from the hotel. Hotel staff is very friendly. Initially I had booked 2 rooms by mistake, but I realized that and called the hotel. They corrected the reservation with no penalty. I used the room with the king bed that had 2 berths and sofa bed. Just perfect for us and our 4 kids. The breakfast buffet included is fantastic to start the day visiting the park.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We will definitely stay here again!
Summary: We decided to stay at Hyatt House last weekend after getting a recommendation from a family member who had stayed there a couple of times. We enjoyed our entire stay! Check in went smoothly and the staff was very friendly. Our room was so nice - it was clean, the beds were comfortable and we loved the decor. Unfortunately we didn't have a chance to get to the breakfast, however we did enjoy the Happy Hour. We sat at the bar and had some great drinks made by Alex and Beltran. They were so welcoming and friendly after a long day at the parks! We come to the Anaheim area a few times a year and look forward to staying at Hyatt House again!

Summary Heading: Property and rooms look a lot nicer online
Summary: Our bathroom was disgusting when we checked in.  It clearly hadn't been cleaned.  This set the tone for how we felt about the hotel as a whole.  Wouldnt stay here again based on cleanliness alone.  We even called the front desk to have the bathroom cleaned, went to dinner and came back to a dirty bathroom.  By this time it was too late to bath the kids and it took another 30 min to get someone up to clean the bathroom.  Just gross.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you are looking for a clean, modern hotel with spacious rooms to spread out this is your place.  We stayed in a one bedroom suite with two queens and a pull out couch.  Lots of room for 5 of us.  We really enjoyed having a full size refrigerator in the room.  The wait staff at breakfast was amazing!  Go before 7:30 and enjoy a quite dining room. Even if you go later there is plenty of room and short food lines.  The room is not fancy but very clean and new.  Plus this hotel is a 10 minute walk to Disneyland.  It doesn't have some of the bells and whistles other hotels have nearby (just the basics) but if you are coming to enjoy Disneyland not be wowed by a fancy hotel this is your place.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Upgraded room through Hyatt Passport program.   We were able to arrive early, park, and go to Disneyland for the day.  The staff made it easy with early checkin (and late checkout).  Welcoming staff and great breakfast.  Able to walk to Disneyland and parking was simple.  Well done, Hyatt!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was only upset that it took over an hour for me to receive the extra towels I called for. Also only wished for thicker cut bacon. I was happy with the room size and the location that was walking distance from Disneyland and great restaurants.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Steve made this stay an exceptional one! He found out we were in town to celebrate my friends birthday (who was also staying with us) and he went out of his way to make it a special stay.  From upgrading our room to a one bedroom suite to sending a pair of mini chocolate bundt cakes and a birthday card to our room, it truly made us feel special and made the celebration even more amazing! Thanks, Steve!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: First time staying at this hotel. We usually stay at one of the Hilton property due to our gold status. For this trip, we decided to stay at the Hyatt house because it was less expensive than Hilton. I am glad we tried the Hyatt house. We stayed in their studio suites for 3 days. It was very clean and spacious. We like the separate sitting area. The bathroom was large and clean. We had a full kitchen with all of the pots, pans, utensils, bowls, plates, and cups. It had everything, including a dishwasher, microwave, and refrigerator. The staff was very nice and professional. The proximity to Disneyland was fantastic. It was a leisure 10 minute walk. Although the breakfast was complimentary, the food was mediocre. After one day of eating their breakfast, we decided to skip the hot
Manager Response: none

Summary: We spent four nights at this hotel on our Disney trip.  We are a couple, no kids with us. The lobby was well lit and modern-looking. The room was very clean comfortable.  Crisp sheets and clean sofas. Good-sized rooms and bathroom. Nice fully equipped kitchen was cool to have (even though we did not use it at all). It was a great value when comparing the price to Disney hotels. The included breakfast had a great spread.  Although we were not interested in the usual sausage and scrambled eggs, we enjoyed the oatmeal and the fresh fruit.  The coffee was not very good. They also had teas, OJ,apple juice, chocolate milk. The staff who takes care of the breakfast area works really hard to keep that place working well.  I applaud them for their efforts. About a 10-15 minute walk to

Summary Heading: Awesome place to stay while traveling to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed her in January 2017 and was super impressed with this hotel! It was a family trip and the main purpose was to visit Disneyland. The walk there was about 15 minutes and that was perfect. The hotel was much nicer than the majority of the run down family accommodations we saw in our trip and in my opinion, the price was right! They had a really really awesome breakfast every day! So much better than the average continental breakfast offered at most places. The rooms were beautiful, roomy and very spacious. Staff were very friendly and helpful with anything we needed. The pool was perfect for an evening dip after the park- we even had dinner and a few cocktails for the adults to wind down!!  Overall great! I'd say again 100%
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Stay at a Great Property
Summary: I can't say enough about this property. The staff is wonderful. The rooms were spacious and clean. I was there with my husband and 3 children for their first visit to Disneyland. We stayed in the 2 queen studio which has a kitchenette. The room was like a small apartment and the view of Disneyland and the fireworks were unbelievable. The beds were extremely comfortable. Not too firm and not too soft. Just right. It was nice having a refrigerator to keep our snacks cold to take to Disney. There is cold water in the lobby every morning that we would use to fill out water bottles. The breakfast is fairly decent. I can't complain because it is free. We picked the things that we liked. The fresh fruit was the best part. I have read reviews that complained about the traffic if they

Summary: This is our third trip to Disneyland in less than a year and we will be back again next month for my daughters cheer competition. I wish I would have found this hotel earlier! We had originally planned on staying at a different hotel next month but we have decided that the Hyatt House will fit our needs much better. I can't say enough about the professional staff, especially Terra at the front desk. She went above and beyond for us. Our little granddaughter hurt herself while in the park and Terra was very sweet and helpful in finding a place for us to take her for treatment. When we got into our room that evening there was a bouquet of balloons with sweet little messages on them along with a nice card and yummy treats, this made a two year old very happy. We loved the breakfast

Summary: Hotel was perfect for our family trip to Disneyland! We had some issues being on the 3rd floor and noise of people above us.  Front desk staff was amazing and switched our room to the top level on day 3 of our 6 day stay.  We had the family room suite with divider  doors which made it great to put our son down for bedtime and still have a room to be in! Will definitely be booking again !
Manager Response: none

Summary: To say this hotel was amazing would be an understatement! Checking in was quick and easy and the guy who helped us (I can't remember his name) was very friendly and gave us the info about our stay. We got up to our room, a one bedroom suite, and it was very clean and pleasant smelling. The beds were very comfortable and I'm super picky when it comes to beds. The included hot breakfast was a perfect start to our day and there were quite a few options to choose from.   By this point we were already impressed with this place and talked about staying here on our next Disneyland trip, then the AMAZING Cheterra came into our life! Summary: I have been staying here for business since October last year, once or twice a month.  The rooms are great, good size and facility in your room. All you need. The gym has great machines with virtual runs which are good.  Staff are all very friendly, particularly the breakfast waiting staff who work tirelessly.  The only downsides are breakfast is the same every day, which if you visit often becomes same same.  Bar is small in the lobby.  Other than that this place does a lot right and is good value for money.  The hotel is kept very clean. The staff make the difference.

Summary: My family of five stayed here for our trip to Disney.  It's within close walking distance and the kids LOVED the bunk beds.  The one room suite is the way to go.  We were able to close the kids in the room to sleep while my husband and I relaxed to watch TV.  It's very reasonably priced and the staff is fantastic.  Best part - THE BREAKFAST.  Wow.  Great spread.  Staff was quick to clean tables and the eggs/bacon/potatoes/bagels/etc were great.  Saved us a ton of money feeding a large family here rather than at the park.

Summary: Although I'm writing this review a month late, I have nothing but great things to say about the Hyatt House. I initially booked a Queen studio suite for our 5 day trip to Disneyland. My boyfriend found this new hotel establishment online after there were no more DVC rooms available at the Grand Californian during the time we wanted to go. The price was incredibly reasonable being that they've only been open since June 2016 so we decided to reserve a room. We put in a special request to be on the highest floor available with a room facing the fireworks if possible.  On the day of arrival, we walked in the lobby area and everything was so fresh, clean and modern. It was evident right away how new this place was and we were greeted with very enthusiastic smiles. Manager Response: none

Paint on bathroom floor, drywall nail pops, dirty windows, dust you can write your name in on top of fridge. Kitchen had two spoons....but 4 steak knives. Overall weird hotel. Housekeeping staff were loud in hallways and unprofessional...dressed in jeans and chewing gum and disinterested in returning a cordial hello when passed in hallway or elevator. Summary Heading: Great hotel walking distance from Disneyland
Summary: This is a terrific hotel, just a few blocks from to Disneyland. Rooms are comfortable,  breakfast (included) is excellent, covered parking is available,  staff is friendly and helpful.  I'd highly recommend it.

Summary: Great location,amazing staff,beautiful rooms!  So great I'm coming back next month! Summary Heading: Great location, staff, and food. Decent on comfort.

The room itself was a downer - while it had great sleeping space (bunk bed, sofa bed, and a queen bed), the extra firm queen bed gave my wife and I backaches while we walked the theme park and we only got 2 bath towels in the room. The breakfast buffet was fantastic - great food with two lines for quick wait times, plenty of tables, outdoor heaters and a pool table. If it wasn't for the bed, I'd have given this place a 9 or 10 since everything else was terrific, but 10 hours in a theme park with 3 kids and a sore back dropped my

Summary: Great new hotel close  to Disneyland with wonderful breakfast included. Rates were comparable, service was good, room was great and clean. Will definitely stay here on our next trip to Disneyland later in the year.

Summary: Service was great. Was fast and friendly. Rooms were not as big as you see online. Beds not very comfortable. Breakfast was not very good. Hotel was clean. Closely located to Disneyland. 10 minute walk.

Summary: This was a great hotel to stay at. Staff is friendly. Breakfast buffet every morning with great food. Rooms are very clean and modern. Ours had a kitchen which was awesome. Walking causal it took 20 mins to get to Disneyland. There is a Walgreens attached to the hotel that sells anything you need. Even umbrella strollers and ice cream. Great value.

Summary Heading: Excellent short stay for a Disneyland race weekend
Summary: I recently participated in the RunDisney Star Wars Lightside Half Marathon in Disneyland.  I chose to stay at this fairly new Hyatt House.  The lobby is modern and beautiful.  The room was spacious, modern and crisp.  The shower was exceptional.  It is a relatively short walk to the Disneyland Resort Parks (15-20 minutes realistically).  There are many conveniences with a Walgreens and CVS right there as well as many popular chain restaurants.  The only semi-negative comment is that I got there early in the morning and yet my room wasn't ready until the 4 pm official check in time.  Luckily there is plenty to do around there so I was able to use my time wisely.  I recommend for those choosing to visit Disneyland without spending the expensive cost of staying at one of the

Summary Heading: Outstanding location, free breakfast, decent rooms
Summary: We stayed here over a holiday weekend (MLk Day). It was overly crowded due to a Disney Half Marathon race weekend, but the hotel still gets a 4 rating from me. The staff was very friendly, the rooms were clean, the breakfast was plenty. Not the best quality breakfast Buffett food but it's included in the rate, so take advantage. The location is this property's best asset. It's a ten minute walk to the front gate at Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean New Hotel with Excellent Service
Summary: We celebrated our one year anniversary at the Hyatt and Disneyland parks. Upon check-in we were greeted by Samantha and Jass who helped to check us in, our room was ready, and we got to talking about our plans and mentioned we were celebrating. The hotel was great location to walk to Disneyland and the room was large and clean. We spent the day at the park and after a long day came back to our room with a welcome surprise and thoughtful card from the Hyatt team. It was such a thoughtful touch that made our anniversary that much more special. We will be coming back here for the great location, excellent service, clean rooms, and overall value. Thank you!

Summary: What a wonderful and family friendly place to stay! Gorgeous, quiet room. Excellent view from the 5th floor. Pool, breakfast, staff, everything was just perfect. Highly recommend and will definitely return here.

Summary: Rooms are twice the size of any normal hotel room.  Small kitchen with living room area and a spacious bedroom/bath.  Beds were comfortable and everything was clean.  Staff were very helpful and accommodating with Disney questions.  We walked to Disneyland since we had a stroller for our toddler but smaller children would probably have a tough time making that walk at the end of the day.  Breakfast was great with many choices and plenty of space to eat.  The only reason we'd stay anywhere else in Disney area is if we found something within closer walking distance for less.  Otherwise, it was perfect....well except for the $17 parking charge.

Summary: The Hyatt House was outstanding in every respect!  It's clean, modern, and has spacious rooms and an accommodating team to help you out.   They treated us well and gave great recommendations.  It's nice that a Walgreens is right there, and Starbucks coming soon!

Summary: We stayed one night to get in two days at a conference.  The room we had was more like a suite.  The front area w/ bunk beds (which we didn't need) had sliding doors for privacy.  Bed was comfortable, linens were clean.  The hotel lobby is somewhat discrete.  Location to the convention center was great, just a short walk.  it's close to plenty of restaurants as well.

Summary: We had a wonderful experience with our room and with the staff. The room was very clean and spacious. The kitchen had everything we needed.  Our neighbors were a bit noisy on our last night but what can you do? Somebody else must have called down to the front desk and it was handled. Having Walgreens downstairs was very convenient since we forgot a few things.  Will definitely stay here again!!

Summary Heading: Best experience at a hotel in Anaheim
Summary: Best experience at a hotel in Anaheim.   I go to the NAMM music convention every year, for many, many years.  This hotel was a few feet further from the convention center than  The usual places.  Five extra minutes walk. But, the Hotel, room, breakfast, and staff  were far superior in quality, comfort, and cleanliness. I am definitely returning for business or vacation.

Summary Heading: Ok as an option near Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here as a family of four on our recent trip to Disney. The hotel itself is good for families and in a good location. The staff here try hard but there is definitely some sort staffing issue - housekeeping was not up to scratch and the front desk seemed a bit frazzled. Our room was not refreshed between 8 am and 4 pm which is not good enough for the premium paid over other hotels in the area. Perhaps the hotel is understaffed. It was certainly adequate but pricey for what you get during peak times.

Summary: Great location if you're going to Disneyland, the convention center, or just hanging out for a stay-cation. Clean hotel, super sweet and helpful staff (especially Cheterra at the front - this girl just has the warmest and most welcoming smile. It's like coming home to family), and great complimentary breakfast. The breakfast area is huge and they had bacon, eggs, sausage, french toast, greek yogurt, oatmeal, pastries, cereal, coffee, tea, and even almond milk! There is staff that's always on the floor to help bust your plates as soon as you're done. I am so thankful for them as it kept the area looking spick and span. There is also an outdoor heated pool with a jacuzzi (that has a foam button!!) - yup, the kids don't have all the fun!

Summary: We had a great stay at the Hyatt House. The staff was very friendly and our room was amazing. The breakfast was top notch and we'd definitely stay here again when we come to the area to visit. Check in and out was a breeze and we had a great experience!

Summary Heading: What a quality stay for an EXCELLENT price!
Summary: We got a family suite with bunkbeds, a kitchen, two televisions, etc. and breakfast included for about $189 a night. The outdoor pool and the (indoor) fitness center are beautiful. The breakfast was top quality, and with non-dairy milk and peanut butter this vegan was in heaven with her non-vegetarian family. This place is an absolute gem and such a value for Disney. Disneyland is an easy point-six mile walk up the street! It's also adjacent to a Walgreens, walking distance to several restaurants (vegan pie at the Pizza Press!), and across the street from a CVS. What a find. Service is so friendly and accommodating, and everything here is clean and new.

Summary: The rooms are perfect for family vacations.  Very close (walking distance) to Disney and having a Walgreen's pharmacy is always very comforting. Great people at the reception and always willing to help

Summary: The hotel is perfectly located for Disneyland.  The staff were extremely friendly and accommodating. The rooms were Perfect! Clean, modern and the beds and pillows were Wonderfully comfortable.  The breakfast buffet was very tasty.

Summary: Excellent hotel.  Modern, very clean and well maintained. We stayed in a little apartment, really good size. Staff very friendly and breakfast good too.   Close to Disneyland and some good restaurants within walking distance.  Will be back to this hotel.

Summary: We stayed at the Hyatt House while we were visiting Disneyland. The food options included scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, breakfast potatoes, pancakes, cereal, pastries, coffee and juice. The food was good and there was plenty of seating in the dining area.   The staff at the hotel was friendly and efficient. I would definitely stay here again and I will recommend this hotel to friends/family.

Summary: Check in was pleasant and the service was great. Complimentary breakfast was my deal breaker when i choose this hotel, and the rooms are beautiful. Highly recommend this hotel if your visiting Disney Park. All within walking distance. AAA+
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive feedback salsakingjr! WE appreciate you taking the time to write such kind review. We hope you decide to stay with us again on your next Anaheim trip. We'd love to host you again!

Summary: Customer service is poor at the Aneheim location. I'm still waiting for my concern to be addressed / I was double charged for our hotel room which is never acceptable. We will stay at the Marriott next time and Not be double charged or pay for parking.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review and your feedback regarding being double-charged. I researched your reservation, and it appears when you checked out, you gave a different card than what you had given at check-in. Upon check-in at any hotel, your credit card is always authorized for the full amount of your stay. This card was only authorized, not charged. Based on the bank policies, the authorization falls off after 2-3 days. The different card you gave at checkout was the card that was actually charged. In regards to parking, as with all hotels in the Resort area including Marriott, we do charge for parking.
