In order to prevent misinformation, I would like to share that our parking is $17 per day. For those that would like a bit of a shorter walk to their guestrooms, I would recommend requesting a room closer to the elevator. However, if it is a Disney view that you are requesting, you may be a bit further from the elevator.

Summary: Worst hotel experience ever! The hotel double charged me and my bank would not release the money unless the hotel did a reversal and the hotel staff said they couldn't do a reversal since it was a hold and not a charge. Long story short, we weren't able to get souvenirs or eat at a nice place like we had planned for our last night because of the $717 we were overcharged. The service for us was not good. The breakfast is good, but go early because they start running out of things and it gets insanely crowded. I would not stay here again. This hotels incompetence ruined our Disney vacation. I was on the phone with my bank for 2 hours yesterday trying to get this resolved and it never got resolved. Hopefully the charge will fall off in a few days. We also put our do not disturb
Manager Response: I would like to offer my sincere apologies for your disappointing stay with us. We did speak with your bank to release the funds, unfortunately, we are then beholden to them in the timeliness of releasing your funds. I am truly sorry that they were not released quick enough for you to enjoy the remainder of your stay. We know that a visit to Anaheim and Disneyland is a special trip, and our staff tries their best to help create special memories for each family.

Summary: We had a great time ..I would come back..great customer service.  Like to thank staff and management for our parking pass too. Was our first time at Disneyland and enjoy it...family had so much fun..also the breakfast was very good...made it helpful with budget..
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent new addition to Disney Resort area
Summary: Wow!  This place was amazing. Brand sparkling new and spacious rooms, friendly staff and great location. The rooms are complete with a mini kitchen which is idea for families vacationing in Orange County.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Room Not Read until Three Hours after Stated Check-In Time
Summary: The hotel is new, so it's nice and clean.  We were there during the week in early December to beat the Disneyland crowds, but the lobby and breakfast were still very crowded.  The breakfast crowd really wasn't a problem bc the rooms are spacious and have a kitchenette so taking breakfast to your room is not a big deal.  People are in the hallways late into the night, so it's a little noisy.  My biggest complaint is that my confirmation email said that check-in is 3:00 pm and we arrived at 5:30.  Our room wasn't ready until 6.  The staff at the front desk were incredibly friendly but when I filled in our survey the rote email  response I got from Lead Front Desk Supervisor, Ray Richardson struck a nerve.  He stated that the hotel was "fully committed the night prior" and that is
Manager Response: I was disappointed to hear that you did not get checked in until 6pm. My sincere apologies for the misinformation you received on your confirmation email, as our check-in is 4pm. With that being said, we still were not able to adequately get you checked in at the appropriate time. I hope that you will give us another opportunity to welcome you back and offer you the service that you were expecting.

Summary: Traveled to Disney with my granddaughter for the first time - long walk to the park - shuttles not close or explained properly.  Room was nice but the kitchen was closed when we wanted lunch for room service after a long morning.
Manager Response: Our location is in the heart of the Anaheim Resort area, however, for a small child it can be a bit of a distance, since it's about a 10-15 minute walk. The ART shuttle does pick up directly at the hotel next door. In regards to room service, as we are a select-service hotel, we actually do not have room service. We do have a chef on property during the day and our guests can always order off the menu in our H Bar.

Summary: The Hotel is very clean and up to date, which should be expected since the staff informed me that it had only been open for about 4 months. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The location is great 15min walk to Disney and next to 24hr walgreens and across the street from 24hr cvs.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you're not wanting to stay on property at the resort, I'd stay here. The walk isn't bad (10 minutes) and the kids loved the bunk beds. I always look for a place with a separate room for the kids. The breakfast in the morning was great!
Manager Response: none

Summary: almost brand new hotel,will come back again and will recommend to friends and family,breakfast a plus!!! parking fee not average compared to other hotels,was overpriced!! but we loved our room!!!walking distance to Disney not bad,food places across street,try to request rooms facing harbor or Katella
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a good family location with suites or large rooms and a kitchen area which is close to restaurants, convention center,  pharmacy and Disneyland.   We can walk to Disney in about 10 minutes or less.   Hotel does not have a Disney Shuttle which many do so this should be considered.  They said you can purchase a shuttle ticket and walk across to Red Lion Inn to catch the shuttle but when so many do have a shuttle this is probably  a downfall.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Considering the location, there is a lot of bang for your buck here. Large bedroom, HUGE bathroom, plenty of living space with a nice separation by the bar top.   Unfortunately, there was a crying baby next door so we got poor sleep.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed as a family vacation and were very impressed with the staff, breakfast and location to Disneyland! The rooms were extremely clean and provided everything we needed.  The kitchen was a huge benefit to being able to eat in the room and not have to eat out every meal.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to stay for Disneyland vacation!
Summary: This place is fantastic!  It is new so everything is fresh and clean.  I was there with my husband, but we had a room with 2 queen beds.  That, plus the pull-out sofa would have allowed 6 people to stay there easily.  Great kitchen with stove, microwave, refrigerator, sink, everything you could want.  Large kitchen island with 2 bar stools.  Separate living room with flat screen TV able to rotate to watch it in bed or in the living room.  Convenient outlets everywhere, lots of clothes storage space.  We only got up early enough for the complementary breakfast buffet one day but it was good (not great but good :)  I am a loyal Hyatt member and I love their new addition - the Hyatt House.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Brand New Hotel with exelent service
Summary: Great stay overall  staff really cares and very  friendly with brand new & clean rooms pool area well attended  Fresh and tasty breakfast ,convenient Parking area and close to amenities Downtown Disney and Parks
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Studio room was great size with its on kitchen separate living room. Clean and can't be any better. Staff is friendly. Breakfast is great and the location is perfect. Walking distance to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great family hotel about 1 block from Disneyland!
Summary: Brand new hotel about a 10-15 minute walk from Disneyland. The staff was absolutely wonderful! Everyone at check-in, Alex and the other staff at the H Bar, and the staff at breakfast were all quite friendly and warm. Hospitality was warm and friendly, each morning and evening saying hello as we walked through the hallways. (Thanks especially to Alex and the H Bar staff for helping to keep our toddler entertained and turning on the Utah vs. CU game for us when we arrived!)  We had a standard room (not suite), and it was just enough for me and my family (me, husband, toddler). Upon arrival the room was clean. In fact, the hotel and rooms are so new that in some corners of the shower the construction marks are still present (pencil indicators to mark where the shower soap dish
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, close to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel was amazing. I stumbled on this place while trying to book a last minute vacation to Disneyland. Free hot breakfast. Close 10 min walk to Disneyland. The rooms are nice and clean. Hotel staff was so helpful and nice. I will use this hotel from now on.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Hyatt House for our short vacation to DisneyLand. This place is newly built and very nice. We stayed in a corner suite and were happy with the cleanliness and extra space in our room. Every morning we made it to the lobby for a delicious hot breakfast. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We didn't make it to the pool but we're happy to know that it was heated. Overall, we were very satisfied with our stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great place to stay when visiting Disneyland. Walking distance to the parks, the rooms are great. Walking distance to restaurants and shops. Definitely will choose this hotel again. Breakfast was great and the stuff was very friendly.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We will definitely choose the Hyatt house again when we have the opportunity to visit Disneyland.thank you for the wonderful hospitality, the clean and comfortable rooms, and the friendly staff. The convenience of a Walgreens right next-door was a much added perk! They provided all the extras that we forgot to bring or wanted to shop for.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent place for family stay near Disneyland
Summary: We had a great stay.  I was especially impressed with the customer service of the staff.  Rapi and Adrian at the front desk were extremely helpful and accommodating and made my experience superior.  They should both be commended for their excellent service!  They both went above and beyond in helping me out with a complicated reservation.  Additionally, I forgot my stroller, and Rapi was on the phone arranging a stroller rental for me immediately!  The hotel was clean, and we loved having the bunk beds in our room.  Breakfast selection was excellent as well.  Thank you Hyatt House.  I would definitely recommend to friends and we will be back.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location and staff are very friendly
Summary: My wife and I took our kids to Disneyland last week.  We had a great experience staying at this Hotel.  The staff were very helpful in helping us get around the area.  Approximately 8 minute walk to Disney and great restaurants down the street.  Full kitchen - well stocked with utensils - and Walgreens was just downstairs!  Would definitely stay here again.  My 5th visit to the Anaheim area - far and away the best Hotel I've stayed at.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is fairly new hotel within walking distance to Disneyland or a $7 Lyft ride. Very modern feel to hotel and front desk employees were very pleasant. Timmy was very helpful with explaining locations/hours of pool,gym and breakfast. Also explained needing key for elevator..an added security measure which is nice! The free breakfast was nice and staff was very busy cleaning off tables and removing dirty dishes that we felt we had to leave a tip for them ! Our room was mostly quiet in regards to street noise but hotel is close to Disneyland and convention center so it is expected to be a busy traffic area. Only complaint I had was in regards to housekeeping. I had left iron/ ironing board out ( too hot to put away) and it wasn't put away when we returned that night. I also had
Manager Response: none

Summary: A very nice hotel! Friendly staff.  Rooms were nice. Only a 15 minute walk to Disneyland.  Excellent morning breakfast buffet!  Rooms were clean.  Certain rooms even give you a great view of the fireworks at Disneyland.  Would definitely go back to stay there.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My stay was awful, couldn't believe how we were treated , my son was hurt in the elevator after slipping on standing water. I asked the front desk for help. The told me where the Walgreens was and that's about it. Gave me the wrong rooms and let me know that it was most likely my fault.
Manager Response: I am deeply sorry for your experience at our hotel. I did speak with our Front Office Supervisor, who is also a nurse, regarding your son slipping in the elevator, and he explained that he immediately asked if your son needed medical attention 3 times. You shared with him that your son was fine and that all he needed was a band-aid and ointment. As we helped arrange other accommodations at another Hyatt, we hope you and your family enjoyed the rest of your vacation.

Summary Heading: Great price, great amenities, location and a State Employee Rate!
Summary: This hotel is new and clean and convenient. It only took us 7-8 minutes to walk to the Disneyland parks from our hotel. Having a Walgreens in the lobby and a CVS across the street was really convenient. We were able to save money on food and drinks, by purchasing at these stores instead of in the parks. The hotel also has a 24 hour sundries shop, but you have to pay at the front desk, and unfortunately every time I wanted to buy something there was a long line of people waiting to check in. There should be a kiosk that you can pay through with your card. The hotel also includes free hot breakfast, although we did arrive for breakfast at 9:45 and it was already done when it was supposed to run until 10am. The rooms are really comfortable. We got an AMAZING rate as I am a state
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at Hyatt House with our three children. The hotel was fantastic, the staff were wonderful. We spent 12 days in Los Angeles on holiday and went to numerous theme parks. The Hyatt House is exceptionally close to Disneyland had a great pool area and having Walgreens alongside was very convenient. The buffet breakfast every morning was great - a good variety of good food. I would gladly recommend this hotel to friends and family.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Wonderful place to stay at on your Vacation. Friendly staff. Clean and comfortable rooms. Felt very secure. Breakfast Bar was one of the best that we have had. Pool and Jacuzzi in the same building, you didn't have to walk to far to use it. Fine Exercise room that was open 24hrs. Relaxing. Front desk was always asking if we were ok.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great, great option for Disney trip!
Summary: We were amazed by how good this hotel is! Walking distance from Disney, super family friendly, great rooms, and staff amazing! Specially a guy who helped us with the chaotic breakfast (3 really excited and energetic kids) called Rey and a super nice bartender who served us dinner one night called Beltran. They made us really feel at home and went out of their way to help us.  There is a huge Walgreens on the hotel grounds chick makes life really easy. Will definitely stay here whenever we come back! Congrats to all the staff for making this hotel such a great option!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a great hotel to stay if staying near Disneyland. Short walking distance to the theme parks. Very modern decor. Staff is very courteous. My whole family enjoyed our stay. The hotel is newly built and in great condition. Their hot breakfast is great but very crowded after 8:00 AM. Will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Highly recommend.  Great accommodations and walking distance to the park.  Nice pool/hot tub and great buffet breakfast.  Family of five stayed in the family suite which was a bonus with bunk beds.  Plenty of space in the room even good size refrigerator.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our first stay at this hotel. Parking was easy, hotel is very clean and beds are comfy. Our room did not have a bath tub so if that is important to you, make sure you ask. Dining area was large which was a plus since it was packed during breakfast. The only negative is that our room faced Katella and every night about 4 ambulances and fire trucks would roll out to calls at all hours of the night. There must be a hospital or fire station nearby. It made us all weary and tired.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review. It sounds like you reserved a King Den guestrooms, which does not have a tub, only a shower. At times you will hear street noise due to our central location in the Anaheim Resort area. However, it is these rooms that have views of the Disney fireworks. We hope that if you visit the area again, that you request a room with a view of the pool, which might be a bit quieter for you and your family.

Summary: Stayed here for a night Good Staff Great Open feeling - Not too crowded in the breakfast area Decent walk to Disney Parking is expensive - with the taxes & all Good breakfast area - Nice selection of Tea
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great place to stay if you are there to attend different events in the area. The hotel is new and show in the décor as well as the housekeeping service. The breakfast buffet was excellent, and employees were very nice and ready to help. The check-in was a breeze, except they forget to mention you must use your room key card for the elevator. Luckily another guest came to provide us that information. Other than that front desk people were very nice and professional to help. Since this is a new hotel there are some kinks that needs improving. Housekeeping really need some improvement in properly servicing rooms. They had a problem in giving us the right amount of towels and washcloths each day. On Black Friday, they were no where to be found once we returned to our room in the
Manager Response: I appreciate the feedback that you shared regarding your experience at Hyatt House. As we do have housekeepers on duty 7 days a week, including Holidays, I apologize for your room not being properly serviced. I will be sharing your review with our Housekeeping Director so she is able to correct the issues that you experienced.

Summary: There are a lot of things to love about this place: new, clean, modern, fully stocked kitchen in the suite, great buffet breakfast, friendly staff, and a Walgreens right next door!!! I can't say enough how helpful that is. The only constructive criticism I have is the very close proximity of bathroom door to one of the queen beds. Every time someone went to the bathroom in the middle of the night and/or early morning, I was able to hear everything! I'm a light sleeper so this was very irritating. Maybe a thicker door is needed or maybe move the bed over a bit. Everything else was so awesome so I won't hold that against Hyatt House :)
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice, new hotel. Very clean. The rooms are small, but very well laid-out. The breakfast buffet exceeded expectations. Most importantly, the property is located just a short walk from Disney / California Adventure. It's definitely the nicest non-Disney property we've ever stayed at while visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This gem is a short walk to Disneyand, the staff is amazing, property very clean and we'll maintained, and has the best hotel breakfast I have ever had. The rooms are set up so you can keep the kids on a schedule or head back easily either walking or by city bus for nap time or meals. 24 hour Walgreens right next door, bus stop is located 2 businesses south of the property.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Brand new hotel Close to Disneyland!
Summary: Stayed this past weekend for the second time in a month while visiting Disneyland. We will definitely stay again! The staff was very accommodating and gave my daughter a welcome gift of candy and snacks in our room. It made her day!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We transferred from the Disney Grand Californian to Hyatt House halfway through a recent visit to Anaheim.  Despite the Disney hotel being nearly 3 times the cost, the Hyatt House room was significantly better at accommodating our family.  The rooms are large, comfortable, fully equipped.  and clean.  The stay also included a wonderful breakfast.  We've stayed at Hyatt House in other cities and the hotels are always new, clean, peaceful and extremely friendly.  They are among the best hotel experiences we've had.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Full kitchen, but no oven.    Great HOT tub.  Need another elevator at ends of hallways.  Missing a street exit.  There are cheaper places closer to DL, but they are older and dirtier.   Guest services are always willing to help.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice hotel!!  Great location!!  Staff was helpful and nice!! Food was yummy!! Walking distance to Disneyland. Room was comfortable, and spacious!!  Kids loved!! Didn't get to use the pool but looked big and clean.  Will be staying again soon!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Peace of mind while visiting the most magical place on earth!
Summary: We not only got early check in the front desk were all smiles and completely professional. Answered all of our questions and explained everything up front so later I wasn't wondering about anything. Breakfast is clean, hot and everyday a little different. The staff are all friendly and eager to help when needed. Our "mini" apartment exceeded our expectations. New of course, but the layout is perfect for a 5 day stay. Enough room for if I had brought my entire family.   I will recommend to anyone that is looking to stay within walking distance. I preferred taking the ART everyday (lazy me)  But the Walgreen's/CVS and the Coffee Beanery across the street made it all the better. We will be back !  Thank you to the entire staff for a top notch stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent Family Hotel Close to Disneyland
Summary: We greatly enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt House.  It is new, clean, and a beautiful hotel.  We needed space to accommodate our large family, and the two-room suite worked very well.  It gave our kids enough space and allowed my husband and I our own as well.  Our kids loved the pool, and the hot tub was huge.  The complementary breakfast was fantastic--lots of variety and delicious.  It is an easy walk to Disneyland (just over a half mile).  We would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pros: New hotel with small kitchen that has kitchen utensils, pots and pan and small fridge. Good for family. Plenty of conveniences close by.  Clean, comfortable bed, sofa bed. Relaxing  lobby. Breakfast is included. Walking distance to Disneyland and Disney California Adventure. Walgreens store next to the hotel which is convenient for any necessities.   Con: Hotel room has thin wall that you can hear conversation from another room. Bar table next to the kitchen made the room so cramp. Not enough toiletries for 5 people. Bed states in the website is queen but it's a double bed in actuality.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and feedback regarding Hyatt House. Unfortunately, at times, we might have guests that are a bit noisier than others. Our Front Desk staff is always happy to address the noise issue immediately so you are able to enjoy a quiet guestroom. I also would like to correct your statement regarding bedding so our customers have the correct information. As our website states, all of our guestrooms are either king-size beds or queen-size beds. We do not have any guestrooms with double beds.

Summary: We had 3 rooms for family, the family suite was not great for young teens as beds were not that comfortable and with ac on and door closed the room was very cold. Not enough bedding, kids were cold.temperature was hard to control in the whole room
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: It's a newer hotel that is working its kinks out. Hoping things improve.
Summary: There was some housekeeping issues but the breakfast was decent, bed was decent and the front desk staff was great! It's a newer hotel close to Disneyland but I rather stay further back and just walk to the Woody parking lot Shuttle bus.
Manager Response: As you stated, we are a new hotel and we are working every day to improve and deliver exceptional service to all of our guests during their stay. Your feedback is invaluable in helping us reach our goal.

Summary Heading: Excellent for area but street noise
Summary: New, great condition, great staff, full free buffet breakfast, comfortable rooms with microwave and refrigerator, big heated outside pool that would allow short lap swimming, great pool deck, some rooms view Disney fireworks. Can walk to Anaheim Convention Center, probably to Disneyland too.  Next to Walgreens and IHOP.  Would be excellent for families.  The only downside is that it's located right on the intersection of two busy multilane Southern California streets so the traffic noise is bad if your room faces the street.  Light sleepers might have a problem. And I don't how it would be for business travelers when the hotel is full of families visiting Disney, e.g. during school vacation time.
Manager Response: Due to our premier location in the heart of the Anaheim Resort, you can experience noise during the busy Holiday season. On the plus side, a number of those rooms have the view of the Disney fireworks. Should any guest prefer a quieter room, please let our Front Desk know, and they will be sure to place you away from the street.

Summary: This is the first time I stayed here as they are new.  The decor is VERY VERY similar to the Hyatt Place right across the street.  This place is HUGE it was a really long walk to my room.  The lobby is big and well decorated with a sports bar in the middle.  My room had a view of Disneyland and can see the fireworks
Manager Response: none

Summary: Overall my stay this time at Hyatt House Anaheim was very good. I enjoy the rooms and the amenities. They still have one of the 'hottest' temperature-wise whirlpools in the area, that is very comforting after a long day walking in Disneyland. Brekfast changes daily, and is very good fare
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a great place to stay.  The hotel is very close to Disneyland, so we didn't have to worry about taking a bus.  They have a great breakfast that comes with your hotel stay.  The parking is very easy.   The rooms are very clean.  They have very friendly and helpful staff.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is an  excellent hotel.The room was very clean, quiet and we especially liked the fact that the room had central air vs. an air conditioning unit.  The hotel is within walking distance to Disneyland. Would book this hotel again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We actually came to the Hyatt House by accident after a mix-up with our reservation at another hotel.  Could not have been more pleased.  Very calm, soothing decor.  Room was spacious with all the amenities we could want and more.  Complimentary breakfast was excellent.  Highly recommend.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family had a great experience with Hyatt House. There are a bunch of nice eating establishments within walking distance and the Walgreens downstairs was very convenient. My kids enjoyed watching the Disneyland fireworks from the window of our hotel room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was getting ready to stay at another hotel when I came across this new one in Anaheim. The location was exactly 12 minutes walk to the front gate of Disneyland. The workers were friendly and the rooms were clean and new which is nice. It comes with a nice breakfast buffet in the am as an added bonus. Parking is under $20 a night and easy to access with the elevator. The extra room was great too in the room. I plan to stay here again in the future.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I loved the updated hotel and room. The staff was helpful especially Terra at the front desk. The complimentary breakfast was just ok and would have preferred a hotel with a shuttle to Disneyland instead of the breakfast. The shuttle is something I strongly suggest them adding, if your paying for parking in the hotel and then have to pay for parking at Disneyland the cost is outrageous! I would stay closer to the park next time instead for a higher cost. We traveled with 3 adults and 1 teen and are feet where tired I can only imagine the people with small kids and strollers it would be so exhausting.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Overall great.  Bar needs more food choices to include fried calamari and fish/chips among other bar favorites.  Breakfast buffet need non-pork meat items.  Parking fee of $17 is a little high.  Great place for families
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great Hotel, Great Value, and a Terrific Staff Hotel rooms are clean, and the beds are extremely comfortable... Would stay here again on our next trip to the Happiest Place On Earth! Disneyland 2016...
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location location location! It's literally right next to disneyland. You still have to walk about 10-15 minutes to get to the Disneyland entrance because Dland is so big. Even if you drove to Dland you'd still have to walk 10-15 minutes from parking to entrance, so definitely worth it for the location.  The building looks brand spanking new. Very clean throughout. The service is good enough. Not a luxury hotel, so don't expect that and you'll be happy enough. There is a 24 hour CVS right across the street. There is a Walgreens that's even closer. It's actually connected to the hotel. It has everything you might need on a family trip. Minor groceries, toys, picnic supplies, toiletries, etc.   There is a regular room. Has mini kitchenette. The family room has a bunk bed and pull
Manager Response: none

Summary: Loved everything about our stay here with only one small exception... the customer service was excellent and location to Disneyland was perfect. The only down side was the breakfast gross and over crowded. Plan to eat elsewhere if you want clean warm food. I would definitely stay here again just not plan to eat breakfast here.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Amazing location amazing service and amazing staff. Close enough to Disney to walk and close enough to restaurants when you need an alternative.  We really enjoyed the room (especially bunk beds for our kids) and the entire experience - we would recommend this again and again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Check-in was poorly managed. Room (microwave) not cleaned properly when we checked in (the tray was full of some dirty stuff that looked hard). Staff only explained that they did not have enough housekeeping staff. I mean this is not a B&B!
Manager Response: I would like to apologize for the experience you had at our hotel. I am truly disappointed in the service you received during your stay. This has been discussed with our Executive Team, and we will remedy the situation immediately. I hope the next time you are visiting Anaheim that you will give us an opportunity to show you the service that is normally provided at our hotel.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but don't get the Disney view
Summary: It's a new (2016), family friendly hotel.  The staff is always nice and courteous.  Don't get the Disneyland view.  You are overlooking a very busy street and emergency vehicles can wake you up in middle of the night.
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear that you experienced a bit of noise while staying with us in one of our Disney view rooms. At times, the street can be a bit busy as we are located in the heart of the Resort area. Hopefully, the next time you are visiting Anaheim, you can experience one of our rooms facing the pool and enjoy a quieter night.

Summary: This facility is new, exceptionally well appointed and well designed for a family visiting Anaheim. Rooms are thoughtfully appointed and well laid out. Exceptional breakfast facility. (Did I mention "free?") Exceptional exercise room, pool and hot-tub. This is a real value. We've stayed in many higher-end full and limited service hotels close to the Disneyland Resort, but this is the best value we've discovered. Disneyland Hotel may be more convenient, but at $200 to $300 more per night and only a 10 minute walk to the park  or 5 minute ART bus to the entrance, DH can't compete in value.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to stay while visiting Disneyland
Summary: Close to everything. Walked everywhere. Very clean. Safe location. Staff was friendly. Buffet was good for kids. Security in parking lot. Rooms were big, clean and quite. No complaints. Will stay here again on our next visit to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Day 1 - Pool area was far better than expected - Noisy neighbor kept us up past 2 AM Day 2 - Fire Alarm had us evacuating after 9 PM Day 3 - Very Good Day 4 - Very Good Day 5 - Very Good Day 6 - Very Good Day 7 - Realized that our door had not been latching when we exited.  When we got back to the room we could push the door open, even though when the door closed it slammed behind us. Day 8 - Very Good Day 9 - Very Good but sad to go.  We loved the divided bunkbed room.  Would have liked a better view but, proximity to Disney was very good.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a new hotel, so they are having start up issues.  Overall a nice stay, but nothing special given the price.  The suite is on the small side, and the room is not insulated for normal noise.  Street traffic and hallway conversations were constant companions during our stay.  Staff is very nice, in a corporate kind of way.  Say hello to the GM (Rosa) if you can.  She is great and will help you in any way she can.  Buffet is average.  Having a Walgreens next door is awesome!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is in great condition. It is relatively new so that helps. The water tastes awful, bring bottled! There is a 24 hour Walgreens in the same parking lot and a CVS across the street so that helps. Close to/walking distance from a lot of things which is nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked just one night here after not being able to get a kids bunk room at the Hyatt Regency Orange Garden down the road.  But this was a great option too!  They had a lovely pool.  The reception people were very friendly and helpful when our car battery was flat.  The breakfast that was included in the room rate was fantastic.  We would highly recommend this for a family stay - and very handy to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for family,  close to Disneyland
Summary: I highly recommend this family friendly, new, beautiful hotel for any family visiting Disneyland. The rooms were clean and comfortable.  The breakfast was plentiful and delicious.  The pool area was spotless and delightful (not to mention we had it to ourselves) and the staff was incredibly nice.  We will be coming back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This Hyatt House was excellent!  Within walking distance to Disneyland...literally across the street.  The staff is helpful and personable and everyone smiles there..from front desk, to housekeeping to maintenance!  The breakfast was great and the wait staff was also very helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights in October as a family of 4.  We stayed in a family suite on the 4th floor overlooking the front car park.  We arrived early and so our room was not ready, but they happily stored our luggage so we could explore Downtown Disney while we waited.  Check in was pleasant and efficient.  Our room was smaller than  i thought it would be.  It was nice, but to be honest felt a little too sterile and felt like we were staying in a private hospital room.  Don't get me wrong, i do like clean modern lines but it did not feel like a house as such.  The kids did love the bunk beds in there section and were happy with their own television.  Housekeeping was ok, one day they left there cleaning rag on the bed and subsequent days it just remained there.  We also had
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Left a lot to be desired
Summary: For being a new hotel (from what I'm told) the condition left a lot to be desired. The floor on which I stayed (5th) had a musky / moldy odor on my end of the floor. The deadbolt on my room did not work and my co-worked got locked out of his room when the door lock refused to read cards or open for the maintenance staff (took them nearly an hour to open his door). Also, a complete lack of any room service was disappointing, as well as not allowing delivery staff from a local restaurant to deliver food to my room (really inconvenient to settle in for the night and order food, just to have to go downstairs to pick it up myself). If you happen to leave something behind, be prepared to pay a minimum of $20 to have it sent back. Unfortunately I left a computer accessory in the room
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your recent stay with us. As in all select-service hotels, we do not have room service. We do feel that as a Hyatt House, we have many other amenities, such as complimentary breakfast and guestroom internet, that our guests enjoy. In regards to food delivery to your room from a local restaurant, we only provide access to our guestrooms floors for guests with a room key. This allows are guests the comfort of knowing that we take their security very seriously, even though at times it may limit access for non-guests. I would also like to take a moment to let you know that the $20 delivery cost for your mouse is based on the price given to us by the postal service used. We do not charge any extra on the price that is quoted to us. I truly appreciate your feedback regarding a musky odor. I have brought this to the attention of our engineering department.

Summary: I wish I could give this place more than 5 stars. The staff at Hyatt House went above and beyond during our 4 night stay. Let me begin by saying this was an anticipated family trip that had been planned for a while and we came across numerous obstacles from stomach viruses to flat tires and the kindness we received from the staff made it much easier to endure. Every staff member we came across during our stay greeted us and always asked if we needed anything. If we asked for more towels they were quick to respond and brought extra blankets asap. The breakfast was amazing and they had different varieties every day. One of the best continental breakfasts that I have experienced. The room was clean and large enough for my husband, mother in law, three children and myself. The
Manager Response: none

Summary: We call this our new home for Disneyland visits. We were greeted by Mytzia's welcoming smile. She was very professional and quick, answered our questions as well.   The parking is spacious and wide and very clean- this is the first thing I noticed as we approached the grounds of the hotel. Cleanliness is important when it comes to picking our main stay hotel. The room is such a delight, modern and spacious. Having a small kitchen is a plus. The breakfast is better than some we stayed in the past. The bathroom is wide and very very clean. There's a Walgreens on site and it's surrounded by places to eat. It's only a 10 minute walk to Disney..   We surely recommend this hotel and we will stay here when we visit Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Clean room and good housekeeping service. Breakfast food was average in quality and in variety.  Long rooms layout. Poor quality of amenities and extras -dispossable toothbrushes were sold at premium cost along with razors and such. Shampoo, conditioner and soap of poor quality/brand.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel - close to disneyland and convention center
Summary: I had a nice stay at Hyatt house hotel during a conference. Hotel staff is very alert and attentive. I was able to check in super early. Very nice room. Free daily  breakfast. 10 minutes walk to Convention center. Very close yo Disneyland. Nice pool and workout area. Large parking lot.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Hyatt House Anaheim for 2 night and we really liked this hotel. The check-in was fast & easy and the reception staff were very helpful. We had the King Bed Family Suite with bunk beds, excellent for a family of 4. My mother and sister stayed in the One Bedroom 2 Queen Kitchen suite. Both rooms were very spacious, fresh and modern.   They had a well equipped gym and the pool was great. This hotel offered free buffet breakfast with the room, we really liked the food and they had good fruit selections. Wifi was free (should be a standard with all hotels!) and the coin operated guest laundry was a major plus for us! Having Walgreen in the same building was very convenient.  A great place to stay when your going to Disneyland or just need somewhere to stay that is
Manager Response: none

Summary: More like an apartment than a hotel room! Full kitchen and dishes/cookware. Huge bathroom. Perfect location for convention center and Disneyland. Less than 15 minute walk to either. Breakfast was great.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Went for business trip. Very close to the Anaheim Convention Center and Disneyland. Breakfast was fantastic, had a lot of options. The family suite was nice and big, had a sectional to close off family room. Internet worked great, pool and sauna were great as well. Would recommend for anyone on a business trip or a family vacation!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have visited anaheim/Disneyland a few times and have tried a new hotel each time. Hyatt house was by far the best experience we have had. Room size was great, staff was friendly and location was perfect. Also pretty nice to have a Walgreens right below hotel. Definitely staying there next time
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'm a SoCal native, lived in Orange Country for 4 years, and have stayed in a few OC hotels. Here's my review:  The Location: Right on the corner of Katella and Harbor, you're literally a 5-7 minute walk to Disneyland/Downtown Disney, less than 5 to the Convention Center, and less than 5 in the other direction to the Garden Walk which has a ton of great restaurants. Right next door to a Walgreens and across the street is a Coffee Bean Tea Leaf. I mean seriously, the location alone is ridiculous.   The Property: The hotel itself is brand spanking new - it just opened the last week in July 2016, so it still has that "new car smell". It has a boutique hotel feel when you drive in, but it's deceiving because it's HUGE. I literally felt like I was at a Palm Springs or Vegas boutique
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here Oct-16 for a trip to Disneyland. It was perfect. The walk was about 15 minutes. The free hot breakfast every morning was excellent. It had a great variety: eggs, bacon, pancakes, pastries, oatmeal, fruit, cereal, etc. It was so convenient to grab breakfast and head to the park. Not sure if all the rooms are this way, but we only had a shower which can make it a little difficult to bathe small children. I would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: New and very modern hotel. Blackout shades are the best for this busy area. Only the very noisiest modified mufflers could be heard in the rooms on the street side of the hotel and this was only once. Kitchens are truly fully stocked. Pool area was wonderful and the down stairs walgreens has everything. Do not forget to bring something to B.B.Q.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I've traveled for decades on business and am accustomed to very nice lodging at my employer's expense because of their designated hotel preferences and negotiated price contracts.  But when it's on my dime I look for value and accept more "standardized" experiences.  Thus my expectation when I selected the Hyatt House (my first time staying at this brand) in Anaheim was modest. A friend and I were spending 3 days there in the midst of a 20-day rail journey, primarily to explore Disneyland and California Adventure.  We arrived way before check-in time and were warmly greeted by Jessalynn at the front desk. I work in the hospitality field and have a good sense when a face-to-face interaction is genuine or acting. This was all genuine.  We were checked in quickly though the room
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a really nice hotel near Disney (about a 15-20 minute walk with 4 year old).  We stayed in a family suite which was really nice. Separate room for the kids was a nice break for adults. Also had a microwave which allowed us to self cater.   Kids also enjoyed the pool on hot days.  Enjoyed breakfast.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a new Hyatt House in a great location for Disney or the convention center.  The rooms are very nice, I had a one bedroom suite which was very comfortable for 4 people and doable for 5.  It's pushing it with one bathroom if you have 5 women trying to get ready at the same time, but other than that, it was great.  The staff was excellent.  They are personable, they anticipate your needs, helpful and informative.  One of the ladies even helped me pin up my costume for Disney when my "gang" left before me.  We were celebrating my friends daughter's birthday at Disney, so we did not get a chance to eat or drink at the restaurant/bar, but it had a nice open ambiance.  I really WANTED to check it out.    I would stay there again in a hot second!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was really nice and it was actually closer to Disneyland than they described.  The rooms were very spacious and the staff was excellent.  My family and I would definitely book a room here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Finally a place you CAN call home!
Summary: This was such a great experience.  The entire staff worked diligently to know your name and treat you like their guest. .  I travel all around the world and stay at many hotels and this one rates as one of the best.  I'd go back with my family!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The layout is abysmal. One elevator bank for a building that size is not acceptable. The family suites are a 5 minute walk down an endless hall and around a corner. There is no alternate route or stairway access. The elevators are also constantly uncomfortably hot. They seem to absorb all the moisture and heat from the laundry facility in the garage. They do not smell good. The breakfast was somehow burnt and cold at the same time. It was disgusting all four mornings. Housekeeping does not clean. Dirty towels were hung as new, bed linens wer not changed. (Child wet the bed, they made the bed over the urine, even after I alerted them of the situation). Housekeeping will knock on your door at 8 am to ask if you're checking out, so don't count on sleeping in.  0/10.  I recommend
Manager Response: none

Summary: Got upgraded to a family suite although I'm alone. Everything is fine but I'm not used to USA minimalist hotel settings for which you have to prepare your own slippers, toothbrush and paste, etc. Good tho, green.   The complimentary breakfast is light, don't expect too much from it.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This place appealed because it was New
Summary: A great first impression on arrival at Hyatt House Anaheim, with a friendly and efficient check-in. Our request for a quiet room, after a long flight, was available or we had the option of a room facing the main road towards DL park. Loved having the partition doors through to the bunk beds and also a nice seating area large enough for the whole family; next time we might choose a  different room configuration due to the air conditioning outlet being directed straight onto the pillow end of the bunk beds, which meant we had to turned it off at night, being the reason  giving this a 4 and not a 5.   Apart from that, the bed was comfortable, there were multiple USB points for charging devices. A relatively easy walk to DL although if a shuttle was available we would have used it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was perfect for our family vacation at Disney as it was just a short walk to the theme parks.  The room was beautiful... clean and new with a well stocked kitchenette. The free morning buffet was a fantastic way to fuel up for the long days at the park.  The staff was friendly and helpful throughout our stay! Can't wait to go back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: A newer opened hotel that is closed to Disneyland. You can walk to the park. The hotel is very family friendly room designed. Laundry is super convenient for family who has kid. High quality  and d=service level that meet what we expected from Hyatt.
Manager Response: none

Summary: New accommodations. Minor inconveniences with the design of the building, door swings, furniture layout,.... not like a typical hotel room. It has a European feel. Hotel staff and housekeeping  needs to shake out the service operation as TV and Wifi was down for two of the seven day stay making business difficult to conduct from the room. Parking is convenient but expensive at $17 per day. Staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast bar is very good.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed for a quick staycation and Disneyland visit (we're passholders). Though we were only there overnight, the staff and accomodations were very cozy and welcoming. The fact that Walgreens was a few steps away made it even more convenient. The room/bed was so comfortable and perfect after a long day at Disneyland. The breakfast was delicious and they offer many choices.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is brand new and very nicely appointed. The lobby area is bright and spacious with coolers of ice water just inside the doors. Staff is very friendly and welcoming. My son loved the pool. We stayed in a small suite with a complete kitchen and a separate bedroom with two queens. The room was quite nice and spacious. Lot of plugs for charging our electronics and a comfy seating area. The free breakfast is not bad although nothing special. They seemed to have a hard time keeping food, silverware and napkins stocked on a busy weekend morning. Housekeeping could use some improvement. Our room didn't get serviced at all one day even though we were away at the Disney parks for hours. We came back around 10 and wanted showers before bed, but had to call for towels. Other than
Manager Response: I want to thank you for letting us know about the issues with housekeeping that occurred during your stay with us and I apologize for the inconvenience. At times, the weekends can be rather busy and our staff works very hard at keeping everything stocked for our guests. There is always room for improvement, which I will be sure to discuss with our Food & Beverage team.

Summary: This hotel is great! It's an easy and short walk to Disneyland and Anaheim Gardenwalk for families. The hotel is brand new and well kept and the hotel staff is super friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean, spacious, and comfortable. And the hotel offers a fresh breakfast buffet each day, which is an awesome perk to take advantage of before you head out for the day. We highly recommend it!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel With Poor Customer Service
Summary: This is a new hotel. The room was nice, and the breakfast buffet was well done. However, the TV never worked. Other residents were offered a discount due to this problem, but I was not. The front desk staff was indifferent to any problems I had. After two days, I moved to the Residence Inn across the street, which is MUCH nicer. I would not stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our room was nice with a fully stocked kitchenette. The room was spacious and everything was new looking and in good shape at the hotel. The breakfast is phenomenal. It was unfortunate there was no TV channels available due to some hotel wide outage that seemed odd for two days. That is why I could not provide a five star rating.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and feedback. I apologize for the unfortunate outage with the TV. Direct TV is our provider, and for some reason they accidently cut the service connection. It was quite frustrating for the hotel in getting a Direct TV representative out to the hotel to fix the issue. Unfortunately, this impacted our guests and the hotel was disappointed that we could not rectify the situation immediately to allow our guests to enjoy the hotel amenities.

Summary: We stayed 7 nights late September/early October and had a good stay. We had a 2 x queen bed room with a sofa bed. Our 16 year old son slept on the soda bed which he said was ok. Lots of tv channels but disappointed that we couldn't watch the AFL grand final as that was a paid channel that wasn't subscribed to :( We could see the fireworks at Disney from our window which was great.Walking to the parks was easy. Loved the Walgreens directly underneath the hotel and a CVS on the opposite side of the road as well as a 7 Eleven and another supermarket/variety store close by too. Note that Walgreens stocks most of everything including alcohol which was very handy.iHop is almost right next door.We enjoyed a few meals at the nearby Anaheim Garden Walk that has a variety of eateries too.
Manager Response: none
